entries.title: A.L.O.N.E: Always Lonely on Newyear's Eve
entries.description:
I'm just going to be straight with you: This is a text based game.

This year I wanted to give myself a bigger challenge than just throwing together a simple flash game like I've done in previous years, so I decided to learn Inform7 this weekend, and now you get to play the result.

This game has multiple endings, so you might want to play though it a few times.

If you've never played a text based adventure game before, here are some basic guidelines:

Commands are generally phrased as "verb noun", in the simplest way possible (so, "take phone" or "go north" instead of "pick up the cell phone on the end table" or "walk to the north")

Pay close attention to the descriptions of the rooms (the few paragraphs after the bold name of a room when you first enter) Sometimes the description of a room will change based on what you do there. You can see the description of the room you're currently in at any type by typing "look"

You can "look at" and "look under" anything named in the room description. Usually you don't have to type out the full name of the thing, so "look at drawers" is the same as "look at chest of drawers" You can also "take", "drop", "throw", "wear", "take off", "turn on", "turn off", "open" or "eat" some things you find.


If you're stuck, please post a comment here and I'll give out some hints. If you're REALLY stuck, there is solution link that contains the solutions for two of the many endings.

entries.title: ESS: Escape the space station
entries.description:
This is my first attempt at ever making a game, spent about 10 hours at it. Build with PyGame. Some art is unfinished.

How to play

Run "run me.exe" or use the source. Then press X to jump and that's it.

Story

You are left alone on a space station that is crashing into the moon.  The gravity generator has been damaged so you need to run uphill and jump over boxes that are in the way, in the narrow corridor leading to the escape pods.
Make your escape.

entries.title: Lucide Solitude
entries.description:
The idea behind Lucid Solitude is to put the fear of being alone into a video game.  Specifically, the fear of being alone in a particularly scary dream into a video game.  Your goal is to collect all of the orbs before your fear overcomes your will to wake up.

Use WASD to move.

*This game is based largely on sound.  It does get louder as you progress, so if it's hard to hear at the beginning, don't turn your speakers up so much right away.

entries.title: Minotaurus
entries.description:
Hey ! This is my game, "The Minotaurus Maze"...
Are you able to survive Alone in this terrible labyrinth ?

Ahahah...

This Game is a multiplayer web browser game.
Need a recent web navigator to play.

[HTML/CSS/PHP/JS/SQL/Gimp/JQuery]
[Powered by MySQL and Lighttpd servers]

Enjoy it !

Lesterpig.

Edit : The players are redirected in instances of a huge maze (14 players by instance). Each Maze is different... and have more than 1000 rooms !

I hope you will quickly find an other player but it's really hard... Maybe the Maze is too... big ? :P

To chat, you need a "Walkie-Talkie" which can be found in the floor.

You WILL die. But when ? That's the question...
Just try to kill many monsters before your death, or explore the Maze to find an other people who is alone, like you...

Yeah, this Game is not completed... But I'm very proud of it, 'cause I'm just a teen (16 Years Old hehe)...

The Maze generator, written in the 48 hours, can be found in the source (include/laby.php).

-- HIGH SCORE (31/12/2011) --
>> 92 points <<

entries.title: Sokobot

entries.title: Solitude-76
entries.description:
About the game:
Its the future, the Soviet Union has just been nuked by the USA and they have bombers patrolling the area to thwart the move of dead hand...

However, dead hand will not activate: a single member of the former USSR survives deep under UVB-76: Kernel Kitten!

You must take control of Dead Hands resources and automated assembly machines that survived, build a defense and offense network to erradicate the american threat and take back the world - will you succeed?

 

Note: the background 'music' is a record sample of UVB-76 itself and the sounds were made with the aid of sfxr/bfxr... enjoy.

Warning: Fans of Wargames - the movie - I know its similar and its not accurate but hey, this is the soviet version. Cut down to fit inside  an LD48!

Controls are ecxplained on the startup screen! Screen resolution > 1024x700 will be needed. Good luck - I will be updating the file to easier gameplay due to some bad early feedback saying it can, at times, be 'unwinneable' Oo

entries.title: The Knock
entries.description:
DISCLAIMER: If you are looking for a platformer/arcade game, nothing to see here. If you want a game that challenge your ability to solve puzzles and riddles, with a dark atmosphere and a bizarre story, you are welcome!

A unique experience about loneliness, with a surprising ending. Based in the shortest short-story ever written by Fredric Brown, The Knock features a sliding puzzle, a "cutscene", one character, and requires lots of thinking and observation.

You control a headless person, using the keyboard to move and mouse to click. It's your classic escape-the-room/point-to-click with a twist, in that the last element you need to find is outside the game, as the tip already mentioned.

Please report any bug/problem, but don't write spoilers. This is one of those game that if you know how to solve it before playing, it gets boring.

NOTE: Here's the last tip which you will need to finish the game: "The last syllable is found in the periodic table."

entries.title: Alone
entries.description: I wouldn't exactly call this game fun, but please read along with the story and see where I was going with this.  If I had more time I think this could have been quite a well done game.  Also this is my second Ludum Dare, and also my second Ludum Dare without using a pre-built physics engine.  I feel that if I didn't spend all my time on the physics, I could have worked more on the animations and the combat.

entries.title: Alone in a Window : A 9 Hour Hack
entries.description:
Instructions are provided in-game.
Please pay attention to the command prompt.

I apologize for the lack of polish: this was mostly made in the last 9 hours of the jam, with new tools and a crazy idea.

Had fun doing it though and I hope you enjoy it!

The game was made using Python and Pyglet.
I also used one file, a camera class, from: http://tartley.com/files/stretching_pyglets_wings/


If you have any question or issues, please feel free to contact me on Twitter @sagzorz

Thanks,
Sagar

Edit: Thanks Brendan for noticing the crash! I tried it on my laptop today, at it seem to be caused by the use of an integrated graphics card (commonly in laptops)
I've changed a few lines in the code, and this should get rid of the crash bug.

You can view the changes, as well the entire code at:
https://github.com/SagarPatel/LudumDare22

Please let me know if you encounter crashes.
If you experience bad performance, I apologize, I did things with the framework that are probably not meant to be done , + it was hacked up in about 9 hours + first time with framework.

Edit 2: It seems someone else also experience a crash, so I've reduced a parameter, hopefully it will be easier to run on slower systems.

If you experiences crashes or strange behaviors, please post your specs, it will help me a lot in fixing the issues.
You can leave it in the comments or tweet me @sagzorz


Edit 3: More bug fixes. Man I must have been brain dead when I submitted the game...

entries.title: Alone In Space
entries.description:

"Alone In Space" is built using "Processing".  All of the source in Processing is available with each download or the web applet.

entries.title: Grief
entries.description:
My name is Jack, I'm 18 and my brother Sam is 17. We developed Grief.

Grief is an experimental game about loss - the time constraints were difficult but I think that me and my brother managed to get the right feel into it. The game focuses mainly on the stages of grief surrounding a major change in life.

There are two executables available (Mac/PC). Tell us what you think and please vote for us!

Cheers

Jack and Sam

entries.title: Hyper Alone (Totally not helpless)
entries.description:
“Alone doesn’t necessarily mean helpless.” is my interpretation.

My game is loosely titled “Hyper Alone”.

This is a game where you are a super soldier so strong that people think you are actually a group of people. Hyper speed, insane accuracy and flawless melee skills. These are all hard to control for a player in real time so the game boasts a plannification system where the whole world pauses just so the player can decide of its next actions.

I did the kitten challenge. Bonus midi metal music and credits screen only if you find it.

entries.title: Leave Me Alone
entries.description:
Description:
"Leave Me Alone" is a fast-paced platforming game where you must run from the demons chasing you. As you explore the space, collect fragments of yourself and escape the demons forever.

With the theme, "Alone", I decided go with the desire to be alone. To escape the clutches of others or to run away from your own inner demons. My dare entry, "Leave Me Alone", takes this idea and runs with it, literally.  

Don't give up if you lose.  You don't have to recollect fragments you've already picked up. Try different routes.

A Post-Dare version with music can be found here:
http://vuha.carbonmade.com/projects/4074974

How to play:
WASD or arrow keys to move
space to jump

Programming:
ActionScript3
FlashDevelop
Flixel
TweenMax

Art:
Photoshop CS4
Graphics Gale

Sounds:
as3sfxr

entries.title: Metamorphosis

Reference: http://records.viu.ca/~johnstoi/stories/kafka-e.htm

entries.title: Project Robert Sean
entries.description:
You are stranded on a deserted island. You have no idea how you got there. Luckily, you have your three items you'd take on a deserted island with you.


Needs LOVE to run. I only tested the game with the latest development version (of which you can get the latest versions at [1],[2],[3] and [4]), but it should run just fine with LOVE 0.7.2, downloadable here: http://love2d.org/.

The game explains itself once running, but here are the controls for the start screen:

Up/Down, W/S - Cycle selection
Space, e - Select item if not on list, unselect otherwise
Return - Start, if three items selected


Sourcecode:
You can get the source code by renaming the file to .zip and unpacking it.


[1] LOVE 0.8 development windows build: http://love2d.org/builds/love-20111218-e54452ae846e-win-x86-default.zip
[2] LOVE 0.8 development Mac build: (DROPBOX WARNING!) http://dl.dropbox.com/u/4214717/love-0.8.0.zip
[3] LOVE 0.8 PPA: https://launchpad.net/~bartbes/+archive/love-unstable
[4] Sourcecode: https://bitbucket.org/rude/love/issues

Edit: Fixed the URL (added a missing http:// and 't').
Edit2: Added Windows/OSX packages.

entries.title: Too late but (almost) finished

But I had an idea, and I wished to try, whatever the result will be.
So, here I am, I just finished, out of time for the standard competition, but I finished - and, trust me, it's a really big surprise for me.

For this, I mainly used :

- The Gimp
- Construct 2 (http://www.scirra.com/)

Tested on Chrome and Firefox (under Windows XP), needs HTML5.



Oh, and before I send this (and - at least ! - going to sleep), I have to say : I'm french, I'm not very good in english, so forgive me if you don't understand something. In this comment, or in the game. Sorry for that.


Edit : Uploaded version was the wrong one. Mistake corrected.
Edit 2 : Not detected "finish" flag bug fixed. This time is the last one. I hope.

entries.title: A Gravekeeper
entries.description:
My entry's about a Gravekeeper who enters a crypt one night after hearing stories about a treasure inside.

I worked on this for probably about 8-10 hours overall, and a good portion of that was swapping between ideas. I focused on the art first, then worked on the game itself. It's unfortunate that I couldn't have done much more in terms of gameplay, but at least it looks like I imagined! Unfortunately, there's no sound and it's rather short, but it was still a lot of fun making it. I didn't really have enough time, between sleep, going out for dinner, my Mom's birthday party, and Christmas shopping.

It's WAY too short, with not much gameplay, but whatever, 8 hours of work from the engine up, so, yeah.

Programmed in C++ using SFML2, all assets done in Paint.NET and I think I might've used GIMP at one point. The levels were made in Tiled to save time.

Source is available here: http://deljam.net/projects/grave_src.zip

..but I'm begging you not to look at it.

entries.title: Dying Alone
entries.description:
I think it turned out pretty okay!

Here's what changes I think it needs most:
1) The meteors need to be more fair in how dodgeable they are. Also, I think they might completely disappear for a little while sometimes.
2) Add checkpoint(s). At least one after you return the first engine.
3) Make better music. Because, you know, it's pretty bad.
4) Make a better title.

There’s a little old lady who lives all alone,
her husband died a few years ago.

Her only friend a cat named pat,
Not wanting to see her sad.

Must find her a gift before this night,

For if he fails to reach his goal,

And maybe that God is you.

entries.title: Alone in the Gloom
entries.description: It is the dawn of the 20th century. A Cambridge scholar and explorer has led a team to the depths of the South American jungle to investigate a newly discovered temple complex claimed to predate the Olmec by several centuries, showing evidence of stonework thought beyond the capabilities of preclassical Mesoamerican masonry. As they begin to explore the strange temple, our professor accidentally falls into a pit and is separated from the group. All alone, he must find his way back to the surface, and maybe score some fascinating pieces of research data while he is at it...

If you find any errors (Spelling, grammar or just bugs), please report them to [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */!

We also plan to include download links for both Mac and Windows once we've had a rest!

entries.title: Expecting a Call

entries.title: Inkompleet Shootiefing

[Netbook users - stay away! - this is GPU-accelerated Flash!]

It's the first Flash game I've made, and even after a fair bit of preparation, I was too ambitious. Was supposed to be a twin-stick shooter (mouse and WASD), but is somewhat short on content!

I wasn't able to spend all day on Mon to finish it off, so it's still very unfinished - but I'm very happy with the progress I made, and it shows that it's possible to do some really nice high-performance 2D with Stage3D.

I'm hoping to finish this off eventually, maybe get it up on a Flash portal somewhere

entries.title: Lava Run
entries.description: first game, functionable but not great XD

entries.title: Lost in the Woods
entries.description:
*NOTE* I quickly added a web link. All it is is the normal game with an applet wrapper. There are options to quit the game which will not do anything in the applet version.

*NOTE2* I have added what would have been the instructions screen to the pictures for the entry. Hopefully that can help people figure out what is going on.

You are lost in the woods.  You aren't sure how you got here or where anyone else is, but you have to find your way home soon.

Sort of in the vain of old point and click adventures, but without the clicking (doesn't use the mouse).  Find, combine, and use items to solve simple puzzles.

I don't think it was explained very well (meant to put in a tutorial) but you enter areas by walking off the screen or by pressing the <ACTION> key at an entrance (path leading up or a door).  The <ACTION> key is also used to pickup/use items, but only if the item can be used. I didn't make things obvious because it is supposed to be a puzzle, but I feel I may have made what to do/how to do it a little too obscure.

The idea behind this is that the player is completely alone. No enemies, no allies, no one except the player and the environment.

I was more than half way through making the game when I realized I have no way to recovering if I die.  I was unable to come up with a system that didn't completely re-define my action system. Sorry, but if you die you have to start all over, but if you know what you are doing it only takes a couple minutes.

entries.title: Mischief!
entries.description:
Firstly, thanks for visiting my submission. I'll tell you now: it's incomplete. There's no sound for starters, but that is I *think* the only glaring omission. It should play fine, if a little 'empty'.

(yay the website is working again) My original plans for this were to have multiple rooms with bonuses to speed and assorted other effects that could help you shred your living environment. The source contains a lot of work toward this, but the ever-looming deadline forced me to make a decision. One room it it is.

I'm not sure what to think of the 'Alone' theme. On the one hand it's very open to interpretation (including a favourite I learn: "a loan") which encourages ideas, but on the other hand it's somewhat...uninspiring. I guess I like my themes narrowed down a little. And with guns!

entries.title: Mom?
entries.description:
You're on a shopping trip with your Mom, but you run the risk of getting lost because of all of the distractions. Don't get left alone!

Because of some Canvas performance issues in Firefox, it works best in Chrome. May also work in IE9, but untested.

Source can be found here: https://github.com/doowttam/Lost-Mom

Game developed by Jose Eduardo Teran, Marco Javier and Zaira Amanda. We were in different locations while deving.

Pop up the bubbles to free the hearts and make sure they hit Mr. Freevil.

entries.title: needle in a hay stack
entries.description: not finished just found out about this contest in the last 4 hours XD did what i could which isnt much but at least i tried

entries.title: Not/Alone
entries.description:
Not/Alone is loosely based around the idea of running from your fears. Though you can't see them, they're still there...

Controls:
W/Up - Move up
A/Left - Move left
S/Down - Move down
D/Right - Move right

Collect the green blocks while avoiding the white. Collecting a green block will destroy half of the white blocks chasing you down and gain you 1 point.

While in the light world, the white blocks do you no harm and cannot move. Use this as a chance to escape certain doom.

The worlds alternate automatically - 4 seconds in the light followed by 6 seconds of darkness, each switch bringing more enemies your way. Keep collecting green blocks to keep their numbers in check.

entries.title: RGB
entries.description:
RGB (Red Green Blue) is a game which aims to show how even using a small amount of art assets a game is possible within 48 hours.

The aim of the game is to rescue your blue friends, whilst avoiding the red swarming madness.

entries.title: Sanity
entries.description:
Created for the 22nd Ludum Dare Jam by shard123 and qwezc. 
Theme: ALONE   

You've committed a crime and are serving out the rest of your life in solitary confinement. You know that you deserve this punishment and serve it gladly. The years in here have lost you you're sanity. You've lost your grip on reality and have slipped into a realm of twisted nightmares with only one thought in your mind, ending the insanity once and for all.

Controls:
Use the arrow keys to move and jump. Press and hold X first to draw your gun, then press spacebar to shoot. Use R to reload.

A lot of the artwork was hand drawn and everything except one of the sound effects was made from scratch so that didn't leave us much time for game play. Also, we're pretty inexperienced at making platform games, this is pretty much our first one that's actually bearable to play! 

Tips:
Sanity is a pretty hard game so here are a few tips to help you if you get stuck:

*You don't have to hit an enemy with your bullets dead on to  kill them...

*Stuck on the platforming segments? Try running and then jumping

*Can't figure out how to beat the boss? Think outside the box a little ;)

entries.title: Solitude - xandrew
entries.description:
== Solitude ==
Submission by xandrew

Executable: Solitude.jar

****
Note:
If you can't run it can you leave a comment please? I'm not the best deployer ;)
**** 

HOW TO PLAY

You are a small guy who needs to escape from this place he is in (Great story, huh?). Lasers are set around the map and there is a portal somewhere that allows you get out. The portal must be powered for you to leave.

Using the WSAD keys you need to move around and discover where to go. When coming across a laser you need to either point it (use ARROW keys to direct laser) at the portal to activate it or direct it to another laser turret to power that and get to the portal that way. You will most likely need to direct lasers at multiple light turrets around the level to create a chain that can reach the portal.

Select the level from the drop down list at the top and click Play - you will be launched into the astonishing world that is SOLITUDE.

-------------------------------------------

ABOUT

Created for the Ludum Dare Compo #22
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/

By xandrew
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/xandrew/

With this being my first Ludum Dare â�� I was thinking Iâ��ll just use this as a learning experience to discover what I need to do BEFORE the next one. And it has been a VERY big learning experience. Also might enter the Jam next time and get a few people in and make a party of it. Because my lack of creativity and ideas started to show about halfway though.

Can obtain the source here:
https://github.com/andrew-smith

(Yes I know - my menu design is terrible)

entries.title: Space Ghost
entries.description:
A little Matlab-esque shooter. I guess it is vaguely to do with the theme since you're alone ... with a ghost ... in space.  Also, there's a kitten!

The game uses hand-written Javascript/HTML5 and isn't obfuscated and doesn't rely on any third party libraries. You can view-source on the HTML document and it should be fairly obvious where the code is. The graphics were generated using a project I wrote a while ago, BatchSVG (Google it if you're interested) and just straight rendering of Javascript primitives. Sounds using SFXR.

In hindsight, a game using similar mechanics, but on a simulated mini-golf course would have been both a better fit for the theme (alone: no enemies) and probably a better game. Ah well, if there's enough interest in this I might look into it.

entries.title: The Invention of Colour
entries.description:
"The Invention of Colour" 

This is interactive storytelling. It doesn't play like a traditional game. You'll follow "Alrion" through his quest to find "shimmers" as he doesn't know what colours are. I aimed to create something that is engrossing and takes the player on a journey. Just enjoy not having to do much and expect a few minutes of atmospheric storytelling. It's intentional low level involvement.

There are two ways (literally) to finish the game. Just keep going.

Hope you enjoy this little trippy & eerie plunge into the heart of a bizarre world.

PLEASE NOTE: This experience requires AUDIO (best enjoyed with headphones), otherwise the game will not make sense. Controls are also explained in-game: just use the arrow keys to walk around. This should run on Windows, Mac & Linux. The only thing you need is a JAVA runtime.

Oh and yes. There is a kitten in the game.

Made with libgdx, reaper & gimp.

UPDATE: Added a complete walk-through video of the game. If for whatever reason you can't play the game this should give you a fairly accurate impression of the experience!

entries.title: We Are Alone
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry =D

Explore a (randomly generated) frosty mountain, try to stay alive before you die of exposure and try to find a way off the mountain.  

If/when you die, you resume as a different character on the same mountain, but with the footsteps of your past attempts it can become easier with each try.

*edit*
Seems I totally forgot to mention in the readme that sfxR was used to create sound effects.  My bad, sorry!

*edit*
Gameplay and timelapse video, the timelapse segment at the end contains spoilers, also shows me wasting time watching youtube videos wheee: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=470se-5AP7o

entries.title: A form of monotheism
entries.description:
*******************************
* youtube: http://youtu.be/8Dke0vWPwL8
*******************************

I'll have a lot to write about this game in the postmortem. Meanwhile:

Alone, we are all essentially alone, a single deity is also alone, but that's not the kind of alone this game is about. This game is about depraved violent little beings which kill other depraved violent little beings because the color under their feet is different, regardless of species or gender. This way they and those like them can be alone on the (rather flat) world.

Your job? To help them kill. Which beings? Your choice. You have equal control over all of them. Pick your favorites and pave the road with the skulls of your enemies. 

There are a number of achievements, and you can consider the game 'won' if you get any of them.
- Have one single species left on the map (4 species, 4 achievements)
- Have a single creature left on the map (one achievement for either gender)
- Have one of each species left

I look forward to hearing from you on this game.

NOW ON THE CHROME WEB STORE: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/lmkbojccjjlficidfnpkgehomippmfgi

entries.title: Alone- The search for home.
entries.description:
You are alone in space and you have to find your way home..

I've always loved open world games and that's what I wanted to give what I was designing this game.

The Idea is that you  have been stranded in a unknown area of the universe and you have to go and find your way home by doing tasks for alien planets, all the while defending yourself from the hostile forces around you.. I had also planned to give a spore type trading/mining system and this was partially implemented but I gave up with that as it was way to much work for the amount of time I had left.

Currently I have implemented a few quests, a quest log and planetary trading systems. (black hole warping is also included :D)

It is also worth nothing that all planetary positions/names are randomly placed each time you load a new game. You should also know that when trading items that all shops differ in price, sometimes greatly.. 

Controls:
W to go forward,
S to go backward,
Q to zoom out,
E to zoom in

Mouse to steer,

Mouse left click to interact,
Mouse right click to shoot.

System Requirements:
Windows 7, Windows Xp with .net framework 4.0 installed
xna framework 4.0 installed (Have you played Terraria? Yes? Then you have the xna framework).

**No disclaimer, there really is a cat!***

entries.title: Station 7
entries.description:
In this adventure/puzzle game, explore the seemingly abandoned Station 7, and try to find a way out. Build various devices from spare parts, and try to navigate the abandoned corridors.

Controls:
-	Click the ground to move
-	Bump into objects to interact with them
-	Click items in your inventory for info
-	Click items again to activate

The desktop version of this game requires a recent JRE to be installed. If you do not have one, go to www.java.com.

The Android version is experimental, and will only work on recent phones or tablets. Note that you must have "Unknown Sources" checked in Android settings in order to install it.

There is also a complete walkthrough available here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/27662833/station7_walkthrough.txt

entries.title: The Unfortunate State of Being Alone

I haven't had too much time to test this, so I will be working on fixing bugs after submission and will merge the show stoppers into the compo entry.

==== FIXED the issue with getting stuck on the second floor=====
==== FIXED linking to the incorrect game =======

WASD to move around
Space to interact
Mouse to click empty word area
Keyboard to enter text

After you meet the janitor, you can solve the word puzzles in each apartment unit.  Each apartment unit has a series of interactable items that tell a small story.  Each story has or relates to the missing words in the room.

I apologize if you don't like the music.  I'm new to piano.. and just played what came to mind during the last 10 minutes of the compo. :)

==================Spoiler================

The first puzzle is .. much harder than it should be.  The answers for this room are "dies" and "believe". 

Unfortunately, I ran out of time and didn't get to go back to this puzzle to flesh it out a bit more.

entries.title: YAE! You Against Everyone
entries.description:
A classic beat'em up (or what you might call it)

It is supposed to feature some kind of magical "star"-force, which I didn't have time to implement properly.

Currently, the star force just heals you when releasing 'c'.
When I improve the game I will change the star force so that you can use it to improve your abilities and/or send away a ball of fire or something similar. You decide yourself what to use it for.

Also, some of the libraries in the source code are not used such as the matrix algebra and tesselation libs.

Good luck! It is unfortunately extremely difficult to beat this game. 

The improved version is available here: springworldgames.com/yae 
(Important: Not the competition entry)

It is less difficult and more features will be added there.

entries.title: Zombie City
entries.description:
Here is my first entry on the Ludum Dare

Zombie city is a small game where you must reach the exit of a quarantine city, your only goal is to reach the exit door but there are a lot of zombies to kill and dodge.

have fun!

Jump - Space
Shoot - Left Mouse button

entries.title: A Lone Story
entries.description:
You get to follow Lone, the main character who finds himself all alone in the world. He starts a journey to find out what has happened and why all the people are gone.

Navigate menus with arrow keys and Enter to select.
Default in-game controls are (changeable in Settings menu):
Left - A
Right - D
Jump - Space

You can set the difficulty in the Settings menu if you find the game too easy/hard.

Notes:
Linux version requires Qt4, SDL and SDL_Mixer.

entries.description: A.L.O.N.E.-A Lightweight Operating Nano Excavator is a top-down evasision game were you controll a robot and the objective is to reach the portals at the end of each level.This is my first Ludum Dare and I starting learning javaa in September so sorry for sometimes sketchy code. Some platformer-puzzle thingie, only keyboard

entries.title: Alone in the Dark
entries.description:
This is a failed LD attempt. This was meant to be a survival game.

You don't know where you are, you have nothing but the light of a camp fire to see and a stick to defend yourself.

Controls are WASD to move, space to swing.
(Nothing happens after killing that first snake)

entries.title: Alone with myself

In order to play your browser must support HTML5 (chrome,firefox)

thanks for playing,
and hurry to escape from yourself !!

entries.title: Alone With Your Thoughts
entries.description:
OVERVIEW:

The original idea behind this game was that you'd be able to roam around an environment, collecting objects from which you'd gain their letters. You'd then be able to use these as a means to further interact with the environment (opening doors, story elements, etc). Unfortunately, that was slightly out-of-scope, so the concept has been reduced to this platformer.

INSTRUCTIONS:

Collect the letters in the red chests and use them against enemies by which correspond to the 'keyword' above them. Enemies are as strong as the length of their keyword, though you can use the same (if you find several) letters multiple times.

CONTROLS:

UP/LEFT/RIGHT - Move & Jump.
SPACE - Interact.
A-Z - Use letters. (Enemies must be on-screen).

NOTES:

- There's not much visual feedback, sorry.
- I was meaning to implement Scrabble-like scores for each letter, but whilst writing this I realised I'd forgotten.

Adventure and explore in the strange land of Arzea.

Arkeus (@arkeus)
http://iarke.us

entries.title: Balloon
entries.description:
Arrows to move, space to jump.
Try to find your friend in the levels.

The things which look like big fans make you float, boxes with a '!' in them are like mushrooms in Super Mario.

The last level is VERY hard.

entries.title: Depressive
entries.description:
This is about a guy being depressive and wanting to push them back of its *vital* zone.

Cosplay costume increases the range.
Megaphone increases your voice energy.

TUTORIAL.png for the tutorial.

That's unfortunately unfinished, and totally unbalanced.

entries.title: Ennui
entries.description:
Battle self doubt and the turmoil of existential crisis to overcome the banal and the asinine. Press X to ponder the bleakness of existence.

I took 'Alone' to mean sadness and made a Philosophy-em-up. Enemies are mere bystanders who shout meaningless drivel at you, which drives you to self-doubt. The more doubt you have, the more you fall into depression, represented by a parallel world. To overcome the trials of the real world though you must face doubt and uncertainty.

Basically there are two levels overlaid on top of each other, and they are blended together based on the damage you have taken. You must take at least some damage to be able to walk through the 'happy' terrain and on the 'sad' terrain, but if you take too much you'll die. To complete the level you have the pick up a maguffin (the bit of paper lodged in the side of the hill).

I kind of liked to concept, but ran out of time, as usual. Consequently there is only one level. I spent my last couple of hours polishing the graphics, which came out rather nicely, I think.

I used Flashpunk and Flash Builder for code. The art was done with the Gimp and a cheap graphics tablet. The sounds effects were made in Sfxr and the dreadful music using Wolfram Tones. You can press M to mute the god-awful music!

entries.title: Erasum
entries.description:
Hello everyone!

My first Ludum Dare entry and I really enjoyed creating the game. I hope you enjoy playing it as much as I have creating it!

Instructions:

Download and Install the XNA Redist first, it's an XNA game!

Controls:

WASD/Arrow Keys = Movement
Space/W/Arrow up = Jump
Escape = Menu

Proper journal link: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/Wompus/

entries.title: Furever Alone
entries.description:
Old Man Smitty has been very lonely ever since Mavis left him for that young car insurance salesman.

There's an empty hole in Smitty's heart, an empty seat 
on the couch and Matlock starts in one minute.

Only one thing can fix this. Cats, hundreds of cats.
Go! Smitty deserves no less.

(Oh, by the way - I'd love it if people posted their scores in the comments. Am really curious how high is possible),

entries.title: Incomitat
entries.description:
Incomitat was made in a huge hurry, but I'm quite proud of it.

There's no real 'point' in the game, you can explore the island and try to figure out why you're alone. There's a boss in the game, try to find it!

CONTROLS:
WSAD - movement
Left mouse button - action
E - drop your active item
Q - open full inventory (you can move stuff around here)
Space - view map

You can use the mousewheel and number buttons to cycle between your active items. Use Q to switch item slots.

entries.title: Kitty Box
entries.description:
you play as a kitty in a box, but will he be adopted?

controls: arrow keys

entries.title: Lil' Zombies
entries.description:
Welcome to Lil' Zombies. The 2D sidescroller that will melt your mind. If you can get pass round 5 you deserve some major internet cupcakes!

Controls:
Arrow keys/WASD - Move
Space - Shoot

Lil' Zombies was made by me (Erik Sundqvist) and Kane Waltman.

entries.title: Lost in Space
entries.description: You must fix you space ship after a battle by completing minigames. For it to run properly, be sure to extract it from the zip.

entries.title: My Own Universe
entries.description:
"In a normal day, of a normal life, you go ot to do some shopping. Something blocks your way, so you go back. But something happens, something really strange, and ypu decide to investigate."

The game is not entirely finished. I don't think it can be even called a game, as you can only win (or, well, lose).

This started as a good idea in my head. I slowly realized I culdn't finish it on 48h. Then I started to feel unmotivated, tired, and finished this in a hurry.

At least I gave it a story, and what got into the game is complete.

*** WARNING :: If the applet doesn't work, please try the Binary (downloadable) version. You *HAVE* to uncompress it, then run the JAR. ***

entries.title: Not Quite Alone
entries.description:
IF IT DOESN'T RUN, GO HERE: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

***HOW TO PLAY***
Press Q on an available space to build a robot(turret).
Press W to build rocket ship parts.
Both of these actions require one part each.
If wall health reaches 0, you lose.
If you build 20 rocket parts, you win.
You may only build turrets when there are no zombies on the map.
You may only build turrets in a position that does not block the zombies route to the end.
Press M to pause/play music.
***HOW TO PLAY***
***STORY***
You are Liam Mith, an engineer. Your goal is to escape Post-Apocalyptic Earth via a rocket. You must balance building of defenses with the building of your rocket, as the zombies *will* overrun you. Sooner than later.
Liam Mith is, as far as he knows, the last person alive in the world. Any communications by radio ceased about 2 years ago, when the Virus hit. The year is 2047, and the world is much different than now. Technology had made absolutely incredible advances. We were on Mars, we were traveling throughout the the solar system to gather materials. Most governments across the world had crumpled, and people did as they pleased. They used their will to shape the world around them, not other people. It was a golden age.

Unfortunately, progress sometimes has side-effects. The entire world was connected electronically. Everyone wore an iEye (pronounced eye),  a contact lens that had the power of todays supercomputers thanks to Quantum Computing. Everything, even your toilet, was wired for network access.

Then the Sun, like it does, screwed everything up when it decided to emit a solar flare so massive it consumed Mercury entirely. The resulting wave of electromagnetic energy had an odd effect, because of the safeguards we had put in place against it to protect our precious electronics. Near instantaneously, every person who was wearing their iEye went abso-freaking-lutely insane. The massive radiation had caused instant cancer in nearly every place of the body, and fried certain parts of the iEye programming. The effects varied pretty widely, but one thing was constant: insanity.

Our current concept of Zombies does not cover what happened to these people. Image what would happen if every cell in your body simultaneously went through a period of such rapid uncontrolled growth, that you went from standing to mush. The pain these people went through is absolutely indescribable, and if not for their iEyes, they would have been killed instantly. But obviously, that didn't happen.

The iEye was the only processor left, and the sudden radiation burst caused it to fuse with the brainstem in most cases. The effect this had was clear and present: you had formings of flesh running about at lightning speed with only animalistic functions left to them, but amplified by Quantum Computing. Essentially, super-intelligent beings with a wisdom score of 0. The remaining people of Earth were almost all engineers who worked underground during the incident, building the sacred electronics in pristine environs.

Liam Mith was one of those engineers. This is his story, as played by you.
***STORY***
The Post-Mortem can be seen here: http://bit.ly/vKBPUd
The timelapse is here: http://bit.ly/sEpTOP

entries.title: Present Continious
entries.description:
Walking around... Jumping, crowling, twisting, melting.
It's Present Continious. It's your time, your life. And your lifetime was stolen! Find some more, somehow, or die. Death isn't that bad coise, dear.. But there's also another end.

Sort of art walk-around... WASD, Spacebar, LMB/E (perform parkour), B (act), Escape (in Windows build).
You've got hardwared "clock" with your lifetime stored in it - spend it or get more.

entries.title: Stelo
entries.description: Better than nothing, but it isn't really a game - it's more like an ambient "controllable demo". I think it might be worth it though if you need to relax.

entries.title: The Lonely Cupcake
entries.description:
Play as a lonely cupcake who just wants to be eaten. Collect the toppings to make him taste and look delicious! Move CuppyCake using the left and right arrow keys, and jump with space.
The game was created using Stencyl by Pralie and Alissa.

entries.title: Volcanox
entries.description:
Volcanox: Abandoned alone on a planet, try to find your way out!


Notes
=======

Had some last minute issues with the sound effects on Windows. Seems to work fine on Linux though.

Built using LOVE. If you're not on Windows you must download the game engine in order to play the provided file.

entries.title: walkabout
entries.description: Not completely finished but there are two levels

entries.title: ZED Survivor
entries.description:
To start the game double-click the .jar file.

You woke up, all alone in a deserted city... 
	...or maybe you're not alone after all...

ZOMG!! Zombies!!!!

My submission for my first Ludum Dare. 
Satisfied with the result because this is my first Java project since 5 years, and pretty much my first serious java game ever.

Developed on osX so pretty sure it works for osX users.
Did little testing on windows and it did seem to work there as well.
Linux is untested. But hey, its Java, it should work right?

Walk: Arrows
Shoot/Use: Space

Well.

Thanks for this great event, I will definitely join the next one :D
(I sure hope GitHub is a good place to host the download & code?)

entries.title: 'malone?
entries.description:
A game where you may or may not be playing on your own.

Currently requires the most recent stable version of Chrome (which should have been auto-applied for most people) or the nightly build of Firefox (which mostly works but has no sound).

music

entries.description:

Unfortunately, we didn't had time to add the scenario. It really stuck to the theme... Many other elements remain unfinished as the graphics or sound effects.

Eldaryze (programmer)

entries.title: ALONE .. Developer
entries.description:
A game about creating a game in 48 hours. You task is to complete your game before the time runs out whilst overcoming problems like power outages, hand injuries, hunger and sleep deprivation.

Requires:

.NET Framework 4.0 (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851 , web installer)
XNA Runtimes 4.0 (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914 , 6.7MB)

entries.title: Alone by TAX
entries.description:
You are left alone in the ocean. You better start learning to sail or you wil drift away.


Simple sailing simulator with wind, bouyancy and plate forces.

Tools: Unity3d, audacity + freesound.org, wings3d etc.

Inspired from: http://www.gamedev.net/topic/313131-boat-physics/

Small video.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&list=UU243yboxcXXL7S1u__ku3MQ&v=8k5dbcVBe5I

entries.title: Crazy Old Cat Lady
entries.description:
Not really a full game, the idea is based around you being a crazy old cat lady or something, but even your animals (not just cats) don't like you, so they'll move away from you. Animals of the same species will not mind being nearby though. The actual gameplay is based around getting a certain amount of animals into various boxes. If I had more time and was more experienced there would be some kind of popup and a chance to generate a new setup, but oh well. As of the moment there's no way to win or get score, and you have to restart the app to get a new setup. The controls are WASD to move, and arrow keys are some tickrate controls I was playing around with (set, increase, decrease).

This was my first time making a game with C++ and I am pretty new to the language, so I'm fairly happy with how it turned out. Windows download is linked, but it includes the source and all the assets so you should be able to build it for another platform if you have a C++ compiler and the SDL libraries.

entries.title: Duke Ludum Forever
entries.description:
Here is my entry. It again fell short of being fully functional so all there is to see is the splash screen but things will be different for LD 23!

Got a Dropbox account this time around to make it easier to download and try.

Thanks for looking and congrats to everyone who was able to get fully functional software out the door!

entries.title: Ejected
entries.description:
This is my first entry at Ludum dare ^^.

It was a great experience, even if the final result is ... huh ... you'll see :p.

entries.title: Glow
entries.description:
My first actual game. Written in Python with pygame.
To launch it on Windows launch file named "glow.exe" and to launch it on Unix-like launch file named "glow".
To launch it on Windows you don't have to install anything else.
To launch on Unix-like you have to download Python 2.7(http://python.org) and pygame with all submodules(http://pygame.org). I would recommend you to run it with Wine. Works fine, no need to download anything.

entries.title: Happy Land
entries.description:
Bob the disgruntled army kitten just wants to be left alone.  However, the happy kitten residents of Happy Land won't take "no" for an answer.  Bob does the natural thing: starts shooting.
Be sure to listen to the wonderful title song!
Arrow keys move, space fires.
*Keys 1-5 switch weapon.  You can't equip a weapon with no ammo.  THERE IS NO INGAME GUI (SORRY), YOU MUST PRESS THE BUTTONS AFTER GETTING HEARTS TO FIGURE OUT WHICH WEAPON YOU GOT (again, sorry)*
1 - Rainbow Splitter: infinite ammo, fallback weapon
2 - Rainbow Gatling: rapid-fire
3 - Heartbreaker: sprays hearts everywhere
4 - Octaflower: shoots a flower that splits into eight petals
5 - Smile Boomerang: flies in an arc

IMPORTANT: If you cannot run the game (most likely cause is not having XNA), then you must use the installer.  I am really sorry for those of you who don't like installers, but it's really the only way to distribute XNA games.
Installer: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/36926855/Happy%20Land%20Alt.zip

entries.title: Hear You
entries.description: Plans for an homage to Asteroids fell apart, became a clone of Asteroids.  Ah, well.

entries.title: It's Space
entries.description:
First 'done' game ever. Was going to do a bit more, but burnt my hand making coffee
Tools: Unity3D, Wings3D, SFXR, Photoshop
Kitten: Present
Sleep gotten: 8 hours total
Coffees: About six

entries.title: Lava Kittens
entries.description:
Finally completed, just an hour before the deadline. This game is, to be quite honest, awful. But in fairness it was completed in just 24 hours rather than the full 48 because I completely scrapped all my code from the first day.

BACKSTORY
You are a social recluse obsessed with being left alone, who for some reason is inside a volcano. The volcano is also filled with kittens who are completely obsessed with you. In each room you have to destroy all 5 of the kittens attached to you by throwing them in lava (spacebar). You can then leave by the green door. Arrow keys to move. Touching lava will, obviously, kill you.

Did i mention they're ghost kittens? As a result they can fly and pass through walls (which is nothing to do with how much easier it makes the physics **shifty eyes**).

Enjoy

Source is the same for Windows and Linux, and is included in the download.

entries.title: Lifeless
entries.description:
Lifeless, a personal interpretation about loneliness.


There are 3 endings to this game (4 if you include the disappeared one).


Controls with WASD+mouse, click to use object (if you ever find one).
or with an xbox gamepad, controls with dual sticks, A to use an object (if you ever find one).




Lifeless runs on XNA, so I included the necessary installers in the zip file if you ever need them.

entries.title: Lonely Tower
entries.description:
Lonely Tower

A game about leaving behind


A young man is captured in a tower. Seeing the door is shut, he decides to climb the tower to the top, in hope to find the switch. On his journey he gets helped by some young girls who are also captured in this gigantic tower.

Lonely Tower is not only about being alone. It's about leaving behind, and the consequences of that.
____________________________________________________


Hi everyone!

I started saturday 7:30 with my game, and at 1:00 am monday I was done. I've only slept 7 hours between those times, wich isn't really special or something, but just to let you guys know.

The first half hour I was looking for an idea, and I'm not sure how I got this idea, but I was thinking about working together, where you have to leave someone behind.

Yes, there are bugs in this game. Some big bugs. But there just wasn't enough time.

I learned a lot of this Ludum Dare. A lot about programming, about planning. I really enjoyed the community and was talking on the IRC chat half of the time. People there gave me the motivation to go on, when I was about to quit.

The most important things I wanted to improve were the level features, and the amount of levels. Right now the game isn't really long, but I hope it can amuse you for 5 minutes or longer.

For everyone who has found the secret kitten: Awesome!
Please send me a message or write a comment about that you found it. But please don't spoil where you found it! Thanks.

Everyone: Thanks for playing this, thanks for reading this, thanks for making Ludum Dare such a great community. I love you guys.

Greetings, Daniel Haazen / Sheep

entries.title: Lonesome Runner
entries.description:
Lonesome Runner is a platformer with a random generated world. And you will die a lot. And it's the first game i've ever finished :)

This was only tested with a linux system, but since it's Java it should run everywhere.

Have Fun! :)

entries.title: Long Walk Home
entries.description:
Story Notes : You just want to get home, but the sun has set early and you've lost your way. You know that these caves are full of holes and passageways, lets just hope you can keep enough batteries in your flashlight to make it over the wall and home!

GamPlay Notes : Use your flashlight to see further and move faster, but remember to conserve that battery life! 
Look for hidden items, each item will make your adventure easier.
Falling is okay. Sometimes its best to start from the bottom and work your way up.

Dev Notes : Wow was this a crazy ride. I think I was horribly unprepared for just how much this takes out of you. You have to be so focused and so productive and also pretty fast to make any significant progress. I'm content with my creation, but its far from what I envisioned and I plan on finishing the project and polishing i tup so its something special.

entries.title: Outpost Alone
entries.description:
I hated this theme, and it was really hard to pull something together when I changed my whole base idea with less than 12 hours to go.  But isn't that what makes this all fun :D

The alone part of this was supposed to be since you are station on a remote outpost taking shots at alien fleets passing by on the way to the real war zone.  Originally there was going to be a resource gathering part of the game between waves of ships, which was going to help drive home the alone thing, but it got cut due to time restraints.

entries.title: Sleepwalker
entries.description:
A quick and sleepless adventure game.

This was my first time making a point-and-click Adventure game, and I felt satisfied by my efforts.

You head up to the country one day in search of some time to yourself so you can get working on your thesis. Fortunately, your parents have lent you a house for the weekend - and you hope to get your work done...

entries.title: The Almighty Annihilation
entries.description:
Control an overly bored God as he tries to overcome his loneliness.
Use meteorites and lightning strikes to wipe the entire population of the Earth!

Creation Time: 21 hours
Engine Used: Game Maker

entries.title: The Grey Waste
entries.description:
The Grey Waste is a quick adventure of a madman in a bad place.

You'll need the XNA framework redist and .net framework 4 redist located:


	http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
	http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17718

Also this game uses the hidef profile, so it needs a DX10 capable card.  That rules out netbooks and the like.

For tools I used quake army knife for the levels, my own build tools I posted before the jam based on genesis/q2, paint.net for the 2D stuff, sfxr for sounds, and raw hand typed in values for the moving 3D stuff.

Hope you enjoy it!  I barely got it done in time. :)

entries.title: The Unattainable Lightness of Solitude
entries.description:
You are a candle, and you dislike the company of moths. Avoid them to burn more brightly, and click to use some of your power to kill them. If you lose all your power, game over.

If you don't like your mouse, you can also use arrow keys and space.

Made with Flashpunk and BFXR.

entries.title: You Are Alone
entries.description:
A small entry completely different to what I had planned. Sadly I tried to use SpriteManager in a 3D world, and my lack of experience with this library made me waste a lot of time, so here is the incomplete final result, at least for the community challenge :D

I will definitely participate in the next LudumDare!

Edit: Web version added
Edit2: Web version 0.2 with mouse sensitivity controls was added
Edit3: Web version 0.2 updated with ZQSD movement

entries.title: 4l0n3
entries.description:
You are an emo kid. Food is your only friend. Eat all the food! But if you eat too much you explode. Same goes for if you lose too much weight.

CTRL to throw knife.
Arrow keys to walk.
Space to jump.
ESC to exit.

entries.title: A Stitch in Time
entries.description:
Help Time Kitten save the universe!  A cute-em-up that you control with the mouse.

This is my first jam game for Ludum Dare.  It was kind of nice, having more time, but unfortunately that was offset by my inability to devote completely all of my time towards LD.

So it kinda balanced out.  However, I think Stitch is perhaps my most polished LD entry as of yet in terms of gameplay.

But that came at the cost of content.  Level one is complete but that's it.  However, don't fear, I will working on the other three levels in a post-compo edition -- including the animated intro/ending that I had to cut.

Note there are two bugs:

* "Fishbones collected" stat is not properly keeping track of the number of fish bones you acquire in a level.
* The game plays a bit too fast -- I tuned everything when I was in a debug SWF inside the debug Flash player.  So level 1 is a bit harder than I intended it to be.

entries.title: Al1
entries.description:
STORY
-
You are one of the world's 10 best people called Al, and have therefore been invited to compete in the Annual Al Acrobatics championship. The winner is given the title of 'Al 1' - will it be you?

HOW TO PLAY
-
Use left/right to charge during the powerup phase. At the top of the screen is a minimap - the small red part of the line is the target, and the green arrow is approximately where you will land at your current speed.

When you're in the air, press the displayed keys to score combos, press left to slow down your flight so you hit the target, and make sure you press space before you land otherwise you won't score any points.

To score a kitten bonus, when the combo letter is 'K', hold shift when you press K. You must land directly on the target to score kitten bonuses. After 3 rounds, the game is over.

THE BIT WHERE I EXCUSE THE CRAPPINESS OF THE GAME
-
Though I actually liked the theme this time, I came quite late and unprepared to this LD, and started coding about 36 hours in. I wasn't happy with the game by the Compo cutoff, and normally I would just submit what I had as a compo entry, but this time round I felt like actually completing something. As a result, while it's missing much in the way of graphics and is completely absent of audio, as far as gameplay goes it's perhaps the most complete LD entry I've made. That doesn't make it any less terrible - the game reminds me of many horribly generic Flash games, but without the presentation, addictiveness or convenience - but I hope that the completely unrelated kitten bonus acts as some compensation for this.

I probably won't be developing this further, though if I do I think I'd turn it into a multi-event game, tune the gameplay/opponents a bit more, add a few little features to give it more depth, and vastly improve the presentation.

entries.title: Alone in Space
entries.description:
Unity game. The game takes place on a spaceship that is struck by an unknown object. The player wakes up in a scary situation.

The original plan was to give it a bigger storyline. I have modeled multiple levels of the spaceship, but I had to cut down the size to finish the game in time. The game has no audio at this point. There are no textures, so the game is only 1MB in size. 

I can build a more complete version if people enjoy the game.

entries.title: Alone in the Ark
entries.description: My second Ludum Dare entry!

entries.title: Alone on a raid
entries.description:
To play you are going to need a mac, xcode and an iphone. Or atleast some combination of those to play. No sound as I have no idea how to program that yet. Game is very rough and you will find you can go anywhere, time must have run out. 

This game aint easy, but enjoy

entries.title: Alone On Planet 54672
entries.description:
You have been abandoned by your employer, SpaceCorp, Inc. A long way east, there is a transport back home...

A spacecraft sidescroller built with WebGL. Also makes use of the lightgl.js and CSG.js libraries from https://github.com/evanw

Works best on Chrome 16+. Also works on Firefox 8+.

entries.title: Alone with the Enemy
entries.description: Use WASD to move (caps lock will break it, sorry) and mouse click to shoot. Requires java.

entries.title: Escape
entries.description: It's a crappy piece of IF I threw together in the final 12 hours whilst I had some downtime from making sweet tunes for a bunch of faggots who don't know a goddamn thing about the blues

entries.title: Eyes of Madness
entries.description:
survive for as long as you can. run into items to get items.
try not to die :)

controls:

arrow keys for movement

x for knife

c for guns

entries.title: Faster, Goetterdaemmerung! Zombie! Zombie!
entries.description:
Here it is: my first LD, my first game.

You should play with FIREFOX.

Instructions: You jump with up and walk with right
If you want to restart the game you have to reload the page in your browser ;-)

Hint: The game is not over, when you reach the yellow stars.

Problems:
No music with Chrome.

I'd like to hear some honest feedback! Thanks.

Libraries 
========= 
- Sprite.js 

Software 
======== 
- GIMP
- vim
- OuterSpace(Pure Data) [music]

entries.title: I Should Go Back
entries.description:
Well, here it is, my first LD entry. I Should Go Back is an adventure/puzzle game exploring the notion of loneliness. Made in AS3 with flixel. 

Controls:  Arrow keys to move, space bar to interact, "s" key to skip current cutscene or conversation.

Walkthrough for the main puzzle here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/25116236/ISGBexplanation.txt

Postmortem:  http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/20/yet-another-postmortem-i-should-go-back/

entries.title: L'Joe Locked in his Basement...Alone with his imagination
entries.description:
Narrative can be found here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/18/recruiting-ljoe-to-fight-off-shadow-and-light-alike/



W, A, S, D controls to move, W to jump predetermined height.

If you walk off a platform, you drop down.

entries.title: Left Behind
entries.description:
You've been left behind. Try to catch up with the flock before they get too far.

You'll need lots of energy to reach the others. Eat fish to regain energy and avoid oncoming birds to make sure you don't get left behind.

Controls:
Tap/hold space - Ascend
A/Left - Glide left
D/Right - Glide right
S/Down - Swoop

entries.title: Lonely Dungeon
entries.description:
A relatively simple maze-based game with a small twist. Arrow keys/WASD keys to move, space/left shift to "phase" through different mazes.

Written in C# using XNA. Graphics done via adobe photoshop and sound with Fruity Loops. Everything was created from scratch specifically for this competition.

The windows executable attachment is the executable that would be created with the installer. THIS WILL ONLY WORK ON PCs THAT HAVE THE XNA REDISTRIBUTABLE INSTALLED. IF YOU DON'T HAVE THE XNA REDISTRIBUTABLE INSTALLED, USE THE WINDOWS W/ INSTALLER LINK.

It will install the game and the redistributable all at once.

I started working on the contest about 14 hours late, so I had to cut some things I wanted to add in.

entries.title: Lonely Space
entries.description:
Collect all 3 upgrades and get out of the ship to win!

Arrow keys :to move/jump
Space :for jet pack and to use computers
A :power up
S :power up

yep

entries.title: My.Masterpiece
entries.description:
Oh dear god... Please, don't kill me because of my crappy programming. Please D:

Anyway, here's my entry, in all it's crappiness. There was supposed to be much much more to this, but sadly SCHOOL got in the way of it being fully completed. This is also the reason why many rooms are completely BARE, or just a design in platforms. I like my idea to include two separate endings, and one involves the kitten hidden in the game.

CONTROLS:

Left/Right/Up/Down - Move (Duh.)
Z - When you acquire the paintbrush, shoot paint blobs. This kills enemies (Yes, those red squares are enemies. I didn't have time, okay!? D:) and "Paints out" specially marked blocks.

The intro explains the story.

Thanks for playing, :D

entries.title: Nobody Wants Kitty
entries.description:
Inspired by Hamumu's "Robot Wants Kitty" .. only this is more sad.  And silly!!

Keywords: kitten,kitty,cat,cats,+1kitten,+1 kitten, flash, web, flashpunk, flash punk, as3, christmas, holiday

entries.title: On Top Of The World
entries.description:
"On Top Of The World" is a platformer game where the world
beneath you is falling apart!

Can the little guy make it to the finish point?
Will he find a friend?

Or remain.... *ALONE*....


Controls:

Space: Climb over a box
Mouse Click: Cut a line of "stars" (the poles)


Requirements:
You will need XNA 4 - http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

Team:
James Wrightson - Developer @ www.boxhacker.com
Claire Knight - Graphics @ www.itsme.boxhacker.com

Problems?

Probably quite a lot, I spent far too long without sleep so bugs are a plenty!!! ><

entries.title: Quiet, Please!
entries.description:
Everything in the house is so noisy! You just want to be alone and go to bed.

Windows version requires XNA 4.0. Web version uses Unity.

entries.title: Snowfall
entries.description:
Snowfall by Carter Patterson

Sadly I can not get the JAR File to work, I have uploaded the source code. If someone makes a JAR file that actually works and can provide a link I would be very great-full and I'll credit you here.

My second jam entry for the ludum dare. Not the full game I wanted it too be but I still like it, I will most likely be updating this game later. If you are interested you can follow me on twitter (@sgtQuad) for updates on this and any other projects I might be working on.

If there are any problems please contact me via twitter or leave a comment here, I will try to fix it as soon as I can.

I hope you enjoy.

entries.title: Stompy
entries.description:
Yeah so this is my first completed Ludum Dare Entry, as well as my first time using Stencyl.

... This is what the theme inspired me to do.

entries.title: Survive The Desert
entries.description:
First time using Stencyl, resulting in a horrible 48 hours. Survive the desert by navigating through using the compass in the bottom right of the screen. Mouse clicks for everything!

MS Paint for graphics, audio in Audacity (murdering a guitar), game in Stencyl. 

Native resolution is 640 x 480 but it seems to stretch in browser, so I uploaded it to the Stencyl site: http://www.stencyl.com/game/play/10168 same game just the proper resolution.

entries.title: ZERO2
entries.description:
ZERO2. You find yourself in a barren landscape, unsure of where you are or how you got there. Maybe you should have a look around...

This is my second Ludum Dare entry. It's a Myst style point-and-click adventure complete with prerendered graphics and a whole lotta mystery. I am NOT a programmer, so it's fairly straight forward and pretty easy to beat. Still I'm pretty proud of this. There was A LOT more I wanted to do (including sound!), but man, 48 hours really flies by, doesn't it?

Code:
Actionscript 2.0 (Yep, you read that right) in Flash CS5

Graphics:
Cinema 4d, After Effect CS5, Illustrator CS5, Photoshop CS5

entries.title: A Door in the Dark
entries.description:
A Door in the Dark is a point and click mystery game- almost...

There is no end screen, but you can feel accomplished if you change the lights.

Hover over objects to see info!
Click anything to interact with it!

Thanks for trying my... game?

entries.title: A Realization (in 13 acts)
entries.description:
A simple platformer in 13 acts.  Navigate through a dark world but watch the corner of your eye...

Now with 2 endings!

Edit: I've seen from comments that most are getting the 'bad' ending.  I know you aren't likely to play it again for the good one, so here's a hint: use your ears on the seventh level.


If you have problems, please try installing .NET 4:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851
and XNA 4.0 Redistributable Package:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

I apologize for the inconvenience.

entries.title: Alone in the park
entries.description:
Physics based platformer. No sound sorry! The game is very short, but the 'tool chain' produced as a result of making it allows more levels to be added quite quickly. Check out the settings.as file if you feel like tinkering around with it.

Update: OSX build is up - this is the first .app I have distributed and I had a bitch of a time getting all that dylib nonsense to work properly. I would like to make sure I got it right, so please let me know if it doesn't work on your system.

entries.title: An Empty Room
entries.description:
An empty room. Scream to keep them away.

Made in the last 22 hours of the competition (about 13 hours total, accounting for sleep). Has almost no play testing, so difficulty may not be perfect.

The game is played using a microphone. It can potentially cause audio feedback, so be warned.

Made using flixel. Art made in the GIMP. Sound recorded with a microphone and Audacity.

EDIT: Created a new version of the game with a config screen that lets you adjust flash's microphone gain. The game is otherwise unchanged. Feel free to ignore this version for rating purposes.

entries.title: AngryMisshapedGuyThing
entries.description:
No, this game is not fun.
No, this game is far from finished.

But at least I didn't give up (if that's a good thing or not due to the result, I'll let be unsaid) and I gained more experience, next time, I will do a better job.

Edit:
I ran out of time, before I knew it the dare was over. So due to poor planning I didn't really create a goal with the game (I had an idea at first but realized it would take too long, and I had already wasted a day).
All you can do because of that is try to kill the enemies, there isn't any reward if you kill some amount of them though.

entries.title: Argus Finnigan's: Loneliness is R'lyehian
entries.description: Argus Finnigan does flips and stuff through R'lyeh alone.

entries.title: Calculon's Revenge
entries.description: The name has nothing to do with the plot. I tried to submit this for the competition, but I didn't finish on time. Randomly generates levels and names. Not much of an artist, so the graphics aren't very good. Also, no sound. Written in C with SDL. Windows version coming soon.

entries.title: Can't Even Apologise
entries.description:
[Oh wow, I just discovered that the sounds hurt with headphones.  Take them off or something.  (They're replaced in the post-competition version.)]

So, you're cursed or something, so that everyone who comes near you dies (and turns to stone or something).

It should be fairly obvious that when one of the other person-things moves inside the big red circle around the character you control, they end up as a solid immoveable block.  By being careful about where this happens, you can reach other areas.

Controls:

arrow keys, WASD: move.
R: reset the level.
enter, space: advance text.
[in post-competition version] escape, backspace: pause/unpause.

WASD works for other keyboard layouts too: QWERTZ, AZERTY, Dvorak, Colemak.

To quit, close the window.

Website: http://ikn.org.uk/Can%27t_Even_Apologise

links.label: post-competition update: Linux / other Unix-like / source

entries.title: Farrokh
entries.description:
Farrokhs spaceship has crashed on the moon, and he is all alone! Help him get back to earth by achieving enough speed to reach orbit!

Hold the spacebar to gain speed, release it to jump. Avoid hitting obstacles as it will slow Farrokh down.

Hurry before the time runs out!

entries.title: Forever Alone
entries.description:
This game was manufactured for the contest. My history of struggles can be found on my twitter account. Fixed the college bug, and so this is the final build!
If you want to see some of the older builds, go to http://topcraftia.no-ip.org/games/foreveralone/foreveralone-x.x.love (where x is the version from changelog.txt). Changelog is here http://topcraftia.no-ip.org/games/foreveralone/changelog.txt
If you want to edit the game, you'll need to download love2d from here: love2d.org.
--
I hope you enjoy the game!
oldtopman

P.S. A big shout-out to FineCraft (on AfterNet) for help with debugging, #love (on freenode) for their expertise with the engine, and anyone else who I forgot to thank.

entries.title: Forever Alone - The End of Colors
entries.description:
This is my first entry into ludum dare. This time I decided to work with cocos2d as it is relatively simple and fast to have a first success. Unfortunately it my setup only works on Mac OS X - Lion. Next time I might try something more ambitous.

In my game you walk around searching for a companion. However he is avoiding you and you follow him deeper and deeper into the darkness.

To steer: use arrow keys or WASD
Spotlight: move the mouse to actually see something


I used:
Language: Objective-C
IDE: XCode
Library: Cocos2d (http://www.cocos2d-iphone.org/)
Graphics: Gimp
Sound: Clavinova and iPhone for recording
MapEditor: Tiled (http://www.mapeditor.org/)

PS: The first five levels are shaped in the letters of ALONE
This is barely recognizable when wandering the labyrinths :)

entries.title: Leave Me Alone
entries.description:
** DON'T PLAY THIS GAME ALONE, PLAYING WITH YOURSELF IS NOT FUN UNLESS YOU'RE INTO THAT KIND OF STUFF **

An intense 2 minute battle among 2 human players, where points are awarded based on how long each player is left alone and how well each is able to capitalize from it.

Points accumulate over time but must be banked by upsetting the other player.

Red Controls: 
Up Arrow - Draw/Fire 
Left Arrow - Turn Left 
Right Arrow - Turn Right

Blue Controls: 
W - Draw/Fire 
A - Turn Left 
D - Turn Right

Other Controls: 
Spacebar - Reset

entries.title: Lonely Weredot
entries.description:
Hi all.

This is my first up load of my game. Its called Lonely Weredot. Basically youre a dot with a health aura around you, in the day you need to be close to other dots otherwise you'll loose health (Companions!). At night other dots are scared of you as you will need to hurt them to heal yourself (youre all alone :'().

Start with the tutorials and try get a good grip with each mechanic before trying survival mode (its the only scene with no writing). In the survival mode I am going to add a timer to gauge how long you survived(once I figure out an easy way to). I would also like to add some sound effects later.

Ive built this entirely in Unity3d.

Tell me what you think please!

entries.title: Neural Entanglements
entries.description:
In short: Neural Entanglements is a game about two sheep with a special connection, that are fleeing from an evil scientist.

If you want to know, what this has to do with "Alone", play the game ;)

It's now Linux only, I will upload an .exe later.

Highscore is in a .txt File in the game folder.

Menuscreen is missing, so is support for different Video modes. The game just uses your Desktop-Resolution in fullscreen mode. I could add support for other video modes, but that could be considered as cheating.

Sound Effects are missing, too.

The game is playable, but not finished, but it's kind of my first real game, so I'm quite satisfied with it.

Requirements:
For now, to play the game it is required to install SFML. You can just install it via aptitude: sfml-system, sfml-graphics, sfml-window and sfml-audio is needed. I currently work on statically linking it, but with SFML thats a real pain.

UPDATE:
The Linux Version now only works with a resolution of 1024x600. If your Desktop resolution is higher, it will start in window mode. With a higher resolution, a bug in the scaling system would cause a crash. I will fix this, as soon as I find the bug. I do not recommend to start the game with a lower desktop resolution than 1024*600.

UPDATE 2:
Windows Version added, same Resolution problem as in Linux Version, but fully functional.

UPDATE 3:
Found a tiny bufferoverflow. Hope that should solve the crashes. Also some "bugfixes" in the titlescreen.

entries.title: Nothing But Stars
entries.description:
Hey Ludum Dare folks,

First some notes: You are required to have .Net and XNA 4 installed to run this. If you don't have those, download the game + resources file. Secondly, the source won't compile without the font "Animated Avatar" installed on your computer. Either switch it to Arial, or go get that.

Thanks for checking out my game, Nothing but Stars. I had a lot of fun making the game, but unfortunately, ended up missing out on the last 12 hours of work time. I full well expected to spend those adding obstacles like meteorites, black holes etc. to spicen up the gameplay. Still, I'm left with an almost decent game with some cool elements and mechanics to it.

All graphics, audio, and code was made by me with the help of the following tools:

Visual Studio
Paint.net
Reason 4
Sfxr
Audacity

Except for the font used, which was originally on DaFont, but has been pulled since I downloaded it. It's called Animated Avatar though.

If you would like to use any of my assets, please send me an email at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Thanks again for checking it out.

entries.title: Nyan Nyan Stack
entries.description:
I had some last minute build issues. This should work fine, but I haven't tested it.  

EDIT: Level select is fixed now, and Mac and Web builds added

---
