The source is included. Rename the .love file to .zip and you can see all the inwards.

entries.title: Solus
entries.description:
Use the second link if the first link doesn't work.

I worked pretty hard on this. It's a side-scrolling shmup. There's a lot of code and art and sound.

entries.title: Solved with Head
entries.description:
My submission: Solved with Head.
XNA 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

After some failed timemanagement during the 48 hour competition, I created this game in 4 or 5 hours. Please tell me here via comments, if there are problems to install/to play.

entries.title: Statue
entries.description:
You wander and explore this mysterious land looking for traces of the people before you.

Arrow keys to move 
Up to climb ladders.
Space to jump (Y on Xbox controller)


**SPOILERS**

Ending: You win the game when you collect all three shards and the optional kitten.

Double jumping doesn't work well. If you jump while standing still and then use the arrow keys to move in the air it will be much easier.

entries.title: The LD Lament
entries.description:
First LD compo entry for Mortality Games.
A fellow Ludum Dare entrant is working hard on his project when something.... unexpected happens.

Created using: XNA, GIMP and sfxr.

entries.title: The Lonely Electron
entries.description:
Guide Mr Lonely Electron to his friends in the battery.

arrow keys to move

entries.title: Together Alone
entries.description:
A fairly short but polished game about isolation, cooperation, and hope. The puzzles have a gentle difficulty curve. Give it a try, you might like it! :-)

UPDATE Jan 9th: There's a new, improved version available. Click the link above. Bugs have been fixed, special abilities added, there are more levels (22 for story mode and 4 challenge levels), and the game should be playable on smartphones. Enjoy!

entries.title: Urine Trouble
entries.description:
All you want to do is pee, but there are people everywhere. 

Get out of site and take a wizz when nobody is looking, if you get caught prepare for a blow to your bladder. ( hold direction towards surface to pee )

You know what a full bladder means? Death, try not to die.

This isn't nearly as complete as I wanted but I suppose that happens sometimes.

*edit* I made a few minor / cheap fixes for the bugs that were coming up. The enemies should no longer fly straight up and into oblivion and the enemy's meters will no longer fill past the limit. 
Just in case these fixes, despite being minor, are against the rules I included them in a separate link. Oh, and if you find any bugs still coming up please let me know, thanks :)

*edit**edit* Also pressing 'M' will mute the audio now

entries.title: /follow
entries.description:
You like to be alone, but this bodyguard won't let you breathe... Escape and enjoy your quiet moments.

(Still a few bugs to kill and an alternate end to code, but here you go, the release version)

entries.title: Alone
entries.description: A game about trying to be alone. Made in around 7 Hours

entries.title: Alone
entries.description: Not really a game...

entries.title: Alone Creature
entries.description: Point-and-click adventure game, with mixed platform features. You play as a creature that lives alone, distant from the society. Move with the WAD or arrow keys, click items and people to interact with them. Press M to mute the sound (it's crappy, so you'll probably do that). Walkthrough link available inside the game!

entries.title: Alone in Space
entries.description:
This game is not finished... I submited it so you can see it and rate. It was preaty good for first LD, now I knoe how to manage my time better.

This is game of Space Shuttle takeoff :P

EDIT: Game controls are:
          - Arrow keys to navigate space shuttle (Accelerate, Decelerate, Rotate Left and Rotate Right)
          - Space key to eject next part (rocket engines and fuel tank)

entries.title: Alone in the city
entries.description:
As always it has been imposible to finish the gameplay, there is no goal besides surviving, but at least you can walk around and enjoy the strange city full of hostile people and annoying dogs.

It was made using Flixel, graphics were created using Photoshop.

When voting take into account that this game was made by TWO people (me and my girlfriend), we didnt know it was a solo compo till the begining. It should had gone to the JAM instead of the 48hs (although it was made in 48hours).

Gameplay:

Walk around trying to find supplies, but be careful, if the loneliness bar gets full you die, some places will help you other will make you die... alone... in the city.



Thanks a lot to my girlfriend for helping me with the graphics and for supporting me the whole weekend. <3

Controls are cursors and space.

entries.title: Angry Kitten Gods Of War
entries.description:
The Angry Kitten Gods Of War demands blood!
Kill everything, including one of the gods, or die trying.

find 2 keys. Unlock the doors to the inner sanctum.
Spank a kitty!

WASD moves.
Arrows shoots.
Bullets hurt.

Time ran out, highscore will be reset when you die. :P

entries.title: Are You Alone?
entries.description:
Wow, what a compo *sigh*. I can't believe I actually got done what I've done, yes, I could have done a lot more but it was my first time so I can use that as the excuse xD The game is very simple; explore the cave, going down ladders, beating ghosts, collecting diamonds and finding the treasure chest.

-Controls-
Arrow keys - Move player
Space - Attack * Only use the SPACE key when there is an enemy in front off you as there seems to be a bug that will sometimes allow you to battle an enemy even if its not infront of you ;D *

Damn! Definetly doing this again xD

entries.title: Astronaut Alone
entries.description:
Apologies if an asteroid hits you immediately... I can't seem to fix that bug. Probably won't happen twice in a row ;)

To blast, you keep space held. Your old gun takes a while to charge. Fill your ore collection tanks to see a High Def thousand colour finale!

entries.title: Dark Isolation
entries.description:
Stave off hunger and discover the mystery... in Dark Isolation.

===

This is my first time making a roguelike!

Included in the download is a readme file, in case you aren't familiar with roguelike controls.

Libraries used:
libtcod

entries.title: Flod Embarks
entries.description:
I had almost given up because I had some tough weeks prior to the weekend, little time, and even fewer ideas. Then, Sunday noon, I finally started with half an idea. But I'm happy about what came out in the end. I put about 14 hours into it. Enjoy!

Tools:
Flash Builder 4.5, Flixel, Flixel Powertools, TileStudio, Autotracker by Greasemonkey (modified a little), Audacity, SFXR
 
~

You are Fraxtol Flod-Pirno S'nint, a lonely robot looking for friends.

cursor keys: move
+/-: volume

entries.title: Last breath
entries.description:
The story of a dog trapped between life & death. 

I can't say much more, it would spoil the story :)

CONTROLS : arrow keys and SPACEBAR to skip messages.
You can also skip introduction using "S".

---------------------------------------------------

ABOUT EXTENDED VERSION : it was posted after the dead line. I only added a difficulty setting, the game is untouched and remained exactly the same.

---------------------------------------------------

I had a really great time making this game! At first, I was disappointed by the theme: too guiding. Especially when you want to do a platformer. But then I experimented a few things. The engine itself was developed in 4-5 hours I think. 

I spent lots of precious time on the sounds, especially because of the lack of good tools (except SFXR, but it proved to be quite repetitive for my 4th LD). Next time, I will prepare a small lib for this purpose.

The animation was a real pleasure :) I definitely LOVE pixel art animation!

HINTS : don't read next chapter if you want to avoid SPOIL!

the Shadow follows all your steps. Use this to avoid it in dead ends! Each time you pickup a ball, the Shadow gets closer from you. Pick balls in tricky areas first.

entries.title: LDKittenRL
entries.description:
PLEASE READ README BEFORE PLAYING



About
=====
LDKittenRL

Your friend has ventured into a cave without you and is lost and alone! It is
up to you to save him! Battle through hordes of 90s boy band members, people
who work in predatory industries, and other horrors of the deep!

Don't read any of the source files if you care about spoilers. This includes 
the ./game file that runs the game.


Requirements
============
You'll need Ruby 1.9.3 and a terminal that supports colors.


Playing
=======
Navigate to the directory in your terminal and run

	` ruby ./game `

without quotes. If you're a seasoned Ruby user, you may have a different
command for running Ruby files. Also, Linux/OS X users may simply

	` chmod +x ./game `
	` ./game `

This will give the file permission to be run, and the second command runs the
file. 


Controls
========
y	-	Northwest
u	-	Northeast
h	-	West
j	-	North
k	-	South
l	-	East
b	-	Southwest
n	-	Southeast
>	-	Down stairs
<	-	Up stairs
U 	-	Use item, follow up with the key in your inventory
g	- 	Pick up item
.	-	Wait a turn


Tips
====
When you level up your unarmed damage and health go up. Try to avoid insurance
salesmen at early levels. They're pretty mean.

Good luck!

entries.title: Leave Me Alone. Never Leave Me Alone.
entries.description:
This game looks at the concept of a person's preference for being alone (introversion), or never being alone (extroversion). I know the science and exact nature of these things is not captured in the game, but the game is meant to be fun/funny too. Check out the instructions in the game menu for the skinny on controls and goals.

More info on this here: http://whilefun.com/games.php#LD22

Controls are X (select in menu), and C, and arrows. Read the instructions for more info :)

More details, if you want them: You select your "alone" preference then play through day (office) and night (city/street) cycles. You must carefully balance your anxiety and energy levels, while striving to be understood by those around you. The more anxious you are and the less energy you have, the more likely you will be misunderstood. At the end of the day (you're understoood, or too anxious), you get to recharge in the way you like. The goal of the night cycle is to lower your anxiety and raise your energy for the next day. Failure to do this means you won't be understood, and ultimately your self worth and lonliness will increase. If your self worth goes too low, you will die. Boy did I make that sound boring. HAH :)

entries.title: Oh Dear, I've Lost My Hat
entries.description: You're in a forest, without your hat. You really want your hat so you go out and look for it. Alone.

entries.title: Out
entries.description:
This is a small top-down arcade game. You're all alone, trapped in a building when the security system activates. Progress through floors by disabling sentries using EMP charges. But you have to disable them all in one shot, and stay out of sight!

I'm pretty happy with the result. My aim was something as simple as the original Lode Runner, and in about the same vain. I think I succeeded in simple; the code is less than a thousand lines, but that didn't make it less a challenge to write! ;)

What I personally find most lacking about the result is that I haven't been able to find the time to create some challenging levels. There's a short but adequate tutorial, and one very simple level.

Still, I very much hope you enjoy it!

Browser support:
 - Chrome: Tested in Chrome 16, current beta. Should work in any recent version.
 - Firefox: Tested in Firefox 9, current beta. Should work in any recent version.
 - Opera: Requires (and tested in) Opera 11.60, current stable.
 - Safari: Broken on current releases. (Due to HTML Canvas bugs.)
 - IE: Broken on current releases. Might just work in IE10 preview, but untested.

Post-deadline updates:
 - Dec 19: Browser compatibility update.

entries.title: Rabbits...

Stinky Pete is a game coded in Blitz3D (plus a little php) for the competition Ludum Dare 22.
The other software I used is as follows:

Paint.NET	- creating graphics and level files
TuxGuitar	- composing music
ETNA		- DLL which allows the game to connect the online high-score database


It was created by Martin Cooke on behalf of Drytree Studios.
I worked solo, created all the code and assets within 48 hours and have included the source.

Enjoy :)


* 'improved controls' version - several people reported problems controlling Stinky Pete so I added acceleration and deceleration to his movements. This is the _only_ change that I have made. It took fewer than 10 minutes to implement and as I had the original version submitted with nearly 2 hours to spare I don't consider it too significant a change... but it is a change that happened after the deadline so I offer it only as a secondary download link - the original version remains intact. Please judge whichever version you wish :)

P.S. Merry Christmas everyone!

entries.title: Bodge's Island
entries.description:
Developed using Java's Slick 2D and LWJGL libraries but controlled from JRuby, a JVM based Ruby implementation. Runs very much like any other Java app though. A Java Runtime Environment is required, sadly, and I ran out of time to bundle one.

In Bodge's Island you're a rich game developer looking for some peace on your new private island. But fanboys are on the way! If they reach you, your spirit will be sapped so find a way to remain alone.

Can't play? See video of gameplay at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6slgcqiA1sc

entries.title: Companion
entries.description:
Arrow keys or WASD to move

There is no goal.
Other than maybe finding a purpose in life. Or at least someone to share it with.

-----

I tend to work by thinking up some kind of interesting interaction  first, and only thinking about a challenge or goal to go with it later on. This is very definitely still in the stage of experimenting with interaction.

I do kind of like what I had here, but it does need a lot more feedback for the player to tell what's going on - when you've died, what the companion is doing, and so on. And ultimately, it needs some kind of direction or purpose.

entries.title: KITTENS the Great

entries.title: Lonely Planet
entries.description:
Lonely Planet is a platformer where you have to feed a planet with baddies until it lets you escape in your small rocket ship. Levels of increasing difficulty give you excuses to jam at your keyboard in a desperate attempt not to get crunched into bloody pieces by the flock of baddies. You'll have no choice but to ride them if you want to attain the high places where you rocket ship might have hidden!

=============
Game controls
=============

Left/Right arrow = walk
Space = jump
Backspace = try a level again

=====================
Level editor controls
=====================

F12 = switch editor mode on/off

---------------
In idle mode
---------------

F1 = load level (esc to cancel, enter to confirm)
F2 = save level
F3 = rename level
F4 = change minimum kills to win
F5 = change welcome message
F6 = change win message
F7 = change next level (enter "<win>" for last level)

----------------
In drop mode
----------------

Left/right arrow cycle between droppables
Right click also cycles between droppables
Left click drops

Start and end points are unique, you can drag them around as
you want (useful for end point to position the rocket ship right)

Vacuums are oriented, click to position, hold and drag to rotate
it the way you want.

Swarms can be sized however you want, click to position, hold and
drag to change the radius however you want.

In decor mode, use 'F1' to choose your own svg file. There's no way
to move a decor once dropped, sorry (we had to edit json files by hand,
it's pretty cool)

===================
Config file
===================

You can adjust the resolution with screenX/screenY,
and change the initial level (see comments) in alone.config

entries.title: Loyd's Tale
entries.description: Made by a team of 3.4 - our first ever Ludum Dare attempt. We were completely unprepared, started without an engine, and despite our better efforts the result is not much more than a passable, generic platformer. Still, it's quite fun, and a little challenging. Check it out, laugh at the source, and mind the FuckingBirds.

This time I spent 43 hours trying to find a good, theme-fitting idea and 5 hours implementing a bad one I had since the beginning. ;_;

Monaxia was made using Processing, sfxr and the Minim audio library.

entries.title: People
entries.description:
This was my first Ludum Dare, and I must say I'm somewhat surprised that I got anything done given how busy this weekend has been.

In between studying for a philosophy test, practicing for a physics quiz, going to driving school, and going to an interview, I really only had around 8 hours to work on it. It will only last you 5 minutes, but I can guarantee that what you read in it will last you for a very long time. It only has one gameplay element (figure out the password), and the rest is a loose story. This was my first LD, and I realized how little I knew about programming, especially seeing what others have made. 

I would appreciate any advice on more efficient or better programming methods (perhaps a generous soul would look at my poor, aching source code and tell me what I should have done instead?). Does anyone know a good way to map in java OTHER than defining rectangles where you can/can't go. Better question: can someone tell me that way? I'm sure I did a very poor job of it.

In perspective, though, I'm happy with it! I learned a lot about game programming, and I'm hoping to do much better next time. Thanks for giving it a look! I hope you try it and enjoy what little it has to offer. Have a nice day!

Controls:
Use arrow keys to navigate the menu, space to select/interact. Mouse is only used when entering the code in the first room.

entries.title: Priorities

You have only limited amout of stamina for the day and from 3 bad pictures your career is over.

*Ah yes sorry about the quality lads. I actually joined the jam afterwards this time around. No audio this time neither.

entries.title: Punished
entries.description: Wonder went went wrong as you explore Punished, a game about redemption.

entries.title: Sinkhole
entries.description:
I wanted to write more running inner dialog for the game but my brain parts fused after the all-nighter. Play it. Preferably in Firefox 8 (reportedly works fine in other browsers but the graphics might be blurry). Try to figure out how to passively use the different light sources and the impact they have on the barely perceived threats. If you want more info (including spoilers) and a peak at my workflow check out the text doc I also uploaded.

Things I would change. HTML5 may be ready for "real" games but my particular HTML5 framework is not. Wish I had switched to Flixel once I realized the game was running at 4fps on my 1st gen iPad. The game has touch controls but good luck using them at 4fps. Collision detection was quick and dirty (broken in MobileSafari, probably because of a precision bug). Could be more forgiving. Keyboard input is unidirectional with the most recent key canceling simultaneous keypresses.

Things I'm proud of. I used cellular automata to generate levels dynamically and A* path finding to ensure they're solvable before presenting to the player. Check the source for references. Pretty happy with the art too.

Sleep now.

entries.title: Solitude
entries.description:
Randomly generated platformer developed in Flixel.

Cut a swath through the army that created you, in order to escape and finally be left alone...

Had an awesome time putting this together, first time really playing with Flixel. Originally planned to get this into the competition but didn't have enough time to wrap everything up. Took advantage of the Jam though, had Pierre Chamberlain (@_bigp) put together both tracks. Also nabbed another friend to do up a title screen.

Mechanics and Tips

- Kill enemies to replenish your energy.
- Health and energy will be replenished when you get to the next level.
- The door to the next level will be on the bottom floor of your current map.
- If you die you restart on your current level, it gets randomized though.
- The final boss has a charge up attack, while charging he doesn't take much damage.
- The boss battle is a pain, but there's one spot on the map you can cheese him.

Eager to hear your thoughts on the game! If you find the game too hard take a peek at the gameplay video. Thanks for taking a look.

entries.title: The Lonely Sphincter

The Lonely Sphincter.

You are a giant worm and people want to be friends with you, but you eat them so you are lonely.

Controls: Mouse moves, Space to bite, Z to toggle posterior clenching.

There is no goal. It's just a toy at this point. The bar at the top of the screen doesn't do anything. Make noises with your mouth as you play.

I wish I had more time. There's something really compelling about eating people as a giant worm. The main thing I would like to add is helicopters.

* people will keep spawning forever, therefore it will eventually start to chug your computer.

entries.description: I got started a day late, so some parts are missing quality, and there wasn't time for gameplay either.

entries.title: W
entries.description:
W: The game with limitless potential.

Follow our charismatic main character as he ventures through levels of challenging adventure/puzzle action.  



Mac and Windows executables are up, Linux executables will be uploaded near future.



This is my first entry into  Ludum Dare, and the first game I've ever made to make far enough where it could be called completed!

I wrote it in PLT Racket, an excellent dialect of Lisp.

All the art was done by me this weekend, and all the sounds effects were made using http://www.bfxr.net/

It is rather short, I should have spent less time on game mechanics and more time on levels.

I regret nothing!

entries.title: 0 ALONE
entries.description:
0 ALONE
1 I AM ALONE
2 GOTO 0
Alone. Hindsight is...

entries.title: Alone with Robots
entries.description:
My first entry to Ludum Dare!
It took me about 6 hours. Unfortunately I didn't have much time, but the result is rewarding :).
It's developed on FlashDevelop with FlashPunk.
Graphics created by me. Music effects from sfxr.

entries.title: Always Alone
entries.description:
My main aim with this game was to tell a story, which I believe I have achieved.  It's an extrapolation of feelings that I sometimes get.

Please play to the end of level 4 (it won't take long) because the vibe changes.

Thanks for playing!

Enjoy!

Tech Note: I made this in a language called Monkey which is a cross-platform language by the same people who made the Blitz3D/BlitzPlus/BlitzMax.  I hadn't properly used it before, so this weekend was as much about exploring the language and making a basic engine as making a game. I even made that font from scratch!  I chose the Flash export from Monkey for ease of use, but it's just as easy to make an HTML5 game, or iOS/Android game, or even PC/Mac executable.

entries.title: But You Wake Alone
entries.description:
'But You Wake Alone' is an abstract game about being alone and how that's both good and bad.  The levels are randomly generated so although there are 8 unique thoughts, you can play as long as you're able!

Controls: WASD or arrows keys to move; space to get some temporary perspective

There is music but no mute button. Sorry, no time!

entries.title: Destination Eden
entries.description:
First Ludum Dare entry, so please leave a comment :)

Known Issues:-

Title screen has spelling mistakes, in particular the spelling of ludum as ludem.
 
Charge up and release thrust to take of from planets. 

Distinct lack of kittens.

20/12/11 :- UPDATE

Issue with users playing with XBOX 360 pad, pressing A spawns a boss, this is due to me forgetting to de-activate a debug command, will fix this evening untill then please avoid pressing A. Keyboard users are unaffected.

Other than that have fun :) hope you enjoy

entries.title: In the Ruins of R'lyeh
entries.description:
Find all the pages of Necronomicon.

You can't move the Great Old One, but you can rotate the world around him,

Rotate the scene using left and right keys. Press R to reload level, ESC to go to menu. Avoid sacred signs.

Made in: Lua + Love2D
Editor: Notepad ++
Music: Chordpulse + Mixcraft
Audio: human voice + Audacity + Mixcraft
Graphics: Paint.net + Gimp
Levels: Tiled Map Editor

Regarding the theme. When I think of "Alone" + Video games and inmediately think about "Alone in the Dark" (the original one not the new one), an incredible horror video game. Alone in the Dark is based in HP Lovecraft's mythos so I decided to make a video game about Cthulhu (One of the most important gods of the mythos) who is trapped in the ruins of the underwater city of R'lyeh. I can't imagine someone more alone :)

Dec 22nd: replaced executables with new ones created using LÃ�ï¿½VE automatic distribution script by mes (twitter: @iliveforrevenge) http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/21/love-automatic-distribution-script/

For Linux please install LOVE2D first.

No newgame features added, of course. but to be brutally honest I corrected a small bug that didn't let you finish the game - altought I don't see anybody trying ;)

entries.title: Extreme Outdoor Survival
entries.description:
Pit yourself against nature in an intense battle of wills - Extreme Outdoor Survival! 

I planned to make a choose-your-own-adventure-type survival game but only got as far as a basic engine before I ran out of time.

Unzip to a directory somewhere & run one of the exes. Click around to explore the island.

entries.title: Leave me alone
entries.description:
A solitary rock likes to be alone, but those pesky Easter Island Moai want to crush him. Help him escape the Moai and find some peace and quiet.

This is a browser game that requires WebGL. It will work in Chrome and Firefox 8+.

entries.title: LeaveMeAlone
entries.description:
WASD and spacebar to play.
A man tries to get people to leave his party.

Bugged to buggery, but there's a video of a bug free (ish) playthough above.

I created a system that allowed me to have simple, easy to write, dialog trees with dialogue able to vary based on loads of variables.
Then just had an hour and a half left to use it...

Sort of a single house RPG thing.
There's an easter egg!

EDIT: 22nd December - I think I've fixed bugs related to startup. Clicking on LeaveMeAlone.jar should be enough to get the game to run now, thanks for the help.

entries.title: LIFELONE
entries.description:
Controls: Move with Arrow keys, 'Z' key for action.

This is a short game which tries to be some sort of "art game". To see all sides of it, you need to play it 2-3 times.

I think this theme wasn't the easiest one, but for me it was something which pushed to make something different than I usually do. Less gameplay, more thinking about what being alone can mean, and trying to put that into a few different stages of something. What if you want to be alone? Are you alone, or somebody else? Are you alone because there's nobody around, or because there are too much people? Are you alone because of feeling disconnected to people close to you?

So in my game there really isn't very much to do actually.. I don't want to spoil it all, but it does vary between each play if you do a bit different things.

The game has a 8 minute soundtrack, with start position synced to real clock, so it continues playing if you start game again right after exiting it.

There is also a video link. But remember that the play experience changes a bit if you play it better, and the video naturally doesn't spoil that for you, so the video really isn't a substitute for playing it yourself!

PS. LD #3 was my first one, but starting from 4th Ludum Dare I named all my entries like "Smthng Warrior"... but now I broke the pattern!!

*SPOILER warning*: If you don't want to figure it out, read this page: http://jet.ro/files/lifelone-SPOILERS.html

entries.title: Lonebot
entries.description:
Small platformer game.

The ending is rushed since we were running out of time, sorry...

By: Yotam Frid and Mati & Itamar Ernest.

entries.title: Lonely Adventures of Al Oneman
entries.description:
You are a space traveler. Your name is Al Oneman.

Everyone on the ship is dead. Can you fly it... ALONE?

Probably not in this version. Very not complete :(

You can click on buttons and knobs and pull levers, but eventually your ship will fail completely. Have at it.

It is possible to sustain the ship for some time. The engine room is pretty well the only functioning area of the game. Warp drive is also possible, but not recommended.

entries.title: Mini Blue Box Boy
entries.description:

By Mr. Wonko
A game made in 48h for Ludum Dare 22 (December 2012)

You are Blue Box Boy and you're all alone. So you run and jump around, hoping to find somebody. But deep inside you already know: You won't find anybody. But maybe you'll win!

Source code available on https://github.com/mrwonko/Ludum-Dare-22

A - Left
D - Right
W, Space - Jump

Cheats:

F2 - Next Level
F3 - Previous Level

Really just a simple platformer that only fits the theme because there are no enemies - but I'm pretty happy with it.

Requires OpenAL: http://connect.creativelabs.com/openal/Downloads/Forms/AllItems.aspx

The Linux version crashes with a Segfault once you win - I may look into that soonish.

entries.title: Never Dance Alone Darryl
entries.description:
Don't leave Darryl the Dancing Dude by himself on the dance floor...

CONTROLS:
Arrow Keys - Move Player
X - "Follow me" (Makes nearby dudes follow you)
Z - "Don't Follow" (Makes everyone stop following you)
ENTER - Win/Next-Level (Once the dance has begun)

Notes:
The large number in the top-right is the minimum number of people Darryl needs to have near him before he's happy enough to dance. Bringing additional people will earn you bonus points.

Also, Watch out for the spikes!

entries.title: Safety 91
entries.description:
Known bug : if the ground is white, it's not snow, it's a texture randomly not loading :\

In Safety 91, you are stranded in a forest, after losing your daughter. Will you be able to find her ? Or at least to find shelter ?

There are a couple of things to find in the forest, one of them leading to something else. You will see.

Requires panda3d 1.7.2 (http://panda3d.org)
Native packages are there, tell us if they work!

Gameplay wise, this sucks, and we know it. We were 3 (2 most of the time) people working on this for the 3 days, and many things are left unfinished. For starter, we had a positional audio-based thingy that was working great but a forgotten commit left it out of the submission (sound is still important though, it guides you). This is clearly more a tech demo than a fully-fledged game, but we'll polish it further down the road :)

Have fun solving the... oops, almost spoiled what it is :D

entries.title: She Loves You
entries.description:
She Loves You
  LD22 entry by Kostas "Bad Sector" Michalopoulos
    made it on almost 5min mark

Controls: WASD, right click to jump
Goal:     be around her or you'll die
          do not be too much around her or she'll cry
              and give her gifts

Important note: if you experience crashes, errors or other issues at startup, download the latest version of Java from http://java.com/ - especially Linux users should use that version (you can place it at some subfolder without installing it system-wide) because most distro bundled versions do not seem to work!

entries.title: shoot stab sprint save shooter battle
entries.description:
Shoot, Stab, Sprint, Save and Shooter your way to victory in this fast paced, action tactical shooter. Take cover from enemy weapons, shoot grenades into the faces of your enemies and save your friends from the brink of death.

Minimum of 2 players, Maximum of 4 player (local multiplayer),
xbox 360 controllers required (for now! Keyboard + online multiplayer not for compo timeframe)

Controls : 

Menu  :
Y : Switch Class
A : Ready / Unready

Game : 
LB : Defibrillator
RB : Knife
LT : Use Item (Hold to place)
RT : Shoot weapon
LS : Move (press in to sprint)
RS : Aim 
Y : Switch weapons 

Try and keep your team mate alive. He dies if not revived for 5 seconds. If both team mates die, the other team wins that round. First team to 3 rounds wins.

Each class has unique items, Health packs regenerate you and your team mates health (consumable), fast clip beacons improve weapon reload times for you and your team when in range, and the cover can be placed to protect fallen team mates and give time for reviving etc.

Different weapons (grenade launcher is not implemented in full).


Theme Tie In : 
The theme is that it is a bad idea to move away / become alone in the game. Friends have 5 seconds to revive you and if you are alone they probably can't get to you in time. Team focused gameplay so that being alone is a bad thing.

Mac/Linux builds coming in the next few days, plus fixes and additions :)

entries.title: The Last Man on Earth
entries.description:
You are the sole survivor of an alien invasion on Earth.
Your sole purpose in life is to avenge your species.
Do you think you have what it takes?

The game turned out to be pretty hard. It requires very precise timing sometimes, so if you easily get frustrated with games, I think you might want to skip this one.
Also, sadly it misses a lot of features that I wanted to add but ran out of time - like animations for the enemies, backgrounds, transitions, more levels, etc.
I appreciate any feedback, but please keep in mind that it's my first LD game, so...

Anyways, thanks for playing!

entries.title: The Wizard Who Stumbled
entries.description:
"You are an old wizard. One day you stumbled and accidentally killed everyone...
But now they are returning as dumb zombies and are annoying you.
Kill them all again, so you can be alone!"

My first Ludum Dare :) This game is a 2d top-down shooter. Made with FlashPunk, AS3, FlashDevelop, Pro Motion and Photoshop Elements. Thank you for playing!

entries.title: Village Bastard
entries.description:
Can't a guy get any peace around here? All this racket is putting you off your chess game. There's nothing for it - you'll just have to drive out the other inhabitants of your village so you can finish your game... alone.

Village Bastard is a puzzle/adventure game where you have to figure out what the villagers like and dislike, then use that to make them leave so you can get some quiet time.

Use the cursor keys to move and 1 to 5 to select an inventory slot. Z and X let you talk or insult people you meet, and C lets you pick up, drop or use items.

entries.title: Astrolone
entries.description:
It's really unfinished! 

Arrow Keys to move, Z to shoot, and X to kill everyone.

entries.title: Zombie in love must remain alone.
entries.description:
Check out www.pixelements.es in some weeks, I'll upload this game as we actually designed it, hopefully. The zombie doesn't even move in this version :(

Press space after touching a cube to grab it.

I uploaded the source, but you don't need to modify the game, just open the .dat with blender, and remember to rename the .blend back to .dat (blender changes the extension) or open it with the executable.

entries.title: Atlantic Flight ONE
entries.description:
Atlantic Flight One is a short rogue-like about the sole survivor of a plane crash.  You must make your way back to safety while carefully managing your hunger, thirst, fatigue, and exposure to the elements.

Controls:
Keypad moves (Keypad 5 - rests)
I - Inventory
Z - Status
G - Get object (from ground)
W - Wear Item
E - Eat Item
D - Drink Item
? - Display in-game help

Created with Microsoft C# and XNA 4.0.  Source and Binaries are in the ZIP. The XNA Redist is available at: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Bunker
entries.description:
The Bunker

Arrow keys to move
X to read
*press K if you get stuck*
Avoid the spinners of death

I didn't get to implement 90% of the things I wanted, I thought I had set the goals low, but I guess I was still aiming too high given my limited skills and real first game finished(2nd game ever started)
*
*** There is a hidden Easter Egg Kitten bonus! *** 
*** When you find the Kitten, it floats around you for remainder of game***  
The secret is the letter K

entries.title: Colorless Hope
entries.description:
Not nearly as long as I would've liked it to be.
However, I did try my best and really enjoyed LD22 :3.

entries.title: Dead Party
entries.description: Dead Party: You are ALONE, and in order for some company you will have to lead the wrongly-damned souls of kittens out of a nameless dungeon, shooting badguys with a dubious psy-beam that you didn't even know existed. Also, You're ALONE.

entries.title: December is a Good Month for Dying
entries.description:
A multiplayer about gunfights and starvation.

Controls are as follows:
-Left click to move
-Shift + left click to shoot

The compass in the top right corner of the screen points towards the nearest food crate.
The bar in the top left corner of the screen shows how much food you have left.

Don't starve.

The game will start 30 seconds after 3 players join a match. You cannot shoot before the match has started.


This game was made using Flashpunk and Player.IO

entries.title: Divided
entries.description:
Well, we worked until the last few minutes to get this done. It's a short but sweet game and I think we're mostly happy with how it turned out.

Divided is a short puzzle platformer with 11 levels for you to enjoy. You play as a character named Ink, working as you try to escape each room and remove him from the clutches of the mysterious "other person" he talks about. 

You control both Ink and his shadow at the same time, so you'll have to get creative to solve some of the puzzles you'll come across. Keep in mind that the placement of your character means everything in this game.

There's bound to be some glitches as there are with most of the games here. To remedy any glitches in the game, we have a reset button for each level.

Here are the controls:

Right and Left: Move 
Up: Enter Doors
Space: Jump
Enter: Select
R: Reset Level

Note: This game also supports gamepads!

We hope that you enjoy our game, we worked pretty hard on it and hope you have as much fun with it as we did making it!

[Edit] - If the game crashes for you, try the "Windows - Minimal" version.  The minimal version doesn't load all of the level text overlay pictures at once.

entries.title: Drill Killer
entries.description:
Version 1.0

Who is the Drill Killer? Are you the Drill Killer? Discover the mysteries of the Drill Killer. 

Rated T for Teen.

entries.title: Head South
entries.description:
Head South is a story of journeys. Not just the player, but the people they meet on the way.
This game asks you to question your interpretation of loneliness.

* WASD/Mouse to move.
* Clicking allows you to skip a piece of displayed text.
* Yes, there is a kitten. Yes, it's well hidden.

Timelapse video of the creation is available here: www.youtube.com/watch?v=625ZEhsCfeI

KNOWN ISSUES:
-- I'd love to fix these, but I don't have access to my development PC over the holiday period, sorry! --
* There are a few places where you can walk off the world. Whoops.
* Just to confirm:

IT'S POSSIBLE TO WALK STRAIGHT OFF THE EDGE OF THE GAME WORLD!

You can't get back. You aren't meant to be able to do this. If you get to the edge please don't keep walking; there's no game down there, I promise!
* The ending is broken - it fades to black, but the game doesn't end. Once you are unable to move, the game is over.
* There's no user-friendly quit button. Alt+F4 works fine if you need it (you will need it - see above).
* The mouse cursor is visible. That one's my bad.

entries.title: I Was Here
entries.description:
## Synopsis ##



"Will you wake up ? Don't be scared while exploring this dark but so familiar cave, and try to light up your own memories."



## About ##



The name's yosh... a french guy crazy enough to participate to this awesome LD challenge : D

During these 48h, I worked on a little browser game based on html5/javascript. It's untitled  "I Was Here" and it's a basic adventure/platformer game.

After many unachieved project, I started something less ambitious than usual, with both minmal gameplay and graphics. 
Enjoy !

Feel free to check the soure code and ask questions :)

Yosh'



## FAQ ## 
(may contain spoiler or game help)

Q: I can't reach a book, my character is not jumping far enough when going out of water.
A: If something seems to be unreachable, try again later when you'll have collect the adequate power up.

Q: Some texts seem to be too big to fit in the screen
A: If you are using Firefox, have a look to the first comments below.

entries.title: Jim just wants to be alone
entries.description: Poor Jim can't seem to get away from the ladies.

entries.title: Locked Away
entries.description:
A platformer game with 3 difficulty levels. You are locked away in a cell on Christmas day. Very lonely, you decide to escape ...

Each difficulty is completely different, and there is a hidden treasure in every level; If you complete the game there is a really dumb reward I added in last second. Also, the game SHOULD be compatable with WINE (Linux), but I can't test it so I'm not sure.

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Looking For Group
entries.description:
Game created in 72hrs for Ludum Dare 22 game jam!

You are a nerd with no friends who just wants to run a DND campaign. Using your magical d20 dice, you can recruit ordinary citizens into fantasy classes to join you in your DND game! Avoid bullies who want to ruin your fun. They will steal your dice!

Instructions
============

WASD to move, Aim and click with mouse. Convert pedestrians into character classes for your DND campaign by rolling dice at them. Defeat bullys to earn more dice, but avoid their redbull cans! They are amped, bro!

entries.title: Loot Alone
entries.description:
A hero. A princess. A dragon. A sword (or not). Coins. Chests. Crates.
A simple story that may reflect the decisions we take in real life.

Playing with the Sound ON helps getting in-game feedback of what is going on :)

Made with:
- Unity3D (C#, iTween)
- cfxr
- Audacity
- Garage Band
- Photoshop

Also: Kitten!

Note: The source link takes to the BitBucket Git repository for the game. Just over "get source" to the right and download the zip.

entries.title: lost, alone
entries.description:
You wake up after an accident in the desert. You need to find your partner. use the arrow keys to move.   

This was my first ludum dare game. It's quite rushed and there's lots of stuff missing, but it could have been worse. It's playable after all.

entries.title: No Longer Alone
entries.description:
35 years.. What a long time that is, but have you ever been in prison? Yeah me neither. But this guy is, and that's you. You lier! This place is soo lonely, I'm done being ALONE!!! TOO LONG! BLACK AND WHITE... everywhere i look. Lets get out of here, careful for the security guards.


Here is my 48 hour timelapse - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J5OjPHugeck

Also, I just got my site up if anyone is interested. NightmareApps.com

entries.title: Senile Quest I
entries.description:
One night you suddenly find yourself, a senile old man, all alone in a strange city.
Can you find your way home?

Controls:

Right click - pick action, or skip dialog
Left click - perform action

F - toggle fullscreen (fullscreen is highly recommended!)


We planned a much bigger quest but due to not making it in time, we had to cut it greatly.
Expect the full version to come out soon!

entries.title: Soliloquy
entries.description:
In this game you are split. You are one person, alone in a lifeless world - but you have two souls, which have to work together ...

Controls:
WASD / Arrowkeys - Movement
Space - Jump
1,2,3 / Mousebuttons - Soulswitching (don't do that in the first three levels :P)

Credits, where credits due:
I used this font: http://www.myfont.de/fonts/infos/5223-AEnigma-Scrawl-BRK.html
And this code: http://lukasz.dk/2011/05/01/pixel-perfect-bitmap-font-in-unity/#1 (Had to modify it, though)
Three samples from freesound.org for my "music".

// edit 1:
I made a post compo version which fixes the following problems:
- After dying, you controlled both souls when sometimes this wasn't good.
- Mouse sensitivity can be adjusted with N/M and was adjusted for Macs.
- The background noise loops now.

entries.title: Space Wrench
entries.description:
You are a space mechanic who is alone on a space ship. You must club your way to freedom.

Spacebar hits things once you find a wrench.

Arrow keys move.

Watch out for turrets that shoot bullets at you.

Also you must find oxygen to survive.

entries.title: The Pit
entries.description:
This is my entry for the Jam - unfinished and unpolished sad to say.

My original idea was to make a reflective game around the theme where the character feels alone due to suffering depression. They are in this dark pit and stuck on a pillar all alone. There would be text-based narration like 'Bastion'.

The gameplay was supposed to be as follows: as the game starts, the player would say something to the effect of 'Every now and then I have a good day, think look up and I feel like I could float on air'. As he says this, gravity stops for a moment and the player can jump and float to the next pillar. At each pillar the player would say something new, indicating the journey out of depression is working. As the player climbs higher and higher the background would become lighter and eventually the stars falling in the background would become leaves and the sun would break through the fog in the background.

Obviously the game doesn't have much of what I've described in it - you can move and jump with the arrow keys and spacebar. Sounds should work in Chrome and Firefox, music will only work in Chrome. I haven't tested on other browsers.

Mainly just putting this here so I can say I was in, and to get some feedback on my idea :P

entries.title: TownAlone[DISTRICT 214]
entries.description:
Well, this is very short game.

WASD - movement
Q - open evidence log
LMB - use selected object
RMB - examine selected object
Esc - return to the main menu

entries.title: Uncorrupted
entries.description:
You wake up, not knowing where or who you are. You appear to be some kind of robot. It's apparent that you're in some kind of research facility. It's also apparent that all the researchers are dead, lying on the ground. But why?

I'd say "platformer/shooter" is the most fitting description of this game. Remember when playing, it's best to read all the notes, logs, and boards, as most of them either contain information about what happened, or real-world references.

Sometime soon I'll be making both a timelapse of my work, and a walkthrough of the game.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Void
entries.description:
Team Helmet present their first entry to a Ludum Dare.... Void

Play the part of one of three characters and find yourself in the most amazing of space adventures. Be amazed by full colour graphics, and high quality mono sound, and most importantly find your friends...

Credits:

Darren Royle (AKA Cap'n Royles) - Programming, cook, provider of Tiffin/Taffin
Ross Devereux (AKA Ross Vandereux) - Programming, token PC boy.
Ian Norris (AKA Ian Visnoth 2nd) - Art, and tidyness monitor
Ralph Johnson (AKA Baron Von Johnson) - Art, tea and coffee making facilities.

Thanks:

Adam Saltsman AKA Adam Atomic - for his excellent Flixel.
Photon Storm - for their fantastic Flod Player (though not sure my mod skills really do it justice).
Duncan Jones, Sam Rockwell and Kevin Spacey - ...for just being there.

We had so much fun making this, though it was hard work, and hope you all enjoy it.

Team Helmet!

entries.title: Will I always be Mollone?
entries.description:
When the theme was announced for LD22 I didn't really know what to do, after quite a while of deciding upon my idea I went with an influence from the American Coast mole, who are a solitary animal, only ever spending time with others during the winter when they find a mate.

Then while reading up more on moles; they have to eat every few hours, 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, so I felt my game suited their lifestyle.

Annoyingly I hadn't finished the three ending screens by the time that the compo had ended so I decided to go with the Jam instead as there was no point in wasting all the work I'd done.

Of course it has lots of weaknesses but I'll go over those when I create a post mortem, overall though I'm fairly happy with the game, I just wish it was more of a challenge. Which it could have been if I managed to get a few more of my ideas in, I just ran short of time which I blame on sleeping.

Will I always be Mollone? Was made in Game Maker HTML5 but I have it running as an executable as I had some perf issues that made it run at about 2fps so  I decided to not submit the HTML5 version, but I'll probably try and fix the issues at a later date so I can put it on my website.

I've only tested it on Windows 7 (64bit) please let me know if you run into any issues.

entries.title: A Whisperer in Darkness: The Game
entries.description: You are Henry Akeley, a eremite professor that lives in the Vermont wilderness. After heavy raining and flooding of the area strange creatures starts to appear. They come each moonless night and seem to be everything than friendly. With your shotgun and a couple of grenades and a #&%!load of dogs you fight the creatures from beyond the stars in this epic game! They want your brain and it's your job not to loose it!

entries.title: ALONE
entries.description:
I made this game to go along with my Nether Six collection, so it's an arcade game that only uses the AXML keys, and has a simplistic graphic style. It's an HTML5 game made using a slightly modified version of my library CanvasLord (http://canvaslord.co.cc/).

Hold the key that corresponds to the location on screen that you want the crowd to move to. Try to avoid the gray circle as long as you can. It must remain alone. Pass through the outlined zones (circles) to get points quickly.

* How it relates to the theme: The gray circle is forever alone.

entries.title: Alone at the Bus Stop
entries.description:
Not finished. I've been very busy...
And it has been my first time creating pixel art.

Great exp, btw :)

entries.title: Alone Game
entries.description:
Your soul is trapped in some magical purple castle. Find your way out.

Direction keys moves your character, M toggles music.

Requires Java SE 7. YES _REQUIRES_. IF YOU ARE GETTING "Could not find main class" WHEN RUNNING THE GAME, PLEASE UPGRADE TO JAVA SE 7.

entries.title: Alone in Space
entries.description:
Just extract the files and run the "ld22.jar".

Press "e" to loot resources from the planets and "ESC" to exit.

entries.title: ALONE with K.I.T.T.I.
entries.description:
You can either play it from the web, or download a packaged zip file with all the files required to play the game locally.

To install locally, just download and unzip the Source version and open up the 'index.html' file in a recent release of a modern browser (like Firefox or Chrome/Chromium).

Sound is kinda wonky -- it's using straight HTML5-Audio through the melonJS lib, and probably won't work at all on versions of IE.

Confirmed Browsers that it works in:
  * Chromium 17
  * Firefox 8, 9


updated: the web version is now actually a version you can play without downloading a zip file! and I altered the notes a bit.

entries.title: AS:ZT - Assault Squad: Zombie Tactics
entries.description:
This game requires an HTML5/Canvas compatible browser, such as the latest Chrome/Chromium or Firefox, and, in theory, IE9.

The last level IS beatable! If you're about to ragequit, try these:

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/5227720/LD22/guide1.png
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/5227720/LD22/guide2.png

This game involves zombie kittens.

entries.title: Beat the Dragon
entries.description:
WASD to move,
Left-mouse button to fire/advance dialogue in special cases.

entries.title: Desolate Human
entries.description: This was more of a test than an actual game... I never tried to make a game like this in Game Maker before, and I -might- have succeeded.

entries.title: Don't Make Eye Contact
entries.description:
This is supposed to be a game about social anxiety but it didn't really work too well.

If you are seen by people then your stamina will go down. If it's too low then it'll get harder to move until it regenerates.

Arrow keys/WSAD to move
X to interact with the cat(the only thing you can interact with)
N to go to the next level once you're finished with it

entries.title: First Cell
entries.description:
This is my first entry for Ludum Dare I've tried to get the emotion of being 'Alone' into the game.

Made with Actionscript 3 and Photoshop.

I'm looking forward to playing games from the rest of the community, and to LD23!

Justification for the Theme:
You play as the first and only cell, the first life, surrounded by dead drifting matter.  If you don't move you are left in darkness.

entries.title: Gravity Cat Thing
entries.description:
Play as a gravity flipping forest creature (which we call the 'Gravity Cat ...thing'), trying to have some time alone by running away from the Evil Dr Cuddles! He wants to spend time with you and give you hugs but you just want to be alone!

The game was originally a *little* bit different, but due to complications, I decided to scrap the entire thing halfway through today, and made a new version. Crazy? Yes. But this version is better :P

Art and music by Ben Swanwick (http://soundcloud.com/dosage)

P.S. I'm not too sure, but this game might be quite difficult...

Gameplay video here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pWYwj2JWp9I

entries.title: Gross.. AS IF!!
entries.description: Why can't they just leave you alone?  All sorts of gross, smelly guys are trying to get you to like them. Get them to go away for as long as you can.

entries.title: I don't want to be alone!
entries.description:
Was aiming to enter the non-jam competition but i only managed to put in 30 minutes during the weekend (3 week old daughter) so this is a somewhat rushed jam-effort. 5 hours in total, and no sound. =)

Story: Everyone's leaving earth, and you do not want to be left alone. =)
Controls: Arrows to move, up to boost.

Requirements: I think that you'll need mono (http://www.go-mono.com/mono-downloads/download.html) since i'm using mono and monogame. Will try to put up a linux port in a day or so. =)

*** EDIT: The NET version uses XNA (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914), so you wont have to use mono and monogame.

entries.title: Kitty Alone!
entries.description: Made by Adam Rademacher

entries.title: Kitty Crusade
entries.description: Shift to Jump, arrows to move

entries.title: Leave Me Alone!
entries.description:
Description ----

You despise the world around you.

At school you feel underestimated by teachers and students alike. At home feels nobody understands you. The desire to burn is getting stronger.

You just want everyone to LEAVE YOU ALONE! And burn the world to ashes!

Other notes ----

* My first entry in a #LD48 compo.
* I haven't tried the Mac and Linux standALONE versions.

entries.title: Lonely Island
entries.description:
This is a slightly broken test build, as Unity crashed while trying to take a screenshot for submission, and seems to have wiped my hand-sculpted terrain data. If I can't recover it, this is all I've got :(

Now-useless source scripts/assets uploaded anyway, in case you want to try and glean anything useful from it...should work fine if you recreate the terrain under it and adjust all the heights accordingly.

entries.title: Skull Hunt
entries.description:
A simple platformer about a man left for dead after his ship is pillaged by raiders.

This is solo project and my first platformer.

I have submitted into the Jam as I wanted 72 hours to sort out any kinks.

All sprites and tiles were created as 16x16 pixel images using paint.net and then scaled to the appropriate size.

The audio is recorded by using a Playstation Eye connected to a PC running Audacity. 

The sound you hear when the player or an item falls into the sea is me dropping an unshelled walnut into a large pot of water balanced dangerously close to my PC.

The guitar is being performed by my uncle.

The font was found installed on my workstation and would be the property of either microsoft or adobe.

To run just unzip and run the .exe, no install required.

NB: Requires both .net 4.0 and xna 4.0 redistributables.
Both of these have been placed at http://games.kellythomas.info for your convenience.

EDIT: Fireworks for New Year's Eve!!

entries.title: Someone Was Here
entries.description: Someone Was Here is a multiplayer game about loneliness. It's very tough to directly interact with someone else in the game, but your actions do have an impact on the world, even if they are only temporary. Have you ever gone back and played multiplayer on an old game and traveled through old abandoned servers? This is what this game is about. Please try out this game, relax, and maybe learn something about yourself.  <3 Steve

entries.title: The Seventh Day
entries.description: The Seventh Day is a sadistic god arcade game, where you take the role of the almighty and must avenge mankind.

entries.title: Things you do alone...
entries.description:
This is my second LD48 and first time for submitting!  Things came together much better with the limited time I had.

Wasn't able to compete properly for the first 48 hours but I had the jam day to get this much done -- thanks for playing!

PS.  If you can't get the applet to work in your browser, here is the directly runnable jar:

 http://jeffz.name/ld22-jeffz.jar

Twitter: @jeffz4000

entries.title: Tower of Abominations
entries.description:
A magical catastrophe has taken out the wizards in a remote tower - all except for their precious orphan of whom they expected so much. You must guide the baby wizard up the tower by defeating the abominations you come across along the way - maybe the tower can yet be saved!

A sort of puzzle/turn-based RPG combat game, choose your moves wisely. More abilities become available as The Baby gets stronger from floor-to-floor.

CONTROLS:
-Mouse-driven interface
-Click on an enemy to bring up the casting menu
-The green light below The Baby indicates it is now the player's turn
-'M' key will mute sound

<Proud participant in the kitten challenge>

-----
[19/12] Added alternative Windows and OSX builds
[20/12] Added link to timelapse video

entries.title: A Blind Man in the Darkness
entries.description:
More of a visual poem, and a quite personal one at that, than a game in itself. Can you relate to it, too?

IDE: FlashDevelop
Language: AS3 (w/Flixel Framework)
Platform: Web (Flash)
Genre: Platform-Adventure
Length: A minute or two

@tompritcharduk

entries.title: A Weekend Alone
entries.description:
This video game is designed to bring you the exciting experience of participating (alone) in a Ludum Dare competition!  Control your lonely character as he/she works to balance coding with food, toilet, and sleep needs and beat the 48- or 72-hour clock.

Controls: LEFT/RIGHT arrows to move; SPACE to interact with objects. In-game help is enabled by default. After finishing the game, post to the leaderboard to compare your time to game jammers around the world.

entries.title: Al One
entries.description:
IMPORTANT: When you play a game, everything will run perfectly and smoothly for the game host, but the clients will see some lag.

This was my first Ludum Dare entry, and I think I did OK (but I can do much better next time).

The game is a multiplayer mini-RTS, where you play as Al and use clones of yourself to fight. You believe you are the original Al (Al One), but so does your enemy.

Use WASD to move Al and click to create a clone. Clones attack each other when they get close, and they can attack you, too. You win when you kill the other Al.

I spent a good 24 hours pacing around looking for ideas, and got about 7 hours of sleep for the last 3 days. I can certainly say my brain is not functioning at max capacity right now.

entries.title: Alone
entries.description:
First time in LD
Look for the pieces of paper lying around, use them with a little imagination to piece together what happened to you.
Made in Flash Develop
Used AS3 with Flixel


The source comes complete with sprites I decided not to use.

entries.title: Alone
entries.description:
A peaceful tale about a man's quest to be totally alone.

The storyline behind the game is a bit odd.  It's probably the only submission about a murder/suicide.  A man pushes his wife out of a hot air balloon so he can be truly alone, only to face the wrath of karma.  He dies, and ends up in limbo where he will be alone for eternity.  The funny thing is, he likes it.  He's finally at rest.  But there's more to it than that.  He's insane.  And not in an interesting and quirky way, in a "I painted a portrait of you with my feces, but I ate it before I had a chance to give it to you" kind of way.  There is no hot air balloon, he just pushes her out the window and runs into the street.  Those are not birds, they're cars.  Those are not fighter planes and UFOs, they're police.  Under it all, this is a pretty dark story about a man who murders his wife and commits suicide by cop.  But that's depressing and hard to draw, so you get clouds and balloons.  I thought you'd enjoy that more.

This is an HTML5 game, so it's best to use the latest version of Chrome or Firefox.  Opera and Safari also work.  IE probably will not work.

entries.title: alone I art
entries.description:
"alone I art" is a game about spending valuable time alone with art.

You're a shady character in a museum. You love art. You love it so much that you need to steal it. But to steal the art, you need to be alone. You can't have anyone spot you stealing or you'll never be allowed be alone with art ever again.


How to play:
- Use the Arrow keys to move
- Use the Space key to grab the art piece
- Go to the exit door to cash in the art piece
- Avoid the guards
- Esc goes back to main menu

Be sure to check the Gallery in the main menu after you're done stealing. Score and Gallery are cleared if you close this page, sorry.

UPDATED TO 1.01, SOUND PROBLEMS SOLVED AND MINOR BUG FIXES

Bug List: 
- Sound and Music aren't playing online (fixed in 1.01)
- Footsteps may not play 
- Loads wrong splash screen (fixed in 1.01)
- Prop and obstacle layers not showing 
- Guard getting stuck sometimes 
- Vase and bust values not showing or being added to score (fixed 1.01)
- P doesn't pause the game 
- Guard "angry" animation isn't playing 
- Exit door animation isn't playing (fixed in 1.01)
- Some paintings are impossible to steal, sorry, our bad (fixed 1.01)
- Gallery doesn't display numbers of uncollected art (fixed 1.01)
- Top Score isn't saved when game is closed
- Guards' circle of vision passes through walls but guards can't see through walls
- When more guards are after you, pursuit music changes to sneaking music if one loses you.
- Top Score and Gallery are cleared if you close the game, sorry.
- Gallery shows 75 paintings out of 72.
- You can cash in a piece of art when being pursued.

Minor adjustments:
- Main menu and HUD objects need alignment
- Paintings and lights need alignment

Missing Features:
- Museum at day with visitors

I made this in about 45 hours and made all the sprites and backgrounds myself. i made it with stencyl, and it is available on any OS/web browser that supports flash.

entries.title: Busy King
entries.description:
Busy King Instructions:
You play as a king who has a long list of things to do, but his subjects won't leave him alone! You need to stay in your office by yourself to reduce your to-do list. But if a subject catches you, you have to get rid of him by returning him to his room.

Controls:
Play with the arrow keys or WASD.

Notes:
Made in Flashpunk. There's no sound. This is all my own work, but I didn't finish in time to enter the Compo.

Well, it's not completely finished: I wanted to add more people and multiple levels, the in-game instructions aren't great, and there's a bug where a subject will occasionally break free and run out of the castle! But in any case, please tell me what you think.

Postmortem: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/19/busy-king-postmortem/

entries.title: TREPANG
entries.description:
Run 'trepang.exe' to play.

-----
UPDATE: As of 12/23/2011 the game has been updated. It doesn't run in fullscreen anymore and crashes way less. If you found it crashing the first time, play this and see how it goes.

------
HOW TO PLAY:
Press Z to shoot an organ. This gets rid of some of your life.
Arrow keys to move. Get to exit.
------

Trepang (aka "Project Chordwing") was done by us! We're Dan, Wilson, and Eric, and we're undergraduates from the University of Victoria. None of us before had any real gamedev experience, so pardon us if you find it pretty crappy. We love it like our child in all its DOS-like goodness.

Trepang is the story of Wopley the Sea Cucumber, out on an adventure to escape the endless cave. Sadly sea cucumbers aren't that smart, so Wopley doesn't realize the cave is endless. In order to "complete" his quest, Wopley must bypass countless evil Starfish, Squids, and Jellyfish blocking his path. But if he can't escape them, how can he defeat them? BY EJECTING HIS OWN ORGANS OF COURSE! Sea Cucumbers actually do that.

The theme of being "Alone" comes from the idea of being the only one of your kind and how you need to expend yourself in order to survive. Community is uplifting, and the game symbolizes its absence.

We coded TREPANG in C and SDL. The game generates random caves using cellular state automata and creates a solvable exit using Dijkstra's Algorithm. The rest is just regular game design magic. There are a lot of bugs, so if you find one, please post a comment. We could use it for fixes! Thanks!

entries.title: You Are (Not) Alone
entries.description:
Game is incomplete.

There's a fair few things to interact with in the world and a few story points to uncover, but there's no end.

Game is/was suppost to be a visual novel/interactive fiction with some RPG elements. You walk around the town and can interact with a few set pieces in a variety of ways.
The story/content never did materialize in the 48 hour deadline.

The setup is the old 'Wake up in spooky town not quite sure how you got there' and 'quiet town hides a dark secret' tropes, but I tried to inject a little humour into it.

Plot and player actions would be handled through dialogue, with multiple outcomes etc but alas the content just isn't there :(

Anyway, enough from me, I'll let it speak for itself. Please comment and enjoy!

Dexter

http://www.renpy.org/
http://pygame.org/news.html
http://code.google.com/p/pgu/ 

This was created by my son and his friends with me doing the programming.

The file is 10-15 MB.  I've tested it on Windows Vista/7 and Mac OS 10.5.

entries.title: Alone With Myself in a Box
entries.description:
Concept:
"You're in a box, which you escape from by destroying the walls. Completing a level creates a copy of yourself with your current stats, a Shadow Link, that follows you to all future levels. Unfortunately, he dislikes how you smell and wants you to go away. Being unable to speak, his only way of expressing his feelings is to shoot you in the face."

Controls: 
WASD - Movement.
Mouse - Aim and shoot. 
E - Swap through weapons. 
R - Deletes your local save file (to start a new game). 

Tools: 
AS3/Flash/Flixel @ FlashDevelop (code). 
Paint.NET (art). 
Musagi (music). 

Rant:
2nd Ludum Dare finished. Woot. ^__^ Yay for Flixel. After spending the last 3 hours of the Dare attempting to compose music, I was reminded how terrible I am with it and ended up keeping the music from my first day build--parts of which are drum samples from DrPetter, if it sounds a bit familiar. All in all, this LD was another ridiculously awesome, fun, and enlightening experience. 

Attached background mp3 to go with the screen shots: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/43348544/bgbeat.mp3

Hope you guys enjoy the final product as much as I enjoyed making it. Cheers! :D


edit: The updated post compo version is not meant to be judged! It was worked on for ~a week after the Dare finished as I continued developing the game for funsies and uses music from my actually musically talented friends. Posted in case you enjoyed the original and wanted to see what happens if you leave a kid with lots of awesome feedback.

entries.title: Deadly Robot Spree
entries.description:
EDIT
some clarifications:
- You can (and probably should) walljump
- The little red things are mines. Destroying them will grant you some points. Beware the explosion
- No healthbar : The more red your square is, the more in trouble you are

Soooo this is my first LD48 attempt, but also my very first game! I wanted to make some games for a long time, but I have always been too lazy to do so. Until now. Also, I decided to try a new language for the occasion. You might notice that the title of the window is "hello world" :)
I used Flixel as a game engine,  bfxr.net for sounds assets, and http://videogamena.me/ to find a name.

My original design was :
- a survival game, based on scoring and combo
- PLENTY of ennemies
- melee fighting
- grabbing and juggling with enemies
- "wall jump" on knocked-up enemies

I quickly came with mouvements controls that I found really cool. I had enemies moving around (wall jumping and climbing) shortly after.

The I tried to implements combat mechanics. I intended to use the mouse for jungling with enemies and dashing toward them, but I forgot that you couldn't right clic with flash. And that mac users also cannot.

So I spend almost the entire first day trying to come with keyboard controls that felt right, but I couldn't. Shortly after midnight I gave up and changed my design to make it a shooting game. I had it working by the time I went to bed.

I spend the second day adding different type of enemies,  levels, scoring mechanism, sounds, a few visual effects (mostly to give feedback to the player), and a proper debug mode. I spend some time tweaking difficulty, and ended up with far less enemies than before (max is 5/6 right now)

I felt the game was finished almost 5 hours before the deadline, and even though I could have easily add sprites, a level editor and maybe an enemy editor, I was just too lazy to do so :)

For those of you who want to play with the debug mode, you can enable it by pressing SHIFT in the instruction screen. When debug mode is active, you can choose wich level you want to play by pressing 1-5 from this screen.
Enemies won't automaticly spawn in debug mode. 

As it is my first game ever, I would love to get feedbacks from you guys. Also, don't forget to post your score!

entries.title: Descension

The game currently has 2 types of enemies, one boss, one weapon, an NPC and 2 powerups.

I kept track of progress on my blog (http://bigbadwofl.blogspot.com/) if you're interested.

Hope you enjoy it,
BigBadWofl

entries.title: Forgotten Memories
entries.description:
Look around you. Do you see them?

Blips out in the distance.

These are all that remain of those who have long since left this place.

And when you leave, you too will leave your own.

Like a message in a bottle...

A forgotten memory...

This is what it means to be alone.


IF YOU DON'T GET IT:

NONE of the blips you encounter have been hand crafted. Every one of them has been left behind by a real person--such as you--entering the realm, and not fictional beings thought up by a developer. 

There is no way to know who left them behind. No name, no link, no nothing. You explore alone. You leave alone. Despite being so close to what others have done, you never meet them, and never know their name.

The closest thing to any sort of connection you will ever have is when you leave, as a blip of your own will be left behind.

tl;dr - It's art. (Though really, it makes a LOT more sense if you read the above.)

WHAT TO DO:

Use wasd, arrow keys, or mouse buttons to move, and the mouse to look. It's recommended that you first look around to discover a blip.

Chrome highly recommended. This thing is iffy about if it wants to work with other browsers; I've had mixed success with Firefox.

OH, and for some reason the library I'm using locks your movement if you hit Q, and won't give it back. So don't hit Q. I wish I could have fixed that.


WHAT IS THIS?

Each blip is generated from previous users, based on how they explored while they were looking around. When you leave the page, your own exploration--your "memories"--will become another one of those blips.

It's rather difficult to call this a game, I suppose... I was trying to create something artsy that pushed the limits of what a game is, based on the definition that a game is an "Interactive Experience." I'm not sure how well I did.


THE TECHNOLOGY

This uses WebGL, PHP, Ajax, MySQL, HTML, and JavaScript.

Going into this, I knew NOTHING about WebGL, PHP, Ajax, or MySQL, and the last time I used HTML and JavaScript was ten years ago.

Don't ask me how I pulled it off.

Maaaaaajor thanks/credit/props to so many tutorial sites I can't even remember right now, but probably most of all to a man known as Paul Lewis. His WebGL tutorials are amazing, and not only that, but they made it possible for me to follow through with my idea. His website: http://aerotwist.com/ 

That said, please do try not to wreck my server. :)

EDIT - Because Internet Explorer does NOT support WebGL, I've added a notification for users that try to run the game on non-WebGL browsers. The only difference between it and the 48 Original version is the bit of code that handles that notification.

links.label: If The Server Is Down, Click Here

entries.title: Hikikomori Manager 2012
entries.description:
hikikomori (countable and uncountable; plural hikikomori)

   1. (uncountable) The phenomenon whereby an individual becomes a recluse from society, typically confining him- or herself to the house or a single room for a very long period.
   2. (countable) A reclusive person of this kind.

Hikikomori Manager 2012 allows you to live the life of a hikikomori.

* Be an outcast in Japanese society!
* Live a life of solitude, unable to leave your room without having a panic attack!
* Struggle against depression!
* Watch your life decay as you become poor and unhealthy!

There is no clear goal in this game. You might want to try to become a functioning member of society again, or just try to survive as long as possible.

(The latest version can be played at http://www.stack.nl/~vdz/hikki/ . Note that that version is not the version that should be rated for LD22!)

entries.title: I Fly Alone
entries.description:
This is my first game :)
A bird needs your help to find his family and food. Be careful with the food!

Notes:

entries.title: Motherless
entries.description:
Learning java as I went. As a result there's more than a fair share of bugs. Still, the base gameplay is fun, I just wish I had the time to make a larger level, implement more than one level and add sound.  

Getting interactions right was the key part though!

entries.title: My Own World
entries.description:
A tricky puzzle-platformer featuring a kid isolated in a plastic ball - his own world. His special ability is drawing psychokinetic borders, which work as platforms and block lasers.

5 levels crafted with love. Mouse to draw borders, WASD/Arrow keys to move, Esc to quit.

Made with Python+Pygame, used bfxr for sound effects. Start the game from /dist/isolate.exe.

entries.title: Never Alone
entries.description:
The player gets dropped into a cave, where he meets a peculiar man. The paradox of the situation becomes more and more clear the further you progress.

Controls: W A D


Journal note: I have not had time to keep a journal unfortunately, this is my first time competing so it was a bit tight, I have to make journal posts and a web version next time and improve the setup of my code. For now I have learned alot from this.

P.S. when downloading the zip, press the blue download button, not that crappy ad.

entries.title: Nowhere Man
entries.description:
Nowhere Man is a resource management game.  You walk out of your house one day to find that you are the last human being.  You have to scavenge food, plant crops, and find medicine in order to survive.  There is no ending, it's more of an endurance match to see how many days you can stay alive.  Honestly, it's mostly luck.

Sorry if the UI is a bit bland, spent all my time on little features and didn't get the time to add much polish.

entries.title: Paper Town
entries.description:
A psychological game that explores the mind who has pushed people completely away.

Complete live stream of the game development is available at http://twitch.tv/quill18

Post-mortem available here: 
http://towerdive.com/2011/12/19/paper-town-a-ludum-dare-post-mortem/
