entries.title: Split Party!
entries.description: A short puzzle game. Rotate the blocks to split them up from their friends, we don't want them partying too hard!

entries.title: The Darkness You Wander Alone
entries.description:
This is a short retro-acion-platformer. You are wielding the sword of swords to shoot your way though darkness and hordes of mysterious hostile creatures. Enjoy!
I spent most of the available time on that darkness/vignetting effect and on playing around with sine wave interference (which you can see in the title screen), but I think that was worth it. I'd love to add more content, a story and an actual ending - we'll see...
Also, this was not only my first Ludum Dare but this is the first game I ever released.

Controls: Arrow keys + Z + X

The tools I used:
- Game Maker 6.1
- Musagi and Audacity (sound)
- Gimp (some graphics)

This is Eelfroth, signing off. I was in! 

EDIT: The problem with the cut-off edges should be fixed now. Go to the options menu or press F5 to adjust the scale. 
If you have experienced low framerates, you can now press F10 to deactivate the dynamic vignetting effect and replace it with a single sprite. This damages the look and mood very badly - use it only if the game runs really slow! (press F11 to see the fps)

entries.title: The Lone Adventurer
entries.description:
(Requires Java)

For my first LD, my game was created in Java and uses the AWT library. You are alone against ghosts who roam in order to meet human flesh. Your mission is to find a secret chest which is in an isolated place.

Throughout your trip where some statues of kittens (\o/) are hidden, collect all the golden coins to open the passage towards the following level, otherwise you will remain alone for ever, roaming as the souls of the lost world in which you are. Good luck, because you can only rely on yourself.

entries.title: Vestige
entries.description:
The game is silent because I got a little carried away with feature creep and my body just can't code anymore...
This comp was a hell of a lot of fun, and I'm very happy with what came out the other end; Now is time for sleep.
Have fun reviewing it. :)
Quimby

Controls:
W/Up arrow - Tap to increase speed
S/Down arrow - Tap to decrease speed
A/D - Hold to roll your craft left or right
Mouse - Steer craft/aim weapon
Left mouse button - Click to fire laser (unlimited ammo)
Right mouse button - Hold to slow time (limited, recharges)

entries.title: Void
entries.description:
The objective of the game is to reach the sign in each level without dying.  The flying souls don't do anything, although they were intended to...

Controls:
W or Space: Jump
A and D: Move
Enter: Restart Level

entries.title: "Confessions of a Plumber"
entries.description:
As something of a nod to those fantastic/crap films from the 70's - I have put you in the position of a randy plumber, fixing many a lady's pipework, and leaving only waterworks. Have your wicked way with the neighbourhood while trying to not get beaten up, or married!

BASIC CONTROLS
WASD - Movement
Shift - Sprint
Mouse - Camera Control

FIGHT CONTROLS
Left Mouse Button- Punch
Right Mouse Button - Block

entries.title: A Typical Friday Night
entries.description: This is my first time entering Ludum Dare, so I decided to make an IF game. Growing up I always loved IF, and I figured this would be a good chance to get making one under my belt. You play similar to other IF games (think Zork). Use directions to move around (such as "east" or "e"), and use verbs to interact with with the environment, such as "sleep" and "take". It's a pretty short game, but see if you can find all the IF easter eggs :). There's also some hidden cats! I hope you enjoy!

entries.title: A Typical Saturday
entries.description:
Presenting my first game in a few months, and my first ever Text Adventure, "A Typical Saturday".

To clarify the tie-in with the theme, a typical Saturday for me is spent alone, wallowing in regret from the night before.

Controls are 1,2,3 (not the numberpad).

Limitations to this weekends's work:
-I was too hungover yesterday (the inspiration for my game)
-I only had 2 hours free today
-I've forgotten how to program

Enjoy,
Haighstrom.

entries.title: A.L.O.N.E.
entries.description:
This is my first time competing in the Ludum Dare. The story behind my game is your the last of your kind... your ship is low on Aloneium and you find some on a planet called Earth. BUT! There are hostile beings protecting the Aloneium. Your gonna need to fight for your survival... Don't forget to look for the special easter egg! :)

-KunoNoOni

entries.title: Alone in the Crane
entries.description:
Controls:
A, D - move crane
W - rotate element
S - drop element
ARROWS - Prince movement
SPACE - Prince jump

Windows:
ESC - quit game

A long time ago in galaxy far, far away there was very pretty princess who lived in big, big magic crane tower. 
She was there alone and nobody cared to visit her.
Every day she was looking from the top of her tower for handsome prince, who will save her and provide entertainment.
Will you be her Prince Charming?

entries.title: Alone in the War
entries.description:
Alone in the war is an unfinished game developed for LD22 Jam. It is a strategy game where your decisions will increase your economy or decrease your worker's happiness.

We cannot finish the game and it's still in development. There aren't enemies and loose condition it's difficult to reach. It's a kind of sandbox for our micro-engine developed for this compo.

"Enjoy" it if you can and thanks for reviewing it.

Post-mortem post: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/22/post-mortem-alone-in-the-war/

Executable: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2427705/ld22.zip
Source code: https://github.com/ultrayoshi/ld22

Game developed by @ultrayoshi and @ReikVal

Special thanks to Sory and Rul.

entries.title: Alone with Aliens
entries.description:
Numpad/arrow keys: Move. Hit things to interact with them (e.g. Consoles, tables with things on them.)

I: Show inventory 

F: Fire your gun. (Move the cursor to an alien.) 

L: Leave with your goods. (Only near your arrival craft.) 

';': Pick up an item on the ground

entries.title: Crawl the Dungeon
entries.description:
Sadly it's unfinished!

This is my entry to this Ludum Dare. You'll need XNA 4.0

The plan was to create a party based dungeon crawler where your teammates would die one by one, leaving only you eventually.

However, it has become an almost fully moddable solo dungeon crawler, with randomized loot and 1 dungeon level with a bunch of generic enemies and ugly items. Also, the world is set in space so there's no sound (:D)

There's still lots of things I wanted to do, but I ran out of time. In any case, I hope you enjoy what did make it into this game!


Update: 25/12/2011

I've uploaded a christmas edition. This has graphical changes, but also some extra features, so do not rate it! The biggest difference is that it's now semi-turnbased. The world pauses when you're not doing anything, so you can think of a way to get rid of those pesky mages. In any case, it's now beatable. Enjoy!

entries.title: Dungeon Dan
entries.description:
I was skiing all weekend so this is what I managed to cook up despite the fact! there's only one level but everything should work fine. Spent quite a bit of time making the song rather than adding more levels. This is effectively a remake of my LD16 attempt: tower quest. I wanted to explore the grid-based and non-grid-based interactions a bit more. Since I only had about 5-6 hours to work on this I didn't very many levels in (only 1!) and the theme isn't very present. Other than the fact that Dan is alone in this dungeon. Hopefully it's well polished though and doesn't have any major bugs. 

Being away all weekend with limited computer time as well as no internet means I couldn't exactly be community active either. So I don't expect to do too well ratings wise, but w/e I had a ton of fun making this small sample and a ton of fun with the music (oh and a ton of fun skiing too).

EDIT: Big thanks to SpaceManiac for hosting the game on his servers for you to download

entries.title: Ego Sum
entries.description:
My first ever Ludum Dare game. It's about a small, pixelated thing who wants to be alone. And then the monsters come.

The graphics were made in MSPaint and the sounds with sfxr.

Features:
* A somewhat epic story
* About 10 minutes of exciting gameplay
* Seven enemies to defeat (they're in each corner of the pattern)
* Cute pixel graphics
* A parallax starfield
* Only 5 colours!

This is a short, quiet game of exploration.

You wake up in a strange stone castle with a note from someone named Lisa.

Written in C++ using an outdated version of sfml 2.0.

entries.title: One Of A Kind
entries.description:
Update: The soundtrack for One of a Kind is available at my Bandcamp site at http://ddrkirbyisq.bandcamp.com/album/one-of-a-kind-original-soundtrack

Hey everybody!

Here's my entry for LD22, Titled "One Of A Kind".  It's a puzzle platformer based around a mechanic of "uniqueness".  The style is somewhat similar to that of "The Company of Myself".

Note: the opening screen says "I am not very special."  You might miss it if you press buttons and such during load.

=====

OS specific notes:
Windows users: *You should be totally fine.*
If running OneOfAKind.exe doesn't work for you, give OneOfAKind_VS.exe a shot. (You'll need the .NET Framework for that version)

OSX users: *You should be totally fine, as long as you extract OneOfAKind.app from the .dmg file.  Do not try to run it within the .dmg.*
Note, however, that the download is ridiculously large (150MB) and the .app is even larger (>400MB), because I had to fit the entire Mono install in there.  Just delete it after you play.

Linux users: Tao seems to be broken under 64-bit, so I don't know if you can run if you're using 64-bit.  If you're under 32-bit, it runs fine if you install mono.  You need to install the following packages:
mono-runtime
gtk-sharp2
libsdl1.2debian-all
libsdl-mixer1.2
libsdl-ttf-2.0-0
libsdl-image1.2

Alternatively, you can run the windows version using wine.  Simply use winetricks mono2.8 to install mono and you should be good to go.

If you can't get the game to run, you can just watch a video of me playing through the game here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B6WRB7Vl3dE

(Note: Sorry, there's no "quit" button--just close the application window to exit)

If your keyboard is super-duper-weird, you can use Enter instead of Space or R instead of Escape.

======

I don't think the puzzle difficulty is quite too hard...there's a little more you can do with it, but obviously I don't have time for more than there is right now.

Fun fact: if you want to have a shot at editing the levels, you can edit the images under the /lvl directory.  The level[x].png files are the tile maps, while level_backdrop[x].png is the background that gets displayed.

Apologies for any weird glitches or bugs you run into--this was made in less than 48 hours after all (closer to 24, considering how much time I spent flailing around before I actually got started).

Framework/tools used:
-C# with SDL.net and Mono
-Visual Studio 2010 to develop, MonoDevelop for release
-Graphics done in GIMP
-Music in FL Studio
-Sound with FL Studio/bfxr

My first LD, and it was a lot of fun, despite being terribly unprepared for it and freaking out when I couldn't seem to think of any puzzles.

--DDRKirby(ISQ)

=====

Update: the download links now point to v1.01, which adds no content but fixes a bug that causes the game to crash when you reach the ending (yeah...).

If you really want to be strict about the 48 hour guideline (i started late anyhow), you can get v1.00 here:
Windows: http://db.tt/8o9U8Tzz
Linux: http://db.tt/rlrftTaw
OSX: http://db.tt/l85ISncw <- requires Mono + SDL frameworks

entries.title: The Lonely Gun
entries.description:
A LOT OF PEOPLE ARE ASKING WHY THEY RANDOMLY DIE. They don't, read the instructions before playing! (below and in readme).

Created in C++ with Ogre3d engine with SdkTrays GUI with my own gui images. Please, don't be afraid to rate just because it's not very good (it's my first ever game, any thoughts are appreciated)!

The Lonely Gun - you control a character ( = cube) that has a gun that makes anyone it hits lonely, meaning whenever you hit an enemy with it, every enemy *except* the one you hit disappears!

A and D to move, space to fire, right mouse button to move camera. Further instructions are in README. To run the game, look in /bin for LonelyGun.exe.

INSTRUCTIONS:

a and d to move, space to fire, right click to move camera (only if you have to, it is probably better not to).

The weapon you have is the "Lonely Weapon" - anyone it hits is immediately lonely, meaning every enemy except the person you hit
disappears. Enemies will spawn randomly every ~1 second (depending on what I change it to and forget to change the readme), and you need to stop them from getting past you bearing in mind the lonely weapon.

You have 100 health. Each enemy takes 30 health if it goes past not (not if it hits you). If you didn't know, you are the blue cube
and the enemies are the red cubes. Score is how long you survived, in seconds.

TIP: Wait for the ones at the back to span to remove all of them and give you the most time afterwards. Hitting the nearest one may make it impossible to save yourself from
being hit,

ABOUT
Why is it in 3D? I have no experience with any 2d engines. Don't ask me why I decided to start with this one (Ogre3d), but this is my first game in C++ :D It was planned to
be a lot more developed, but I completely underestimated how bad I was at C++, having only been using it about an hour a week for a few months.

entries.title: A Manor of Speaking
entries.description:
!IMPORTANT! 
I have found that clicking outside the game window stops the game from working properly. Press F4 to make it fullscreen and then you can't click outside the window, but if you must play in a window, just watch where that little white dot is when you click. Though you don't need to click except at the menu, so ...

I suppose it also occurs if you alt-tab, not sure.

-----
This is basically a LD48 submission that needed to be bugfixed.

Music was created using Avairy's music maker (drum loops, samples etc), sound effects generated with DrPetter's SFXR. Everything else created by me.

Originally submitted for the Ludum Dare Comp (finished the game with hours to spare) but a major bug that my friend found the next morning AFTER the submission caused me to patch it up and submit for the Ludum Jam instead. :( Oh well.

A HTML5 port may be available soon.

It's half-baked but you can at least see what I was trying to do. Click through the brain menu, only 1 of the 4 stages was complete so any that you choose will take you to that one. This was a great lesson in having a more reasonable scope for a 48-hour competition.

Go shoot some creepy faces! Enjoy! So sleeepy, going to pass out now.

Ahhhh I needed more time :/ Never mind. Game is playable, up to 5 levels. W,S,D,A or arrows to move, ENTER to suicide, space + W,S,D,A or arrows - removes next block. Have fun, good luck.

Made with: 
slick2d
gimp
paint.net
eclipse
java

entries.title: Alone in the Dark
entries.description: My first Ludum Dare game. Twas fun, and I'll expand the game after this. Story Driven game so read the text....and don't get too lonely. Is the entry a winner? Probably not...but it was still fun to make and I am going to do some serious upgrading of graphics and gameplay with my partner(graphics artists) to turn this into a really cool game later.

entries.title: Alone in the Shadows
entries.description:
You find yourself in a dungeon, with a flashlight, torches and guns. The shadows are your enemy. Survive.

EDIT: VS2010 Runtime Environment Required! Download here:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=5555

entries.title: Ascent
entries.description:
Your friend has just perished in the bitter cold. You must continue this treacherous expedition alone. 

Climb to the top of the mountain using the arrow keys to move and spacebar to attach your safety line to the marked points in the mountain-side. If your stamina drops too low, you are apt to slip and fall. When dangling from the safety line, press up repeatedly to climb to climb up the rope and regain your footing. Be careful not to stress the rope the attachments may come undone!

entries.title: Chamber of Remorse
entries.description:
Synopsis:
In Chamber of Remorse, you play as a character who is currently suffering from amnesia,
you awake in a dark chamber and have no idea as to how you got there... As far as you know, the only way out, is through...
---------------------------------------------------------
Basically, take Amnesia, and make it a top down game and add spells.
This game took me most of the 48 hours and I barely got sleep,
it has 3 unique levels and a very hard boss fight at the end, and trust me, even though there's only 3 levels, the dark maze-like feel of the game will make it quite time consuming :D
I'm most proud of myself for the lighting system I put in this game, it took me like 4 hours to get working right.

entries.title: Diamond Darkness
entries.description:
I was going to add much more to this, (including a title screen :P) But I was pretty busy, but I like the game a little so I decided to enter it anyway :D

Controls:
W - Walk Towards Mouse
S - Walk Away From Mouse
Left Click - Shoot
Mouse Wheel - Change Color

Your color must match the zombie-things you're shooting at in order to kill them.

The goal is to find as many (randomly placed) diamonds as you can in the randomly generated map.

Enjoy :P

entries.title: Friends
entries.description:
Small game created in 5 hours.
You're completely alone. You should find some friends to beat the game.
Controls:
UP/W - Go up.
DOWN/S - Go down.
LEFT/A - Go left.
RIGHT/D - Go right.

Nuprahtor's comment:
"Breaking the fourth wall"

You can take this as a hint.

entries.title: Ghost
entries.description:
A small point-and-click adventure game about a ghost wandering alone in the world trying to get one more chance. 


Programming, Graphics and Animations with Flash.

Sounds with Cfxr (Sfxr for mac) and Cubase.

Music with Cubase.

entries.title: Headphones On
entries.description:
Headphones create a bubble of solitude. On the bus, at work, while developing LD games - everyone can be as alone as they want, at any time.

Known issues pending fix: Final score display not working.
Features missing: more enemy types&interactions, music.

entries.title: Joe Vs. Loneliness
entries.description:
I'm 13, and this was my first Ludum Dare. Originally I was making a survival horror platformer, but I had trouble with the inventory system on Sunday afternoon and realized that I wouldn't be able to finsih, so I gave up and started over. And this is the product of me starting over. It's silly and short, but just have fun. Took about 6 hours.

Press Space to skip the cutscene in the beginning.

I apologize for the crappiness of the endings, I made those during crunchtime.

Source is included in the Windows download.

Made with GameMaker Lite.

(Sorry for the infinite jump, I'd fix it if I could, but I consider changing the game after the deadline to be cheating)

entries.title: LEFTalone
entries.description:
The apocalypse is here! Zombies took over the world and you are the only one left. Fight your way to safety!

This entry is not complete, but fully playable. I am pretty happy with how it turned out, considering it was my first LD48. Much more content was planned (more levels, a score counter and some music for example), but I encountered some complex issues that made me run out of time. I may add some of the planned features post-mortem. The game is written from scratch using C++/SFML.

I am really thrilled to test all those games! Hats off to every brave human being participating in LD48/LD72. It is really hard, but I had a lot of fun.

Have fun testing! :)

entries.title: Luto Hominus
entries.description:
Hey, have an awful unfinished game.
Use arrow keys to move, space to pick up/throw block. Take the block to the little firey hole (a kiln) and drop it in. Then pretend you made a little golem. THE END (Ctrl to make a new map)

entries.title: Rid me of You
entries.description: The theme left me clueless. I am still clueless. During the time I made this game, I came up with an excellent idea for another game which didn't fit this competition's theme. This competition forced me to go through with something and inspired me to do other things with my developing skills. Thank you, Ludum Dare. Enjoy my crappy game.

entries.title: Shadow Glow
entries.description:
Point your flashlight at things with the mouse.
Walk with WADS.

Find your way in the dark.

entries.title: Shrimp
entries.description:
An entry for LD48 #22. 

You are a little boy alone in a scary place. Find the green light to the next level before the darkness gets you! Use matches to keep the shrimp at bay.

No time for a title screen, I'm afraid. Push "z" to light a match, "x" to count matches (you should hear a tone for each match you have). Works on Android if you have a keypad. 

Sound effects from sfxr. 

Base library is enchant.js from Ubiquitous Entertainment, which I re-investigated thanks to the prompting of Kazuhiro Sera (@seratch). 

Art, story, and code by Paul McCann (@polm23). 

Match counting idea from a recent Auntie Pixelante article.  

Maze generation heavily guided by Wikipedia article on same. 

Idea of giant shrimp in darkness inspired by the light shining through the fronds of a palm tree on a stormy night as I was half asleep. 

Idea of world destroyed by horrible mind-reading shrimp in meteorite based on true events. 

Thanks for playing! This is the first LD I've finished a game for and I'm looking forward to the next one. -POLM

P.S.: If you beat it and you'd like a New Game Plus, click this link and then play again:

http://www.youtubeloop.com/v/ZnHmskwqCCQ

(Please note New Game+ is not within Compo rules.)

entries.title: Spaceman Samotny
entries.description: It may be impossible to win, but I tried my best to test it all the way. I updated libgdx to the latest to fix things not working on iOS/Mac.

entries.title: The Best Of Us
entries.description:
It is STRONGLY reccommended that you play this game wearing HEADPHONES. Otherwise, make sure you can HEAR SOUND. It is INTEGRAL to your enjoyment of the game!

A multi-genre sci-fi tale of heroism and self-sacrifice, 'The Best Of Us' is really four games in one. A scrolling Shmup, twin-stick shooter, rail-shooter and 2D platformer all in one, tied together with full voice acting, cutscenes and a minimalistic soundtrack. 

All control-related instructions are handled in-game.

Also, there's a kitten in Chapter 2.  

Enjoy!

entries.title: The Diary
entries.description:
We are four guys that are very new to game development and tried to join this competition. We had to face the truth at 21.53 on 19th that we were not able to finish the game. 

Things that we leant: 
*Dont try to learn AI programing during the contest.
*Start developing right away and dont wait for graphics.
*Dont focus on one or two major bugs which took forever to fix.

Anyways here is out Game. The state of the game is very WIP and heavily ALPHA so if you play the game bare with us.
We're happy to receive any type of critics as we are to learn not to win :P

Controlls: WASD and E to USE things.
Aim with mouse and shoot with left mouse buttom and reload with right.
M to mute the music!

CREDITS : 

Programing: David Skeppstedt, Andreas Brommund
Graphics: Anton Begnert
Sound: Tim Ã�st Lundkvist

entries.title: The Last Leech
entries.description:
You are the last Leech -- the last of your kind. You are alone in enemy lands.
Their numbers are great, and you have no ally. You do have your one ability:
 murdering the magically gifted transfers their knowledge to you. The question is --
 can you survive?


Controls:
Left mouse button: Cast spell
Right mouse button / scroll wheel: Switch spell
WASD: Move

Spells:
Water - Deals heavy damage in a single projectile
Fire - Creates a damaging stream
Ice - Blocks enemy movement
Lightning - Damages targets and bounces between enemies
Acid - Creates a damaging pool

Enemies
The Hawk, with its ability of flight, can swiftly fly over ice and acid pools.
The Hunger wants to eat your soul, but is very slow
The Guardian, even slower than The Hunger, produces energized projectiles that will seek you out.

Created with:
ENIGMA via LateralGM (http://enigma-dev.org)
GIMP - Graphics
BFXR - Sound effects
Chronolapse - time lapse

EDIT:
Added Mac/Linux build (not extensively tested)
Added timelapse

EDIT2:
Linux 64 bit version is available here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1215621/TLL_Linux_x64.zip

** DEPENDENCIES:
OpenGL, Mesa LibGLU, OpenAL

** There are some weird bugs with the Linux versions, sorry:
1) The game runs at the correct speed, but because I developed it under Windows which ran faster, the game is slower paced on Linux which makes some of the weapons act stranger.
2) There is something extremely weird under Linux with the interaction between the Hawks and the Ice... they kind of twitch around a lot and may disappear completely.

entries.title: The Sheep & The Peach
entries.description:
A little story about a Sheep and a Peach. A depressing little 15 minutes that should suck the happy out of anyone's day.

Now with a gameplay / walkthrough video. Warning: spoils the entire game!

entries.title: You Can't Go Through The Door
entries.description: Controls: Home Row

entries.title: .Journey to Polygonia
entries.description:
"Journey to Polygonia" is the story of a lone triangle, Geometri, whom, when stranded in Dodecaen territory, must bravely journey home to his friends, Spheri and Quadra.  During his journey home, he must avoid the dangerous minions of the tyrant King Dodeca,  the Vertizez.  Along the way, Geometri must steal the dimensional shadow crystals to sap Dodeca of his power, end the tyrant's reign, and restore Quadra, the true heir, to the throne.

Note: Didn't finish building any levels beyond the Hexagian Caves.

AUDIO STOPS AFTER 10 MINUTES DUE TO HTML5 LIMITATIONS. Sorry.

entries.title: Abandoned Planet

Very short game. Has audio. Please enjoy.

Some machines crash when the game exits, and those machines might not have sound either. I am currently looking into this issue.

entries.title: Alone in a cave
entries.description:
Alone in a cave is a puzzle game with three possible endings.
The goal is to get out of the cave without getting caught by robots. If you have three keys of either kind you can unlock a different ending.

Known bugs: If you stand on a blue signal that is in the reach of a robot, you will get stuck. (You can press R to restart if that happens.)

Note: Blue signals, and mice with blue ears can't be picked up. Press R to restart a level. Press F5 to save and F6 to load.

entries.title: Alone in a cave
entries.description:
Hey everybody, here is my game. Keep the monsters (the evil black things with red eyes) away from the person, who is trying to get too the far right of the screen. Features randomly generated terrain/dirt textures, high scores, and difficulty levels. Enjoy!

Tools:

Sfxr
Game maker 8.1

P.S, please don't use any of my code with out permission from me! :)

entries.title: Ancient Rover
entries.description:
For this game you'll need to turn up your speakers.

This game was made with C and SDL.

I wrote this from scratch, got stuck, looked at some of my previous code and it didn't help. Then I didn't have enough time to finish in 48 hours, so here's my jam entry.

If you beat the game and want to replay it, you can skip the essential black screen narratives by pressing 's'.

EDIT: I'm still porting to Windows, but I will.

entries.title: Buttercup's Castle
entries.description: Ludum 22 Jam Entry. Rob Maher - Pixels, Kyle Bostelmann - Programming, Trent - Programming. Princess Buttercup, is all alone at the top of her castle. Waiting for a bold adventurer like yourself to come save her. Robin: Oh, princess let down your hair and I will save you

entries.title: Carry Meow Home
entries.description:
To download:
Follow the link, then go to File -> Download Original

For the Windows version, you play the game by running CarryMeowHome.exe 

*****************************************************

In this game, you are a kitten.  A kitten who has become lost and is all alone without its mommy-cat.  Your goal is to find and return to Mommy.

There's a problem, though.  You're tiny and weak... you can't move very far, or very fast.  

Yet, there's a solution!  These humans think you're SUPER CUTE, and then want to carry you home!  If you meow [Space Bar], the ones that hear you will run to pick you up!  Don't let them carry you off, though!  You need to find Mommy!  Let them carry you for a while, but if they don't seem to be going the right way, hop out of their arms [Space Bar] and look for another ride!

Good luck, kitten!

entries.title: Don't Touch Me
entries.description: A silly thing created in an hour. Move around with WASD or arrow keys. Grab her!

entries.title: Fur Ever Alone
entries.description:
My first Ludum dare and first game made fully. Really enjoyed it so will be taking part next time.

Full stream recording is at - http://www.twitch.tv/tentaclenoises

Time-lapse!: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qo0PUvKisjc
Fur Ever Alone Timelapse at x264 speed - Ludum Dare #2

java -Djava.library.path=. -jar Fur_Ever_Alone.jar

entries.title: GloW
entries.description:
An adventure game where you need to help a tiny rotery bot to freedom, from junk to starlight! :P

Instructions:
Arrow keys to rotate bot, up key to jump and space to shoot!
You can move the character sideways while in air using
left and right arrow keys.

My first Ludum Dare and it was AWESOME! Thanks a lot to everyone who participated and made this a great experience for everyone involved!

Too bad I didnt get to finish that boss in the end.
There are still some bugs left. For example, enemie mines 
dont seem to react when you shoot at them, but shoot enough
and they will die.
Well, next time! :D

Cheers everyone!

-MaxDev

http://pdude2k7.blogspot.com/

P.S - The windows link needs no install, just unzip and play :D

entries.title: I used to speak to the wall
entries.description:
I used to speak to the wall ( a game about Schizophrenia ) is my second participation in the Ludum Dare. Like the first time, it was a total blast !

IUTSTTW is less a game than a short interactive story with no real goal. Find your way in the mind of the subject, and make the good choice. The story has three different endings, either good or bad. 


There are many things I would have loved to add, such as music or more interaction, but ultimately ran out of time. I also apologize for the english mistakes I left there and there :/

IUTSTTW has been made with FlashPunk.


Feel free to discuss about your understanding of the story in the comments !


EDIT : Like rawbits pointed out in the comments, the game is more about DID than Schizophrenia, sorry for the misunderstanding..

EDIT 2 : Seems like some people on Twitter are searching for the 3rd ending without success. Actually, it doesn't come exactly as I would have wanted to.. This will be corrected in the improved version.

For now, I can give you a ( big ) hint. Try ( and I said "try" :p ) to kill both personnality, then search for a special object.

entries.title: I Was Wondering on Floating Islands

The game is a treasure colletting game on floating randomly generated islands. 
To move use the arrow keys and if you press SPACEBAR + direction you can dig in that direction.
Once you have collected all the treasures in a map a new map will be created :)
Hope you enjoy this :) Mark :)

entries.title: Margrets Runaway

Margret decides that life is something more! She have heard that there is three old artifacts that could make her understand everything. Help her find the artifacts! It's not as easy as it sounds!

Soo, the goal is to ascend. To ascend you need a Sky-Beam and to get a Sky-Beam you need three artifacts. These artifacts is not very easy to get to. Two of them is craftable and the last you have to find in the world (rare find). The materials to the artifacts are rare and you need the right recepies. You walk around and klick the various objects in your surroundings to search them for stuff. At the same time you need to focus on staying alive and have your stamina up at all times to not start to lose life.

entries.title: The Solitude of Sam Smith
entries.description:
Sam Smith is going through a rough patch and is taking some time alone to collect thoughts; help out by providing comfort, avoiding grief and allowing distractions only when they're needed.

A Life Apart is a short atmospheric game about a spirit that must make amends for the horrible life it lead.

(In order to pass the gate in the 5th room, you must light all the torches)

entries.title: Alone
entries.description:
Your plane crashed and your are all alone, evil creatures shows up, what do you do?

Run - Left/right Arrows
Jump - X
Aim - Up/Down arrows
Shoot - C

entries.title: Alone - Save your family from an Icy imprisonment
entries.description:
Ok, so here's the deal.  I used Construct 2 as my game making software, think of it as GameMaker HTML 5, only better IMO.  I didn't get to any of the sound unfortunately as I had some neat ideas planned.  The premise was supposed to be that an alchoholic verbally abuses his family, and goes to storm out of the house, when he knocks himself out by tripping.  He then wakes up in this prison to find his family frozen in ice.  All he has is his bottle to try and save them.
My ideas were bigger than my 24 hours (stupid work!!) allowed me to implement.  There was gonna be demon family, a good and bad ending, and you'd have to face yourself!  Ooo and there were going to be a couple brief cutscenes.
All things considered, given the fact that this is my first attempt at any kind of game making contest, let alone a timed one, I'm very proud of my entry here.  I hope people find it fun to play, there was no time for bug testing or playthroughs of any kind.  So if it winds up being incompletable then I sincerely apologize.  Enjoy.
You need Construct 2 to view the source.  This can be found at www.scirra.com, they offer a free version of the software.

Control

Arrows - Move
Shift - Jump
Z - Attack

I'm a member of Fireskies Studios, so feel free to come by our brand new website at...
http://ganzfeld.ca/fireskies
...and our youtube channel at... http://www.youtube.com/user/FireSkiesStudios

entries.title: Cat Match
entries.description:
Help your Nan clear out the stray cats that were keeping her company while the rest of the family were on holidays.

Controls:
Click on two cats that are the same color and adjacent to send them on their way.
Click during cut scenes to speed them up.

Coded In Java from scratch. No engines, no development environment, no prior experience.

Madame Margeurite and Her Magnificent Menagerie, a roving circus troupe, have set out on an Arctic voyage from Paris to the World Fair in the New World. En route, in her haste, the ship charges headlong into an iceberg. 

None survive the plunge into the icy Arctic, or so the newspapers say...

entries.title: Drink Alone

Controls:
A/D or Left/Right Arrow Keys - Move Left or Right
Move mouse left or right to balance
Click on bros to punch them so you can drink alone.
Click on the bartender to buy a drink when you have enough money.
Click on a drink to drink it.

Excite Marathon (individual caregory)

[Flixel 2.55]

entries.title: Filling Time
entries.description:
Time by yourself can be fun and productive, but it can also lead to anxiety and loneliness.  Your goal in this game is to stay sane.  Keep yourself busy with the two mini-games to ward off anxiety, but be careful!  Making mistakes will cause you to more rapidly lose your composure.  
 
There is no real win condition; you can keep going forever.  There is however a definitive lose condition.  The look on your character’s face will clue you in to his current sanity level, as will the state of his surroundings.  You will know when you’ve lost and the game is over.  Even if you decide this game isn’t for you, it’s at least worth intentionally going insane to see the effects!
 
            There are two mini-games that can either help or harm your sanity.  Pressing LEFT and RIGHT in the main screen lets you switch between them, while pressing ENTER starts a given game.  Use the ARROW KEYS to navigate through the game and ENTER to activate the currently selected node.  If you do well, your characters sanity increases.  Do poorly, and it will decrease much more quickly.  When you’re done with a game, press ESCAPE to go back to the main screen.
 
            The computer allows you to solve simple, randomly-generated Boolean logic puzzles.  A red line represents a powered wire, while a white line is unpowered.  Pressing ENTER on one of the logic gates (nodes) cycles through the various logical operators: AND, OR, NAND, NOR, and XOR.  The objective is to set up all the gates so that current flows from the left all the way to the final node on the right.  Pressing SPACE during this mini-game will check your results.  If you’re wrong, you’ll lose sanity.  If you’re right, your sanity increases and a new puzzle is generated.
 
The bass lets you play the other mini-game: composing.  This allows you to write an accompaniment that is played alongside the game’s main music track.  This game’s display is analogous to staff paper.  The window represents one measure, with time moving forward from left to right.  You can turn on up to three simultaneous notes per rhythmic division (sixteenth note).  Note pitch increases as you move up the screen, with the bottom being a C.  The red lines represent chord tones; stay inside the harmony and your sanity will increase.

I’m not sure what else to say.  Sure it’s flawed/incomplete, but I think it’s pretty cool anyway!

entries.title: Friendship Snake
entries.description: Friendship Snake is a simple snake game. The game was done using the Processing.js framework and should work under most HTML5 canvas compliant browsers (IE9+, firefox, chrome etc). You can play the game directly in your browser by going to the web site.

entries.title: I Wanna Be the Fishy
entries.description:
You're a little fish, lost in the ocean, looking for his friends. 

It's meant to be rage-inducing, inspired by I Wanna Be the Boshy.   There are about 12 screens, plus a neat victory screen.

Hope you like it. =)

Tools: Haxic, Photoshop, bfxr

entries.title: Leave Me Alone!!!
entries.description:
==Description==
You're trying to play your video game but your mom keeps telling you to shut it down. Throw soda cans at her to make her leave you alone!

You "die" if you lose your concentration. You lose it faster with more people in your room. You regain it by being alone.

You gain score by playing your video game (surviving) and hitting your mom. You lose score if you hit yourself.

==How to play==
Windows: Unzip and run LeaveMeAlone.exe
Web: Click the link (you need Unity Web Player installed)

Click at the target (or near it) to throw soda cans

==Remarks==
The game was made with Unity and voxel art was drawn with Paint3D and converted with 3ds max. Sound was recorded with an iPhone.

This was my first ever 3D game and also my first try at Unity, so don't expect much. It's kinda half-finished but enough to be playable so I decided to submit anyways.

It was supposed to have fun dialogs/sounds and have more NPCs (dog, neighbour, little sister, guitar player) but time was barely enough to add mom :/

entries.title: Mama, I don't want to die alone...
entries.description:
Here is my entry for 22th LD. 
"Mama, I don't want to die alone..." is a platformer game in which you play a cat. This cat is telling you the story of a day he wouldn't forget of all his 9 lifes.

You'll progress by learning of your mistakes through one level (+1 intoductory with a lot of text to read to understand the cat's way of thinking + 1 concluding one)

/* Made with, Construct 2 Free version (Beta), Photoshop CS5, Illustrator CS5, Audacity, Otomata, sfxr, inudge.net, Audacity, my own voice, AND a lot of patience */

Works with IE, Firefox, Chrome
You'll can listen to the music on Chrome only
Doesn't seem to work on Safari

entries.title: Run Away
entries.description:
Run Away

Run away is a die and retry platform game.
You can't totaly control the main character because he is to scared to stop running.

I hope you will have fun playing the 5 levels and defeating the boss to the loneliness quest.
Two world to cross and foes to dodge, can you do it?

entries.title: Shadows in the Night
entries.description:
A 2D survival horror game about a boy facing his darkest fears at night!

Goal: Carefully sneak past the shadows, and escape from the nightmare.

Controls:
Walk : Click with Left Mouse Button. 
       WASD keys on the Keyboard.
       Moves slowly, but silently.

Run : Hold down Left Shift.
      Moves faster, but may alert a shadow.

Crouch : Hold down Left Ctrl.
         Hide behind obstacles to remain out of sight. 
	 Crouching makes Billy feel safer, and gradually      recovers health.

Interact : Space Bar 
Keys - Pick them up to progress to the next level.
Doors - Open them to progress to the next level.
Light Switch - Light stuns the shadows for 10 sec.


Description:
Every night, Little Billy is haunted by the same dream. He finds himself all alone, in an abandoned home, chased by frightening shadows that torture him until he wakes from the nightmare. Escape from the shadows, and survive the night!

entries.title: Shell
entries.description:
prototype on the theme of alone.

Ideally, you could collect the green lights. These represent the positive experiences in life. The light you control grows bigger. However there are also red lights perhaps representing bad experiences. When you collect these, they begin to form a shell around your light and your light becomes smaller. This makes it easier to block and avoid any kind of experience. As you get bigger, it becomes harder to avoid other lights. If you collect too many red lights, you disappear. If you form the total shell, you cut yourself off from the world. If you get big enough, you can break out of your shell. Otherwise, you just run out of time.

entries.title: Solitary Traveler On A Far Planet
entries.description:
This is turn-based game about lone spaceship pilot, who is searching for fuel for his spaceship on a far planet.
Press Escape during gameplay to see the controls.
Additional info:
To refill your energy, food; drill and radar charge - step on the center of spaceship.
Maximum depth is 90ft (9 levels). 
You don't need to collect ALL the fuel inside the planet. Needed amount of fuel is always lower. 
The game is really hard, you should be very attentive to win.

Windows version must work on:
Windows XP SP3
Windows Vista
Windows 7
for older Windows use version of this game, ported to java ("Linux" link above)
To run this game from linux terminal, cd to folder with downloaded jar, and execute: 
java -jar stoafp.jar

entries.title: Temple of Loneliness
entries.description:
CONTROLS
X : Select item in main menu
R : Reset room
Arrow keys : move around
C : Surprise! :)

GAME
You're a adventurer who got trapped into a temple, the Temple of Loneliness, and you want to get out, but getting out comes with a price. You have to complete a series of challenges (puzzles) in order to get to the treasure room, but avoid the spikes because you only got one life.

The game is simple with cute graphics. There's some known bugs that I couldn't solve in time but they are so little that you wont even see them.

Please leave your comments if you liked the game about what is cool or not and, if you want, vote for my game if you really think it's good and it deserve your vote ;).

Thanks.

entries.title: The Chosen
entries.description:
Alone you wake up on the shore of a deserted island only. A flock of strange creatures is shooting through the air.
A giant Pyramid is on the shore and waits for your ritual...

In the beginning I felt like an Island would be a good place to feel lonely and when i started to play around with the music I suddenly realized that being Alone does not have to be desolate and negative like i was thinking at first. It can be quite nice to feel yourself on the inside.. that lead me to abandon all ideas of unfriendly environments and led to the game like you can play it now.

I feel like there could be something more behind the Story of this game, so I will probably keep working on it.

Tools and asset creation:
I have been using Unity3d for development. I am using the built in lensflares I hope that doesn't violate the rules too much. I wanted to make my own but time didnt let me.
also for the textures I have used some photoshop brushes I have downloaded somewhere.

The music and sound effects are entirely made in FLStudio with the help of mostly synthesizers(the waves are entirely synth) but also a few samples i recorded with a h4n1 recorder(footsteps, birdsounds).

Models were done in modo, Textures in Photoshop

I will upload the whole Unity Project in the next days for current lack of bandwith.

Edit:

Instructions:
Use WASD and mouse for movement, q shows the map e hides it there is no mousecursor in the map menu sadly.

The objective of the game is to collect all 6 eggs and place them in the moulds before the the big stones. After each succesful placements you should hear a sound and after all placements the pyramid should have a light on top. Then go to the pyramid then to see the ending.

entries.title: The Secluded Cave
entries.description:
You find yourself alone in a strange cave.

Controls are AWSD and mouse.

No sound because it was crashing for some reason :(

entries.title: The Stars Need a Friend, Too...
entries.description: Navigate a lonely astroid belt in your ship.

entries.title: The Vestibule
entries.description:
A visual novel/adventure game made in Ren'py, The Vestibule is about the chance encounters made by the main character, Gale, on a voyage by train for the holidays.

Artwork by: Kate Holden (@darthmongoose)
Story/programming by: Bishop Myers (@projectbc)

entries.title: Wait up guys
entries.description:
My first ever Ludum Dare entry. 

Chase after your friends who ran off without you.

Controls:
   A   - left
   D   - right
 space - jump

Written using HTML5 and webgl, requires a webgl capable browser. Simply unzip the entire archive and open alone.html.
Tested using Google Chrome and FireFox.

This isn't what I'd call a finished game by any stretch of the imagination, but still... I did it :D
Plus, I learnt webgl and pixel art along the way, so can't complain.

entries.title: 5 DAYS
entries.description:
Survive on your own for 5 days until rescue arrives, and explore the station where you are stranded.

You are an astronaut, who, after an unfortunate accident, is stranded on Mars with barely any ressources. Can you deal with the hunger and the need for air? Or will you resort to barbaric measures only to survive?

Features:
- Immersive in-your-head ego-controls!
- A moderately-sized station to explore!
- Atmospheric soundtrack, pronouncing the inevitability of death
- Deep puzzles, challenging your wits!
- The largest amount of story I ever put in a game
- Completely unrealistic pixel-y graphics
- A cat in a pivotal role!

There are several possible ways of playing through this, and there is a definite win-condition. Figuring it out is part of the puzzle :-)

Controls:
WSAD - Movement
Mouse-Click - Interact
Arrow-keys - Movement
M - mute sound
Esc - pause


Also available for your convenience: A timelapse-video, and windows- and mac-standalone-files.

Have fun!

-Matthew

//UPDATES
I fixed a critical bug. The red door should open now, and the resolution-problems have been fixed.

//Music!
I uploaded the "lone ambient"-theme, for all your soundtrack-needs. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eH09xzlZBKo&feature=youtu.be

//I Got reviewed!
It a really nice piece, actually. Here's the google-translated version
http://bit.ly/rEhWYw
here's the original
http://bit.ly/vCjBKf

//And I wrote a post-mortem
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/27/how-2-days-of-crying-will-result-in-a-game-%E2%80%93-a-post-mortem/

//Another review!
Dogbomb made a 100-games-20-minutes video, 5 DAYS shows up at 11:57
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2EAB_gUi88A

entries.title: Alone in Translation
entries.description:
An experiment in text entry and story telling... in an action game.

We proved a whole bunch with this -- primarily that it's impossible to use typing input as the primary mechanism to a game that involves reading text as the primary output/reward mechanism.

Going to write up a post mortem on the finer points of that later in the week at http://www.36peas.com -- but suffice to say that while this didn't turn out as we thought it might, we figured out all kinds of interesting things along the way.

We used the the 2.0 beta of Cocos2d Mac, and the Component Architecture we've published previously here: http://www.36peas.com/blog/2011/9/15/lightweight-component-architectures-and-object-composition-i.html

entries.title: Best Friend
entries.description:
Move with the arrow keys, mute music with M.

*Source requires Flixel2.55 and Flixel Power Tools 1.9 to compile(FPT for the .mod player)

There are two endings! One ending is obvious the other, not so much...

entries.title: Challenge Accepted!
entries.description:
Started late sunday night so entered the Jam.

Top enemies are worth 2 kills. Bottom are worth 1.

Needs the XNA4.0 dist (or just having XNA4.0 is good enough)

entries.title: City of One
entries.description:
You play the role of a survivor of the zombie apocalypse. You must find food and ammo while fending off the nasty zombies to survive. Ultimately, you must explore the entire city, finding new guns and leveling up, in order to kill all the zombies.

The game is very replayable, challenging, and fun! Hope you enjoy! :)

Also, the game requires XNA to play. I think you can run the installer to get it to work.

Edit: Added the source and removed the source from the main file. Should make downloads faster by a lot.

entries.title: Co-op Land
entries.description:
A game that is great fun with a friend! What!? You have no friend?
...I guess you could still give it a try...

entries.title: Duckling
entries.description:
A simple platformer where you play as a duckling that has been left behind by it's mother, and is now all ALONE. Yeah, not the most deep, creative, or interesting use of the theme, but it works. 

Here are the controls, even though most are mentioned in the game:

Move: Left/Right
Jump: Up
Flap (can be done three times per jump): Up (in the air)
Swim: Up/Down/Left/Right
Restart Screen: R
Quit: Escape

This is my first LD entry so I didn't try for anything too complex. I hope you like it, anyway.

Find the secret kitten!

The results are in, and I got in the top 100 overall (#89). Cool! Plus, I got #20 in fun. Wow, that's amazing! Thanks so much to everyone who played, rated, and commented on this game!

entries.title: ExtraVertical
entries.description:
My LD22 entry explores the loneliness felt by those who thrive on attention and social admiration when their popularity fades. Oh, and it's set against the backdrop of an 80's themed skiing game!

Enjoy my first LD entry :)
Ps. I hope someone gets the title..

entries.title: Far From Home
entries.description:
My first ludem dare and also my first game (ever)! Seriously. Before this weekend I've only been through basic game tutorials, building things like pong and breakout. 

My day job is web development so I'm not new to design or html5/js. Anyway, I had a blast. Game dev is my new passion and I really wanted to push myself this weekend. Thanks!

Note: I only had to to develop and test in webkit based browsers, so use safari or chrome to see all the scaling and fancy CSS3 sprite animations.

entries.title: Find your stuff
entries.description:
A game where you are alone and have nothing except for your underpants. Find your stuff and make it to the exit! 

Comes complete with "Music"!

entries.title: Friend-Bot
entries.description: A fast paced "on the run" game. Stay ahead of the Friend-Bot. Some minor, but bearable bugs.

entries.title: Golgafrincham
entries.description:
Loosely based on Gravitar and H2G2 and very loosely on Lunar Lander.

You pilot a generation ship that is trying to populate a new world with a portion of its homeworld's survivors. Just the hairdressers, telephone sanitizers, and other important people. As you deploy pods your mass lessens with the physics manifestations that go with it.

The controls might take a bit to fully grok, but it is definitely possible to win, and even get all 10 pods deployed. Pulse width modulation is your friend.

The third screenshot shows a successful run of 10/7.

Unfortunately, the current build has a bug re: win condition. If you get 7/7 it will say you failed. The easy solution is to get >7 (which is actually what the code is looking for). :)

Please provide feedback.

entries.title: I Want To Be Alone
entries.description:
Controls:

Arrow Keys - Move
Space - Jump
Up - Pick Up Item/ Open Door/ Climb Ladder
Enter - Pause
Backspace - Reset Puzzle

Press Alt+Enter to Fullscreen

entries.title: ITS DONE!! Calisto is Alone
entries.description:
Calisto is The only survivor
He is alone


TOOLS: Unity3D, MonoDevelop, GarageBand, Sketchbook, BFXR

I have a lot of fun this weekend but...

-The game need some tweaks
-I need more food !

C ya

Thx for playing !!

entries.title: Josh The Fan-Tastic
entries.description:
Platform: Windows
Technology: XNA, C#
Resolution: 800x600 only
Requirements: XNA 4.0

Video:http://youtu.be/LW5uo67LXzE
Game Name:Josh The Fan-Tastic
Type:Sidescroller
Description:Josh is alone in a strange place, his only goal is to make it out alive.

If you're having trouble installing please install XNA 4.0 redist before the game: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/confirmation.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Last Stand
entries.description:
So my goal was to create something like a top down SURVIVAL MODE shooter. You can not win, the goal is to see how long you last and how many kills you can get before you are finally taken out.

I had some additional ideas that I wanted to do in addition to what you see here, but what are you going to do, 48 hours. :P I am very happy with what I got accomplished though, I had a hell of a lot of fun with it and I hope you guys enjoy playing it!

To put this together I used Java + LWJGL along with SlickUtil for texture and sound loading. I used Paint.NET for the artwork, sfxr for sound effects and atrk-bu for music. I also used BMFont for creating font textures and ChronoLapse for the timelapse.

Thanks!

entries.title: Little blue box
entries.description: A game about a miserable blue box, that needs a friend..

entries.title: Not A Soul in the World
entries.description:
WARNING: This game uses the HTML5 Audio library, and will not work in all browsers. I've only had time to test it in Chrome. Sorry if it doesn't work in your browser of choice :-(

I don't know what possessed me to make a text-based game this time, but here it is.

In "Not A Soul in the World", you play the part of a psychologist talking to the first mind successfully uploaded into a computer (by none other than the Kurzweil Institute, of course). Unfortunately, there is a problem: for some reason, the patient believes that he is an AI program and not a human. Your objective is to make the patient realize that he is human, by uncovering strong memories from his past.

Stuff used: Aptana Studio, HTML 5 Boilerplate, jQuery, WebPutty, Google Fonts, some small JS libraries (credited in source), Finale Notepad, BFXR, some public domain sounds, Paint.NET

links.label: Web (w/ hints and cross-browser audio support)

entries.title: Someone To Love
entries.description:
You're a small, lonely kitten, looking for someone to love. It's a short game with FIVE different endings, depending on your actions (not very complicated though). One full playthrough should take no more than 10-12 minutes (note that finishing the game depends on events done, rather than amount of fish). One of the endings is an easter egg. :)

It's my second entry in LD48 and first game using Flixel. See my journal (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/marudziik/) for more info.

BTW. See that progress bar on the top? When it's full, next event will occur, providing you're in the right place (usually near/far from the human). After a few (12 or so) such events, the game will end.

entries.title: Spirit In Mansion
entries.description:
Inspired by "Fatal Frame". Created in Java.

NOTE: If the ghost doesn't move, it's not bug. Since I use Java, it should be able to run on linux and OS/X too but haven't tried it.

EDIT: 
+ Because an incidentally mistaken on sprite rule, I took time to fix it so I changed this to Jam entry for fair's sake.
+ changed the host to dropbox for easier life.

Thanks for trying this creepy game. Cheers!

entries.title: The Rescue
entries.description:
The Rescue is basic story driven platformer. I experimented with a couple things to see if they would create a good mood and I feel like they did. I use a color palette of white, grays, and black. I also worked with a tilesize of 8x8. Those two things ended up working nicely together.

I don't really want to give anything away about the actual game, so you will just have to download it.

Made in XNA, so it is currently Windows only, although I am working on porting to other systems using MonoGame.

Controls
========
Movement - WASD/Arrows
Jump - Z or Space
Exit - Escape
Fullscreen - F

entries.title: This Sentence is False
entries.description:
Oh no! It's the future and you need to do stuff!

Edit:
Works on Chrome now!

Apparently Chrome hated my flash embedding tags, so I fixed those. The game itself has not been altered, only the HTML surrounding it.

entries.title: Tomes of Solitude
entries.description:
It's a game about a wizard in search of power. You need to collect the 5 Tomes of Solitude. There are three bosses you have to fight in order to beat the game.

Controls:
  - arrow keys, to move
  - z, use a spell tome
  - 1-5, select a spell tome
  - escape, quit/return to main menu

entries.title: A Date With Zombies
entries.description:
You are the sole survivor of a zombie apocalypse, and must survive for as long as possible.

Controls:
P - Pause/Upgrade Screen
WASD - Move
If your using mouse controls (enabled by default), use the mouse to aim and fire, otherwise use the arrow keys.

Edit: Not completely sure if this is allowed, but minor bug fix. The second upgrade for the pistol had the wrong number displayed next to it to start. Should be 3000$ not 2500$.

Edit2: Removed Kongregate link as the game has been updated on that site, and would no longer be the LD22 game.

entries.title: A Rift in Space
entries.description:
You are stranded alone, in an asteroid field, and must gather parts to repair your warp drive. However...?

This was heavily inspired by the amazing Metrojd mini-game by Daniel Remar. I wanted to do a lot more with it, and explore the concept more deeply, but halfway through I had to fix a broken audio engine and then realized my shader pipeline was much more broken than I had initially thought.

This game uses OpenAL for sound.

UPDATE: No more crash on exit or alt-tab breakage. I've fixed a couple of bugs in the graphics engine, optimized the physics and turned off vsync and yielding by default (although you can still change the settings in config.ini). I've also made it so you can turn off the audio and enable small nebulas, which makes run a lot faster on integrated GPUs.

entries.title: A sub-par adventure
entries.description:
SPA is a point-and click adventure (and my first entry into Ludum dare). It was made in just under 48 hours, with as few bugs as I want to think about.

NOTE: Because I'm new to this, I've had to package the source code only. You can, however, still run the game via compiling, so it sort-of works.

entries.title: A Tale of Seven Kittens
entries.description:
I created a Wolf3D type engine and added RPG elements. This is a simple dungeon crawler. The dungeon is procedurally generated using the name you type in during the intro as a seed.

Made from completely from scratch using opengl for graphics + FMOD for sound.

Only pre-existing code was a small module that handles the loading and playing of sounds. This was declared in a blog post before the contest started. 

My take on the theme 'Alone' was that of a lone hero. But the hag in the intro brings the 'being alone' theme into the game in two additional ways.

Controls: 
Movement -- Cursor Keys
Fire/Use -- Control
Select Item -- Number keys 1-7
Exit -- Escape.

The mouse can also be used with the inventory.

I've play tested it a little, to verify that everything works, and crudely balance the three player classes. 

I hope you enjoy it! I've certainly enjoyed making it. :)

entries.title: Afrocity Atrocity
entries.description:
This is my entry Afrocity Atrocity.

Controls:
ARROWS - Drive
CONTROL - handbrake

Objective:
tl;dr - Find the red gem in 'night mode'

Wreck havoc to get the havoc meter to the threshold.
Then, you have 5 seconds to build up havoc more!
The more havoc you are able to wreck, the more time you can spend in Atrocity.
Min is 5 seconds, full bar is 20 seconds.
Use the time to look for Atro Gem while in Atrocity!
It appears somewhere else each time.
Reach it in time to win!
Don't crash cars in Atrocity, or you run out of people.
When there is no one around to wreck havoc upon, you lose.
Don't get alone!

Plot:
I had this plot... but I ran out of time. So my cutscenes are 100% TV static and no main menu or start screen.

EDIT: Ok, I will write this them I thought of. It's not like I made it up just now. I had it in mind but I ran out of time to include features such as plot, front end etc. Anyways, here we go!

You live happily with your girlfriend in Afrocity, when suddenly she disappeared. He went out looking for her, noticing that despite the city is full of people, they are all... flat! Literally and with regard to real life and 18th century sentimentalistic style he realised it's just a bunch of paper-mache figures. They just go back and forth. The Afro guy (I didn't actually think of a name for him) went rage! And suddely, he ended up in a strange place with a glowing red gem around that evoke within him that he really wants, NO! Needs it! In a flash he was back in reality And realised that once he gets the gem, he gets the girl. Not pondering too long about it, he started to wreck havoc in the city to get to the plac ewith the red gem!

tl;dr - You are alone in a full city. Everyone is just a scenery. Just like real life.

There! And there was absolutely no way I would manage to even write this within the time limit :P


Credits:
- Stage3D Camera by Jackson Dunstan
- Obj loader by Breakdance McFunkypants
- Random bits of Flashpunk by ChevyRay

====WARNING!====

THIS GAME USES FLASH PLAYER 11 STAGE3D FEATURES!
Make sure you have the lastest version of the player installed!
If you have any trouble, refer to tips at the bottom of the game website!

================

EDIT: 
Just uploaded Jam version! Here are changes I made in it:
- Added sound effects
- Added "Click to start" screen
- Customised the preloader
- Added more grass on the map because it looks cool
It's not much but it plays way better now IMO.

IRC quote (everyone has that, right ;)
<Jiggawatt> >theme is alone
<Jiggawatt> >make a fully populated city
<Jiggawatt> Just another day in Sos' mind

entries.title: Alone in a cave with some bats
entries.description:
If you just wish to play, download the Newest file. It fixes some game-breaking collision errors and makes updates the controls and death handling.

The Entry files are what was originally submitted. Enjoy! If you have problems running the windows build, I am sorry!

Source is included in the windows build, just open the rb/w files in any text editor.

entries.title: Alone In Space
entries.description:
In the spirit of the 'Alone' theme, you will feel truly alone as you guide your ship through space and crash into planets.

I will mention that it is an incomplete game, but we felt it would be best for our hard work not to go in vain. There are many bugs, and we have plans to continue our development on it in the near-future. Thanks a ton for playing!

entries.title: Alone In Space...
entries.description:
You goal is to earn money, upgrade your ship, and defend the Mining station.

To Play:
Unzip the files to a location you prefer, and run alone.exe

To Win/Lose:
To trigger the ending sequence of event you first need to find the Drone, and shoot it. The drone can be anywhere on the map, and will turn and move away when you near it. (its a bright white circle) 

The Controls:
These are the defaults, you can set them to another set of keys, or to a Gamepad by clicking on the control in game.

Move Left: A
Move Right: D
Move Up: W
Move Down S
shoot: Spacebar
Upgrade Engine: 1
Upgrade Weapon: 2
Upgrade Sheild: 3
Upgrade Cargo: 4
Replay: Escape
Submit Score: Tab

Scoring:
You earn points for destroying stuff.

Online HighScore table:
http://allaroundgames.net/LD22/highscore/

Known Issues:
-Sometimes crashes giving a render error, no solution that I know of.

Source Files:
I have removed two bits of information from the source files.
- My MYSQL database information, just your standard php mysql information on a db.php page.
- Inside of the .cap file I removed the location of the submit.php file.

entries.title: Alone In The Office
entries.description:
We had a game concept, was never able to implement it, and simply ran out of time. Barely got to working on the actual levels. So, enjoy walking, running, jumping, and moving onto another game.

Controls
A = Left
D = Right
Ctrl + Direction = Run
Space Bar = Jump

entries.title: Alone vs Monster(s)
entries.description:
Hi!
This is my first video game, realised with Game Maker 8 in 36h.
Your goal is to go to sleep with your friend while putting the lights off. You can put objects in your bag: tidy your room is important before sleeping. But be careful with the black monster.
Keys: Space(jump) ; Left/Right ; Enter(Restart)
Have fun.

entries.title: Alone with... things!
entries.description:
The game is a puzzle-jump&run about a boy who wakes up all alone. After initial fear he discovers that he has the ability to bring inanimate things like furniture to life. Supported by his wooden companions he ventures into the dangerous world to find out whats going on.

Hint: There is a specific end point you have to get to. You will have to use the abilities of your companions to get there.


Keybord controls:

Arrow keys for movement
D to animate furniture


Gamepad Cotrols:

DPad for left and right
A for Jump
B to animate furniture


You can run the included CheckPrerequisites.exe to check whether all required Prerequisites are installed already. Run it if the game won't start or causes an error.

Prerequisites:

- Microsoft .Net Framework 4 ( http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851 )
- Microsoft XNA 4 Runtime ( http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914 )


Development Tools:

- Visual Studio 2010 with XNA 4

entries.title: Ghost Town
entries.description:
-- Ghost Town --

A flash game built in Flixel, using FlashDevelop.

Graphics were made in Photoshop and GraphicsGale.

Unfortunately, no sound effects, only one short piece of "music".

entries.title: Goodbye
entries.description: Use the arrow keys to move. You play as a depressed man who is very lonely.

entries.title: kuudou
entries.description:
Kuudou is an exploration game in which players should guide a "lone lorn creetur" around a huge, empty and extremely dark cave.  Somehow the creature has developed the ability to make her own body glow, but it is not enough to see far off in the distance.  Fortunately, the cave is not so empty as would seem a priory.  There are some critters lurking in the dark, and they have very, very bright eyes.

Using the eyes of the critters wandering around each stage, it is possible to make a mental map of where are the platforms and jump around to the exit.  All the levels are doable with that can be seen and what can be inferred by the position of every creature or by jumping around the area.  Some of the jumps require almost pixel-perfect collision that, together with the already frustrating environment, make the experience a little less enjoyable than what I wanted.

Please don't mind the name and the fake Japanese characters on the title screen.  In the README there is the reason behind it all, for these that are interested.

Kuudou is made in C++ using the SDL and SDL_mixer libraries.  The sound effect (there is only one) was made with sfxr and the background music with its four notes was made with Schism Tracker and a royalty-free freeware sample.

entries.title: Leave Me Alone
entries.description:
Hello there....

finally we have a "finished" product in our hands.

This is a team effort, produced by Saikai , Dero ,Mirthen , Physx and Madea. This game is our first finished game in this constellation ( and with xna.... mind you ).

This Game need the XNA Redistributable to run.
You can get it from here:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=15163

The game is a simple side scroll running game. You are followed by a horde of people who want to hug you, even though you sold your "free hugs" sign yesterday. So you try to get away from them. No matter what, you want to be left alone.

The Goal of this game is easy... get to level 5 with as few followers as possible. You can loose followers by throwing bombs at them (...obviously). There are also breakable objects in the level which you can break through while rolling.Also...please don't step into the fire....it hurts.

When you are caught, you can retry the same level, but your score will be reset to zero.

Default controls: ( Can be changed in Options )
   [UP] -> Jump
   [DOWN] -> roll
   [SPACE] -> activate bomb


Good luck ...and pray that our level generator doesn't cough up impossible levels.


ps: We are very sorry that we can't give binaries to all the Linux and MacOs guys(and girls) out there . XNA at fault here :) . We will put up a Youtube Video soon, to show the Game to you too.

entries.title: Slot Machine
entries.description:
If you are lost in the white fog, just run in one direction and you will find the target (sooner or later... You can orientate on the "click" sounds)!

TIPP: The town is in the direction of the slot machine!

Controls: 

Left Click / CTRL - Interact
W A S D - Move


You have to close the game with CTRL + F4 or Command + Q I didn't have the time for a ingame menu.

By the way... the traffic lights are really working! :D

entries.title: Space Shuttle
entries.description:
You're alone in deep space where dangerous planets are lurking. Dodge those planets and go as far as you can with your limited supply of gasoline.

Fixed:
- Planets spawning fixed.
- Entered name stays, so no need to enter it again after each run.

If you can't play the game, be sure to check it out at youtube.

entries.title: The Cheese Stands Alone
entries.description:
How to play is written in the game.

Hi-scores are tracked server side, that PHP isn't presently included in the game source download for security reasons.

The game's source (the Stencyl project) is available at the bottom of the page.

Current Changelog:
v1.1
Bug Fixes
- powerups on how-to menu fixed

- fixed crash when placing blocks on either side of self and wall
- enabled hack protection for a known exploit

Balance Fixes

- fbomb lifespan 0.3 seconds
- fbomb range lowered to 200%

- block internal cooldown reduced to 5
- block pwr cost reduced to 3
