- Hugg speed decreased to 10
- Orphan speed decreased to 14

entries.title: The ghost who wants to be alone
entries.description:
Controls are WASD and mouse, but you can change it to fit alternate keyboards.

It's a shooter about a ghost who wants to be *alone* so that he can finally rest in peace. Monsters appear, though, and make a bunch of noise. You kill them. If you kill 6 bosses, then you win, the monsters go away, and you get to go back to sleep, *alone*.

Here's a timelapse of the creation: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F4Z0gd7cpig

entries.title: The Last Adventurer
entries.description:
Requires an HTML5-capable browser. Tested on Firefox and Chrome. Chrome is preferred, it gives better performance and the music loops correctly. The game is designed to be playable even at low framerates, it just might not look as smooth.

This is a game about losing your companions. It's an action RPG with the twist being that you start with a party of five and lose one member at a time until the final quest when you're alone.

You mostly play with the mouse, but use SPACE to cast a spell, and a couple other keys come in handy. There are no in-game instructions, so please read the controls listed on the webpage. If you get stuck, check out the tips.

entries.title: The Last Metalface MK2
entries.description:
Because of the recent release of Oxeye Game Studio's new game "Cobalt" I made the main character a MetalFace.

(Just click to run. It's a jar file ;D)

entries.title: The Lost Viking
entries.description:
Jisus christ. I did not expect to be done this late. Even though this is my first ever LD I thought I would be more effective 

I finished the game The Lost Viking a bit different than first planned. Since I don't have any prior experience with this I had no idea which parts of the development would take the longest. I know that now. The god damn graphics.

It ended up being a top-down survival shooter. Unfortunately I didn't have time to polish and balance the different weapons, and I didn't get to add any powerups, but what the hell. It's done so I'm happy.

Thanks for the ride guys!

Tools:

Code: XNA, Visual studio
Graphics: Paint.NET
Sound: GarageBand, SFXR

entries.title: To be or not to be - Alone
entries.description:
Being immortal is hard, people are always around making noise, living short meaningless lives.

You've had enough, kill everyone so you finally be alone.

You start out weak with few allies. You can pick up new special attacks the more you fight.

-Controls-
Arrow keys - Select attack/ Select mob
Space - Attack

links.label: Source
links.url: http://media.zensoftware.org/LD22/to be or not to be - alone.zip

entries.title: A Room of One's Own
entries.description:
This is a Love game - you will need Love2D to run it.

The source is inside the .love file - rename to .zip and unzip it.

entries.title: A World Alone
entries.description:
WorldAlone, wake up in your room noticing that something isn't right. Although something is miss you decide to go to the bathroom, but is it your room? Are you still home? What happend? 

Find out! Or not...

The game is crossplatform, but only a windows binary is provided, the source is linux/mac osx compatible. Please see the readme.txt inside the source zip.


SOURCE
I installed Ubuntu, compiled, no problems at all, but running seemed a problem. Well I'm a windows user... maybe I get it to work but please some suggestions if you tried it on linux. 
For a source archive including all necessary libs and a makefile and codeblocks project see below:
http://direct.4vandorp.eu/redirect.php?urlId=5

entries.title: Am I Alone?
entries.description:
You awake in the grass with a gun in your hand. A beautiful sunny day... Oh, wait! ZOMBIES!!! You start shooting them and hope you are not the only one uninfected left on this Earth.

(Use "wasd" keys to move, mouse to point and shoot.)

entries.title: Aurea Oceanus
entries.description:
Collect enough gold and return to the submarine!
Beware of the sharks! Run to avoid them!
But take into account that you will need more oxygen if you run.

Tip: Don't run the whole time and always look around for sharks. As soon as you see one run away! You should have plenty of time to look for the gold if you just walk.

Needs a installed Java Runtime to run the JAR

Start with: java -jar aurea_oceanus_final.jar
Or try the applet (no fullscreen)

Controls:
Mouse/Cursor Keys: look around
WASD: move
Hold Shift: run
F: Fullscreen
F8: Screenshot
+/-: Brightness

Gameplay Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sruGpHp4Ehw&hd=1

Used Tools: LibGDX, LWJGL, Blender, Audacity, LMMS, autotracker-bottomup, Gimp, Eclipse

entries.title: Catspace
entries.description:
"Once upon a time, a man named SchrÃ�ï¿½Ã¯Â¿Â½Ã�ï¿½Ã�Â¶dinger had a cat. As was his nature, he decided to perform some routine quantum mechanical experimentation on it. He had a box, he had a radioisotope, he had a detector, and he had the poison gas. But when he opened the box to see where the cat collapsed to, the box was empty! The cat, he thought, must have ran away. But it hadn't run away. It was, in fact, CATAPULTED INTO THE SPACE BETWEEN DIMENSIONS. Now it walks the maze of emptiness alone, messing with waveforms and heading towards the faint light ahead, the faintest hope of escape."

This is what I planned to make. An epic maze of tubes and obstacles to navigate as a lonely dimensionless cat. Instead, I was constantly being forced away from programming to visit relatives and fix computers and prepare for the holidays. A majority of the ten or so hours I did use was spent working on the rendering engine instead of, you know, the game, and another majority was spent on a couple persistent and annoying bugs. Not to mention learning how to use flash. By the end of it all, I just didn't have any motivation to go further. Perhaps if there had been a theme I could have done something with, something that had suggested a mechanic, really anything except this one which eliminated all of my good ideas. On top of it, I had to struggle with figuring out Actionscript, which turns out to be a very infuriating language for me. Maybe next time I'll have a better reason to go on, but for now I just have this half-game.

INSTRUCTIONS (not provided in game):
Click and drag to rotate the view.
The colored node in the center is your cat. (It is not visible to the human eye because of quantum effects and not because I couldn't figure out how images worked.)
Click on an adjacent node, marked by the blue connections, to move to it.
Colored nodes are doors and switches. (quantum doors and switches of course)
You can not move to a door, but if you move to a switch, a door of the same color will vanish.
To win, get to the white area at the end of the map, and a new level will start.
There were going to be more and more complex types of obstacles than doors, but they were too buggy to fix in time for the end.

Hopefully next time will not be in the middle of a holiday break, have a theme that I know how to use as a mechanic, and start with me actually knowing the language. And maybe I'll even remember that I'm supposed to be making a game and not spend half the time working on rewriting existing technology and equations from scratch.

entries.title: Chronoflux
entries.description:
Didnt get a chance to put the set up for the story in your a Human that has had your mind implanted a robot in order to fix time shoot anything go wrong with a top secret experiment, which in this case has kill all humanity

arrows to move
z to travel in time
x to use
c to jump

I've uploaded an improved version it fixes warping into a wall teleporting you out of the level and the slowdown (for some reasons my bullets were checking collision with everything in the map)

entries.title: Co-op Alone
entries.description:
Its supposed to show that the player is alone by making him playing co-op levels alone.

Its basically a puzzle where you push boxes and get a very wierd item.

Language: C++ with SDL

The control option in the menu isnt functional yet.
Controls: arrowkeys and space to select

Edit: you cant finish the game, i have a bug in loading what doors are related to which pessureplates. You can only come as far as to the room before the last room. Sorry.
I added the needed DLL file for music to work.

entries.title: Containment
entries.description:
This was my first LD entry. It is a 3D puzzle and physics based platformer attempting a creepy atmosphere. It is largely unfinished and still contains many bugs. I tried to polish up what little I had.

NOTE: The only controls are left/right arrow keys and space to jump. The goal is to complete all the puzzles to get to the last room.

If you can't get past the first room.....well
the faucet and the box, both points of interest right? all my playtesters couldn't figure it out for the life of them.

entries.title: Dr. Autofober's Experiment
entries.description:
**Windows Exe added** Run DrA.exe!
**Fixed broken link!**

For Linux or to start from source run DrA.py if you have python and pygame installed.

Goal of this game is to keep Dr. Autofober's Experiment about loneliness running for some time. Therefore the test subjects should not get in close contact. You can avoid this by placing walls and kittens. You also have to keep the panic low, which will rise by placing walls close to test subjects.

Game could need some polish and there is only one level so far. Any comment welcome.

entries.title: Kaylin Norman's Generic Series: Platformer
entries.description:
The original idea behind the game is that it was supposed to look extremely generic - but have an extremely original concept. knowing that I'm among a lot of creative people in this jam, this probably has been done before. but Sense I didn't have the time or energy to flesh out the concept (and a lack of understanding of rapid prototyping) I just made the first level.

Even though this isn't my first game jam entry, its my first one that I've made in 3 days. I'm really excited that I got to do this and I'm glad that I had the encouragement.

You'll see that this game isn't well planned out and mainly focuses more on the aesthetic than actual game play (well it really depends on how you look at it.)

I hope you enjoy playing what little game there is to play :-).

The Music is a loop I made called "Loneliness" I made it specifically for this jam.

entries.title: Leave me alone!
entries.description: Runnable JAR file using nothing but basic Java. You love being alone and you are trying to reclaim your me-time cave by killing everyone in it. It will be difficult, so you will have to collect coins in the forest and buy good items first.

entries.title: lonely robot
entries.description:
A game about a robot in search of its friends.  And there's rocket jumping. (shoot your feet and jump!)

Controls:
WASD: Movement, S to open doors.
Shift: Run
Mouse: Aim
Left Click: Launch bomb (hold to charge shot for longer distance and faster projectile)
Ctrl: Hold while charging shot to launch bouncy bombs
Right Click: Hold to move camera
E: Reset camera

Thanks for having a look!

entries.title: robot friends
entries.description:
You find yourself alone in a room with some programmable robots. Can you use them to help you escape? Watch out! Their playback facilities use dead reckoning and are thus prone to accumulate error.


------------------
The linux version might only work if you have glibc 2.11.

entries.title: Singing Zombies
entries.description:
A game about killing singing zombies and exploding cars in a once nice city.

Changelog 1.01:
 - Nerfed zombie speed and health

----------

Map (if you get lost): http://ld22.mgrilec.com/map.png

Web (1.01) mirror: http://ld22.mgrilec.com
Web (1.0) mirror: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8672119/singingzombies_web.zip

Windows (1.0) mirror: http://ld22.mgrilec.com/singingzombies_windows.zip


Music mirror: http://ld22.mgrilec.com/singingzombies_soundtrack.zip

----------

I used some samples from "ATOM SPLITTER AUDIO - Games and 8Bit Kit Volume 1 and 2" i got from http://woolyss.com/chipmusic-samples.php. These are original and royalty free.

Also used plenty sounds from bfxr.net.

A map is provided here as the city is quite large and boring: http://ld22.mgrilec.com/map.png, as well as being displayed underneath the player at ld22.mgrilec.com.

entries.title: sQared
entries.description:
You start in a room that you know nothing about.
Why are you here, who brought you here, are you alone, those are the questions that come into your mind. And then, you begin your quest. It's simple as opening a door: you enter a maze with some strange lights on the walls, their meaning are not familiar at all. During your journey, you will encounter some people, and yet you will still be alone.. at the end.

Who will you be at the end ? Who will you chose to leave and live ?
That's the question you will have to answer to be able to complete the game.

Some bugs are fixed, unfortunately, I had to change the default font with another one to be able to fix the first critical issue (white text on white background). I picked and installed the new font within 5minutes so this critical bug could be fixed without interfering much with the "72hours" jam rule (and I took a screenshot to replace the one where we see the old font)

Here's the fixes made tonight, version 1.1 :
Critical
- Fix the dialog font that was white (on white background) : default Arial could not be used so SIDE EFFECT : font now used is Nakadai + black font material (text color won't stay black after saving project, defect to submit to Unity3D)
- Fix the button action that made the character Willy disappear

Game playability
- Fix the exit trigger that could be triggered infinitely by the player and never end the game
- Decrease the mouse sensitivity (15/10 -> 4/3)
- Fix the Actions Gui : won't orient itself toward the user, located in front of the collider (so it doesn't appear inside object in some case)
- Fix the default "name" of who you are : "me" instead of "grandma"

entries.title: The Cheese Stands Alone!
entries.description:
The only controls you need are the left-click on your mouse, and the space-bar (stuff will only start to move AFTER you pressed space), also, the R key resets whatever level you are currently on.

You shouldn't need me to explain the objective. Figuring that part out for yourself is meant to be part of the fun. (Here's a hint: If you got past the title and still haven't figured it out already, just remember the theme and stop thinking so hard.)

I'm planning on working on this game further after the competition. So, if you enjoyed this game, and are better with making puzzles than I am, show your appreciation by making your own puzzles and showing them off to me! (For those not familiar with Ogmo, I do accept levels in the form of crappy doodles.)


UPDATE: Yeah, if nobody gets my game at all during this competition, I'm going to blame the people who maintain the LD site. Every page that I've been to and clicked the "View USERNAME'S Journal" button doesn't actually go to their journal. It looks like it's working now, but i'm going to quote the first post I made after the competition starts just so that there is absolutely no confusion left about how my game is supposed to work. (Note that by knowing this,  the levels themselves should be so easy, that everyone will finally realize how tragically short my game actually is)

-------------------

Dog chases kitty, kitty chases mouse, mouse lives to eat cheese

What does this have to do with anything? Well I'm not 100% on how this will all go down, but I think I should go full throttle with the idea since the first thing I came up with was the win condition, and I'm guessing that's a good sign.

So how do you win?






You do not win.

 





Not until the cheese stands alone.

-------------------

entries.title: The Four Hats in "Room to Roam"
entries.description:
The Four Hats just can't seem get away from all their fans to record their next album. Guide them away from the horde of adoring fans and the paparazzi so they can get away to the studio and record their next hit!

The game is for iOS (and now ported to OSX) and was built using cocos2d and chipmunk.

You can get the iOS app through testflight:

Register your iOS device: http://bit.ly/gU8RCH
Download the app: http://bit.ly/u7gyan

You can get the OS/X port from the OS/X link above.

What Next?

We are going to submit Four Hats to the App Store after Apple's holiday break and will continue development on additional levels and characters if people enjoy the game. We original pictured a much bigger game, but the 72 hour time limit restricted what we could build.

entries.title: The Last Shadow
entries.description:
The Last Shadow - created by Justin and Blake Mullin.

Stranded on a dark planet, you must gather enough energy from an abandoned building to escape.

Known bugs:

- Doesn't work with Java 7
- After pressing Escape to free the cursor from the applet, you are no longer able to draw power correctly from objects.
- Sometimes the first object you absorb will give you one Watt too few.

Let us know what you think!

entries.title: The Lonesome Pixel
entries.description:
Controls:
     Arrow keys: Movement / Jump
     R: Restart level
     Escape: Quit game

You are the red pixel.
Feel free to make your own levels; they're just plain old 24 bit bitmaps.

Note: Some users have experienced some difficulties on the bridge level. If you feel that it is too difficult, then replace /resc/maps/main3.bmp with http://whff.tk/download.php?file=3vmi1r5grk
If you are in game, pressing 'R' will reload the map entirely. There's no need to restart.

Update: My friend who is starting in C wanted to write a platformer using the Windows terminal for I/O. Just for kicks I ported it to use the console. The link has been added. (Note, I didn't bother porting over the splash screens, and the controls are ever so slightly more sticky. Don't complain about these things if this is the version that you play!)

Another update: I got a Wii for Christmas and it hasn't taken me long to figure out how to write code for it. I decided to port this over. To run it, you'll need the Homebrew Channel. Enjoy :)

entries.title: The Maze
entries.description: In a dungeon far below the world of stereotypical RPGs, there is a place where Slimes, Blobs, and other Jellies can reside in peace. Not anymore. The Red slimes have made war on the Greens, and Red slimes have higher levels than greens, duh. So the Green army was wiped out, and you are the sole survivor! Run!

entries.title: The Onanist
entries.description:
NSFW but kinda not.

Yeah. I did three quick prototypes, but the first two would have taken to long time and I lost inspiration for the last one. So I made this as a quick backup.

Note: I was actually going to make it deeper, but the mic I hace here is a piece of crap and it was impossible without real soundeffects.

Story:
You are alone in your room, trying to masturbate. Your fundie parents are sadly on patrol...

Controls: Space to hide/unhide penis, mouse to navigate, fap with UP/DOWN arrow (must surf porn to do it). Don't let your parents see you fap or surfing porn.

And yeah. You need to have sound on (please note that's NOT a screamer)

entries.title: The Square
entries.description:
A game initially inspired by The Cube (http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0123755/) and Portal (no link required).

It's a short game that can be completed under a minute playable in a browser using javascript.

Controls are:
left and right arrows to move
A to jump
S to use objects.

I've tested the following browsers and they seem to work fine:
* Chromium 15.0.874.121
* Firefox 8.0.1
* Opera 11.60
It does even seem to be working in the Android browser, but I don't have the keys to control my character on my phone :P
If you have any problems with any browser or version, please let me know. I'm interested in the kinds of problems.

Existing code used: require.js underscore.js.

If you can't find how to solve the later stages you can decode the following base64-string for a hint:
UGxhY2UgdGhlIGNvcnBzZSBvbiB0aGUgcHJlc3N1cmUgcGFkLg==
(Decoder: http://www.opinionatedgeek.com/dotnet/tools/base64decode/)

entries.title: The way home...
entries.description:
My first entry in a ludum dare competition.
The goal of the game is to find your way to home...

Controls:
Left/Right - Movements
Space - Jump

entries.title: Trapped Alone
entries.description:
In this game, your character is alone in a large network of caverns. You must survive and find your way out to be back with your friends again. My first ever game for Ludum Dare!

MSVCR100.DLL missing (Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable)
Get it here: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&id=5555

Timelapse of game creation: http://youtu.be/qUCHPi0LrXw

entries.title: Al Own is Alone with A Loan
entries.description:
TO PLAY:
Arrow keys to move
Escape to go back to title (Or in Intro- to skip)
Collect Good Credit (green arrows) to increase credit
Avoid IRS (If hit, credit will go down!)
Find the exit!


NOTES:
Actually did this under 24 hours. Woke up today at 7:30 am and started from only 3 hour of work on Saturday. Wish I had started earlier though. Wanted to make it longer and make a better tile set.

TOOLS:
Gimp (Graphics)
Audacity (Music conversion)
GarageBand (Music)
Gosu (Ruby)
Unitron (Text-editor)
TextEdit (make map file)
Ocra (Compiling for windows)

entries.title: Alone
entries.description:
Need XNA 4.0 to work.
Made using the Reach profile so should run on older hardware.

entries.title: Forever Alone - The Movie - The Game
entries.description:
This is one masterpeace of a flash game i made today.

It reminds me of the chilly snow on my bare foot when i was burried in the sstop to die.

Pros:
*Button
*Unique design
*Addictive gameplay

Cons:
*No replay button
*Auto replay
*Dont need to replay

I hope you enjoy the game and dont forget to write a long review, on how much you love it. Thank you for your honest opinions.

                                                   @TukTuk

entries.title: Forever alone Simulator 2012
entries.description:
Forever alone simulator 2012:
This is the newest in the series of simulators of being forever alone!

Features:
*Amazing high-res graphics
*Kick-ass sound track
*And the forever alone gameplay we all know and love

entries.title: Frostbite
entries.description:
A post apocalyptic soldier in a watchtower going mad on a nuclear winter, seeing things and with some serious memory problems.
A simple platformer, maybe a little too serious and pretentious :D

Keyboard:
X: Jump
C: Action/Shoots

F4: toggles fullscreen
Esc: Instantly quits the game


Used GameMaker 8.1, Graphics Gale, Drumcircle, Pxtone, Sfxr, Photoshop, Paint Tool Sai and Audacity.

For more info on me (and my studio!) check http://studiominiboss.com

If you are in a hurry you can check out the gameplay video!

UPDATE 12/19
Minot bug-fixes and made the game a little easier.

entries.title: G is for Grue, likely to eat you
entries.description: Small game about life, death, and Grue.

entries.title: In the Dark
entries.description:
Thousands of years ago, a boy named Aziz descends into the cave of the Auroch Spirit. If he is able to navigate the twisting paths and hazards of the caverns within, he will learn the spirit's secret and emerge a man.


This is a Myst-style graphical adventure. Point-and-click your way through the images. Items you collect are used automatically when you click an applicable target. Click the down arrow to go backward.

Works best in Chrome and Firefox.
Bugs: Doesn't work in IE. Cursor will not change when hovering over clickable objects in Chrome.

entries.title: Lava Jumper
entries.description:
*NOTE: Please use the patched version as level 10 had a problem and rendered the game unplayable.  The only modification was replacing the previous level 10 with a new copy moving the spawn point pixel down 1 space.

This is my first completed game. The basic principal is to make it to the blue square aka portal. Some levels are hard and some are easy. Due to a messed up collision engine there is a hidden "Feature" that makes some hard levels easy. If you get stuck (99% certain at least once) somewhere simply press "R" to restart the level. Sadly there is no sound due to a major crash issue with a sound engine.

Credits:
    Skriglitz - Code/Art/Levels
    Detected Error - Levels/Logo

Timelapse of first 48hrs (minus time chronolapse had black screenshots) can be found here: http://youtu.be/z_HAlENkod0


Note: As mentioned at the end there is a way to add your own levels to the game. The format is as follows
    1. 32x25 pixel PNG with border of choice of stone, dirt, or grass or all 3.
    2. Airspace must be black.
    3. Player can not pass through 1 pixel holes/gaps due to bug
    4. The lattermost Spawn Point and portal is considered the only one.
    5. Images must be inserted into the jar under resources\level with filenames in sequential order.

The color pallet RGB's are as follows:
Air: RGB(0,0,0)
Stone: RGB(127,127,127)
Dirt: RGB(127,63,0)
Grass: RGB(0,255,0)
Lava: RGB(255,0,0)
Spawn Point: RGB(255,255,0)
Portal: RGB(0,0,255)

entries.title: Leave me alone
entries.description:
Leave me alone
----------------------
This game is about Ingemar, he is sitting at a desk working furiously with something important! He just wants to be left alone. But colleauges and managers are constantly disturbing him with stuff. HE JUST WANTS TO BE ALONE! So, your job is to protect him. And shoot all disturbing people :)

Made for Ludum Dare 22 compo with Java and PlayN.

Only tested in Chrome.

entries.title: Left Alone
entries.description: Try to beat the clock and kill all of your enemies before the time runs out! I know the game sucks but it was my first game ever, so try not to discourage me too much!:P

entries.title: Lonely Island
entries.description:
A game where you must survive on a desert island long enough to be rescued. Balance your limited food (provided by coconuts) with wood used for your signal fire: burn too much too fast and you might starve to death!

Incidentally this game was made with a rather stricter time constraint than 72 hours - I started from scratch around 4 hours before the Jam deadline. So, it might not be as polished (or fun) as other Jam entries but I'm still pretty pleased with what I got done.

Controls:
Left and Right arrow keys: Move
Mouse: Interact

Clicking a coconut tree while it has coconuts will eat the coconuts. Clicking a coconut tree while it has no coconuts will cut it down. Win by building your fire big enough to attract a rescue ship!

Made with XNA 4.0. Please make sure you have the XNA 4.0 Runtime installed (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914).

entries.title: Lonely Thought
entries.description:
A lonely kid struggles with his inner thoughts...

Click on the screen to shot at a word, simple as that. But don't let them consume you.

Try to unveil all the messages!

I aimed for a songless, still design, I hope it's not too bland.

links.label: Java 1.7 link, any OS that has JVM

entries.title: Maze Explorers
entries.description:
MazeExplorers is a maze game with a few twists. Your goal is to find the exit of the maze before your food runs out.

My goal regarding the theme was to use "alone" in the mechanic of the game, not necessarily in the "dressing" of the game. There are other explorers in the maze - each of them will give you some ability, but they will also eat your food (do you will have less time to complete the maze), and they will block your way (possibly taking you to dead ends).

So, is it better to try to solve the maze alone, or ask for their help? This is a crucial decision.

There are 5 mazes in the LD48 version of the game. Even if you beat a maze, you can still try to find the minimal path.

Also, there is a secret kitten mode ;-) Let me know if you find it.

This was my first entry to Ludum Dare, and it was quite fun!

Code is Java/Slick. Sound is sfxr and espeak. Sprites based on the openPixel project.

Make sure to check the time-lapse of the game being made: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0tpQZ1pjQKM

entries.title: Mission to Mars
entries.description:
In this game you control Curiosity, the latest Rover from ASAN, and your mission is to go to Mars to explore it, in order to find evidence of life.
Unfortunately, during the landing, some of your tools got damaged and stopped functioning, so your first job is to rendezvous with Spirit (the first rover) in order to get its Radio Transmitter, so you're able to communicate with ASAN and receive further instructions.

Controls:

Movement: Arrow Keys
Use Drill: Z

entries.title: OUTPOST_NULL
entries.description:
There's only one way off this outpost.

Art and design by Delko. Checkout his blog here: http://delkoduck.wordpress.com

entries.title: Robot Armageddon!
entries.description:
Robots have killed everyone on earth! Now only you remain. See how long you can survive against the robot death squads.

Controls: W/A/S/D to fire, arrow keys to move, also supports dual-analog joysticks (auto-detected on startup)

to play in full screen add -fullscreen to the command line (defaulted to windowed mode by popular demand)

written from scratch in c++ w/ SDL, video of development available here. 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IR8oWQD0Zx4&list=PLEB3D4FCC93E0B497&feature=plpp_play_all

entries.title: Solitaire
entries.description:
short and stupid. but if you're anything like me, you might find it amusing.

the arrow keys do pretty much everything. (up and down to operate elevators)

ran out of time for sound/some polish, so it's still pretty quiet and buggy. I'll probably pick this up again sometime and finish it. I'm pretty content with it for what it is.

entries.title: Subconsciously Alone
entries.description:
This is my first LD48... Turned out pretty well, except a little stressed at the end.

So I came up with a story platformer, sorta. You're this guy trapped inside his own dreams, and he tries to destroy his own subconscious because he is convinced that will solve all his problems.

Use  the mouse to look around.
Other controls are explained in the game.

I also apologize for the difficulity of the survival part...didn't have time for balancing, just had to get it all to work. I suggest having a good mouse. :)

entries.title: Take care of the trees
entries.description: This is my entry. I wanted to make a game like this for a while. I hope you like it. I am tired now goodbye.

Hey guys this is my first Ludum Dare ever! I hope you like my game It was made in the depths of my heart.

entries.title: Varon Sector
entries.description:
Help a lost survivor seek out a means of communication...IN SPACE!

Also press space to skip cutscenes.

entries.title: Warrior cursed by Loneliness
entries.description:
Long ago, there was a great warrior. None of his opponent could survive under his blade. His body was immortal because he had stolen the cloak of invisibility of the Death. As a revenge, the Death cast a curse on him - not only the Death, nobody in the world could find this great warrior. Year after year, the loneliness made the warrior going crazy - now, there was only one thing left for this immortal one, fight against his spell-cloned body.

This is a First-Person fighting/action game.

IMPORTANT: You need a mouse with 2 buttons(Left & Right) to play this game. Touchpad of NB is not suitable for this game.
============
Controls
============
#Attack
The success of attack depends on if you could land it on your opponent's vulnerable bits. The enemy's vulnerabilities will be exposed when he has lost his defense stance(attacking, blocked by your shield). And there are 2 type of vulnerabilities: Far & Near(with red circle in it). Slashing attack can only reach the near vulnerabilities while piercing attack could reach both.
##Piercing: Click with LMB(Damage: 1-3)
##Slashing: Drag with LMB(Damage:1)

#Defend
The enemy will attack your head, chest, or legs, so you need to position you shield at the right height while defending. When enemy begins attack, one part of the screen(upper/mid/lower) will flash red to inform you where he is targeting. Use your RMB to defend yourself as follows:
##Shield: Hold down RMB at the red screen area.
##Block: Hold down RMB just before the enemy's weapon reach your body! If you push RMB too early, blocking will not be triggered but you can still defend successfully.

============
Hints
============
If you've defeated the warrior, the attributes of him will be randomized in the next game. The "Attack" attribute may be a little puzzled. In this game, it means the percentage to land a power attack which could make the camera shake a lot even if you defense successfully.

This game seems quite challenging at start, until you've learned how to attack efficiently and master the art of blocking.

entries.title: You Only Help Yourself
entries.description:
A mighty obstacle obstructs your path, and you cannot possibly surpass it alone. Unfortunately, you can remain alone even when surrounded by others. With your newfound power to objectify, people may as well be stepping stones to you.

Use arrow keys for movement.
Pick up small red blocks by running into them.
Drop a held block by pressing 'down'
When things change, objectify by holding 'down' to charge ( when not holding a block). The beam will fire when fully charged.

This is my first Ludum Dare! How'd I do?

entries.title: A rather Lonely Darkness
entries.description:
Myself (pireninjacolass) and My friend Ollz272 (Timothy M Bradford and Oliver Parker) worked to bring you a game. The game is a top down shooter titled A rather Lonely Darkness.

Story:
You have set off from your home to acquire riches untold from the deep dark mine about 11 miles from your village. The forests between here and there are full of wolves and there have been sightings of a few orcs roaming the wilds. Fortunately you came well armed spending your life savings on three, reliable guns. These should see you through the forests but once you enter the dwarves mine, even they might be have a hard time keeping you in one piece since the horrors of the mine are far beyond anything anyone has ever shot to death before. 

Controls:
WASD to move
Mouse to aim
Right click to shoot
Enter to change weapon

entries.title: Al-one
entries.description:
This entry is not really a game. It's more an experience, even if there are rules and gameplay. But the most part of the game, you will have to wait. The shortest mode (easy) needs 1hour to be completed. The hard mode needs 24 hours.

To play this game, it's better to have pen & paper and a chronometer.

For the braves who are going to play, I'll offer a Christmas gift (even after Christmas) to the first guy who finish the game in hard mode!

You can ask me the source but you'll not be eligible for the gift contest anymore...

entries.title: Alone ?!
entries.description:
A litte chick has lost his mother. Now you have to find the mother as little chick after 10 seconds or the litte chick dies because of loneliness.
Have Fun

P.S.: You have to win the first level, before you can go on.

Left-Arrow to move to the left.
Right-Arrow to move to the right.
Up-Arrow to jump.

My first game.
I make it with Flashpunk, FlashDevelop, Inkscape, Paint.net, sfxr, WolframTones, Audacity, pencil and paper.

entries.title: Alone in all Elona
entries.description:
Simple game but was fun to make :D

Engine: Stencyl
Tools: MSPaint

entries.title: Alone in the Rain
entries.description:
Linux users: 32-bit build.
Mac users: Windowed mode only. 64-bit build.
Windows users: Coming soon(TM).

entries.title: And then, alone at Epsilon-1
entries.description:
A small sci-fi adventure game with some puzzle elements to it and a story crammed in.

Hope you enjoy!

entries.title: Codex Vaticanus A
entries.description: Nope.

entries.title: Desperate4luv
entries.description:
Date Simulator + RPG + Point and Click Adventure = this :O

Plays on browser. Please report any bugs.

Made on MMF2/TGF2 + GraphicsGale + BFXR + Schism Tracker + Audacity

PLEASE leave a constructive comment so I can rate and comment your entry. Thanks! ;)

entries.title: Fatward
entries.description:
This is an interactive story of a poor little student who has no friends.
Controls are Cursor keys or WASD only. Just wander around and check out everything to dive deeper into the story.

Takes only around 10 minutes to finish game, 5 minutes if you know the route or if you are quick. 

Bonus: There even is a kitten in the game somewhere.

entries.title: Gemclusion
entries.description:
The object of the game in Gemclusion is to combine all of the gems into one. When two gems combine they change color. The order of gems are Red, Blue, Green, Purple, Yellow, and Orange. When two gems combine they take on the color above the highest gem color. For example if a red gem combines with a green gem you will get a purple gem.

Throughout the level you will encounter different colored blocks. You can pass through them only if you are the same color. For any other color they will be a wall.

entries.title: HUG MONSTER
entries.description:
(Since the blog link is currently broken, you can find it here if you want to judge "Community" :: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/dr_soda/ )

The Hug-Monster (-o^_^)-o can never get enough love or hugs, and is always happy to see you.  Unfortunately, it's a little too excitable and at times doesn't seem to know its own strength.

You  on the other hand are small and fragile, and most definitely want nothing more than to be left alone, especially from the big, scary Hug-monster!

How long can you avoid its warm, snuggly, and loving arms of death?  Find out in this classic platformer!

The Hug Monster

The game is a Unity project.
 - Unity3D - Written all in C# using MonoDevelop
 - 2dToolKit libraries (Not included)
 - Photoshop CS3  

In my declaration I mentioned using 2DToolKit to programmatically create sprite animations, but I'm not sure whether its license allows me to include it as plain text in the Unity project.  It's available in the Unity Asset Store, but at cost.

If that's not kosher for the Compo, then I'll happily resubmit it as a Jam entry.

(12/22/2011 - Uploaded bug fix for issue reported by caranha -- and then a bug fix for the bug fix.)

entries.description: A physics platformer where you have guide a lonely robot through a series of puzzle rooms using various attraction and repulsion mechanics. If you look carefully you may just find a kitten or two to keep you company on your journey :)

entries.title: Lonely Kitty
entries.description:
Looool, this is what happens when you change your plans a bazillion times before finishing.

Still, kitties!

entries.title: Oases
entries.description:
*** IMPORTANT NOTE *** 
This game, as mentioned below, has some trouble running on many computers. If you're getting .dll errors, try erasing the msvcr100.dll file I included, and installing the Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 redistributable: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=5555. That may only work in 50% of cases, but...fingers crossed, right?

*** IMPORTANT NOTE THE SECONDE ***
I've compiled a new version using the Qt library for networking, instead of some random code found on the internet for scanning wireless SSIDs. The new version is available here: http://www.newton64.ca/games/jams/ld22/Oases-v1.1.zip
As mentioned in the README, I'm not sure if this can be considered valid for the competition. The changes were minimal, and in the back end, and the game is functionally identical to the original submission; however, it was done post-deadline. Let me know if it goes against the rules, and I will remove the link.

In any case, Linux version on its way soon.

==========

The game has been tested on Windows 7, but as with any good last-minute entry, it doesn't seem to play nice on anything other than the developer's PC. If the game doesn't run at all, or forces you to quit for not having your wireless card turned on, I apologise. Working on that presently. Do mention in the comments if you've had any errors, and provide things like error messages, and OS version.

Oh, and do play this on a laptop. Like, you pretty much have to. And wear mittens.

entries.title: Omnis Moriar: Dawn of the Forsaken
entries.description:
This is produced by Cory "LordVashi" Freitag and Caitlin "Pixel Noob" Lander.

Omnis Moriar: Dawn of the Forsaken is a top-down survival-horror/ puzzle game.  The main character, Alexandria Valmont, is a knight returning to her castle after a great war. She wakes up and finds everyone has dissappeared.

We were able to get most of the back end stuff done and have a good preview.  But we didn't have enough time to get everything we wanted in the game in and finish the end goal.

Here is our attempt though. I hope people enjoy it.

entries.title: Realistic Desert Survival Simulator
entries.description:
Test your survival mettle against the elements, as you wander the deserts alone looking for food and water to keep you sustained!

The longer you spend in the desert without food and water, the closer you get to...well...let's call it not surviving. Pick up a rock to bash open a cactus and get access to the sweet moisture inside, or throw it at a snake for a tasty uncooked snack.

The further you wander, the harder it gets to find the things you need to stay alive. How long can you survive?

I wish I'd slept a little less on this one, couldn't quite get the polish level up for the end (some weirdness with high scores, a memory leak I didn't have time to track down), but overall it really captures that lonely feeling I wanted to create.

entries.title: Relativity
entries.description:
A first-person puzzle game where light can be slowed down to 2 m/s.  Uses a 4D raycaster, the puzzles are very basic, spent most of my time working on the raycasting.

Uses SDL, OpenGL, OpenAL, Sean Barrett's Ogg decoder (http://nothings.org/stb_vorbis/)

Music was made in Ableton Live 8

entries.title: Space Game!!!
entries.description:
Game is written in lua using the love framework.

UPDATE: I have fixed a bug with garbage collection, as well as uploaded executables. Sorry for the issues. Thank you for trying my first Ludum Dare game!

entries.title: Step Off
entries.description:
you play the purple guy who is so deathly afraid of other people's company that it physically pains him. To stay alive he must make them leave. But he doesn't want to talk to them or touch them so he just throws stuff.

Keep the yellow guys out of your circle.

Throw items at boxes to break them.

controls:
Arrow Keys to move

Spacebar to pickup and throw items

entries.title: T - O - G - E - T - H - E - R ______ A - L - O - N - E
entries.description:
This game runs windowed mode. Dodge the squares using ARROW KEYS, hit ESC to quit. Game quits if you fail so you may have to run the game a few times to reach the ending. If you happen to have the XNA redistributable and other frameworks installed, you can use a zipped version of the game if you prefer [ here it is ----> http://dl.dropbox.com/u/122720/TOGETHER%20ALONE%20ZIP.zip  ]. If you are having trouble finding the game after install you can just search for the "TOGETHER ALONE", as XNA installer puts stuff in a weird spot under your All Programs list. It should then be uninstallable through Add/Remove Programs. It's not very long, so I have faith in you! YOU CAN DO IT! Enjoy my first ever LUDUM DARE entry made with XNA, ASE, and Audacity.

PS - LESSONS LEARNED - Make sure you really know your environment well. My newness to C# and XNA led to some horrible looking code...check it out in the source! : ) Also, don't be too ambitious. I had to scrap first two partially completed projects because of this. Oh wells...will be really ready for my second LUDUM DARE!

entries.title: FELINUS: the cat gods
entries.description:
INFO
this game is an SRPG (like ff tactics, advance wars, etc) about cats.. er i mean an SRPG where you only have a single, _lone_ character to control. there are four different cat gods (two playable), each with unique abilities. most of them use magic that creates orbs. orbs stay on the field persistently and move around after each character's turn according to different rules for each orb type. so you can dodge or block incoming orb attacks to avoid damage. there are three levels and an original four-song blues guitar soundtrack by drew southern.

linux users: you'll have to download the .love file and install love from here: http://love2d.org/

this is a jam entry because i didn't come up with the idea until half way into the compo, but i took advantage of the allowance for outside help for the level graphics and music. the main thing i didn't have enough time to spend on was the AI; it is quite poor. i also wanted to add a level-up that brings a new ability for each character.

CONTROLS - README
the controls are simple but you might end up accidentally quitting and losing your progress if you don't know them (sorry). use the arrow keys and enter to select stuff. you can back out of most menus (including the quit menu) by pressing backspace. to check an enemy's hp, you can press backspace at the move/cast/wait menu and arrow over to him and press enter. esc quits the game.

STRATEGY
this game can be pretty hard so here's a little strategy guide. i encourage you to not read this and try to figure it out by yourself since part of the fun of a strategy game is figuring out the strategy, but if you are having trouble there are some helpful tips here. once you are familiar with the basic mechanics and how the different orbs work, it shouldn't be too hard to beat any battle with the right strategy.

ap (action points): when a cat's turn is up, it gets 4 ap (except the black cat, who gets 5). any ap that isn't spent during a turn will carry over to the next turn, but there is a max of 12 ap.

orb details: if an orb would be created/move to the point a cat is standing on, that cat will lose 1 hp. the only exception is that a cat will not be affected by its own orbs. if two orbs would both occupy the same grid space (provided there isn't a cat on it), they fizzle and are both destroyed.

playing the black cat: casting a black orb costs 2 ap. the black cat's orbs will always move one step away from her at the end of any cat's turn. the orbs can move diagonally, but only if she is standing exactly on a diagonal from the orb. if you want to get a sure hit in, end your turn with a black orb right next to the enemy cat such that it will be pushed into him immediately upon ending the turn.

playing the yellow cat: casting a yellow orb costs 1 ap per unit of distance away from your cat it is. you can read about the system the yellow orbs are based on here: http://goo.gl/QbJSC. at the end of any cat's turn, yellow orbs are created and destroyed based on these same rules. the main thing to keep in mind is that if there is an empty space next to exactly three yellow orbs (including diagonally adjacent ones), an orb will be created there. so to hit the enemy cat, all you have to do is cast yellow orbs such that he is touching no more or less than three of them at the end of your turn. one effective strategy here is to box the enemy into a corner and just keep putting orbs on the three cells next to him. also check out the example pattern sections on that wiki page, as they will work quite nicely in this game. in the beginning of my gameplay video you can see me shooting a glider at the black cat.

fighting the white cat: the white cat will duplicate herself if she has any ap at the end of her turn; this is pretty hard to avoid. it costs her 5 ap to cast her aoe damage spell, so you can prevent this by being far enough away that she has to spend her ap on moving within range of you. try to separate her from her duplicate and kill them one at a time. it is rarely a good idea to move toward her, just let her come to you.

fighting the purple cat: congratulations on making it this far. the purple cat has 8 hp and can be difficult to hit, but he isn't very aggressive. his orbs will take one step randomly in any of the four directions at the end of any cat's turn. if you are playing the black cat, some tricky juking may be necessary to get hits in. try turning your orbs mid-flight by walking to another side of them or to a diagonal. if you are the yellow cat, a strategy of slow advancement works well. wait until you have a lot of ap, then move in and setup a wall of orbs. if you place them well and continue to augment the wall every turn with more orbs in the right places, you can slowly advance towards your opponent and eventually corner him while preventing his orbs from reaching you.

entries.title: Live another day
entries.description:
Hoooooorah!... Didn't think I'd get a chance to submit an LD22, but knuckled down Saturday night and managed this bleak piece of code. Now I must sleep as it is Sunday morning.

HOW TO PLAY:
Your goal is to mouse-over positive words; mouse-over negative words and the screen becomes more and more red, and your gun arm shakes more and more, and the gun hammer gets pulled.

There are two endings - you either survive or you don't.

There is also a 'score' at the bottom left.

Note:
Because this is quite a simple and short game, I have made it quite challenging in terms of game difficulty - this is also to increase the tension in-game, which I feel is a big part of the experience.

WARNING:
MATURE CONTENT

entries.title: Midnight Run
entries.description:
Bit of a mixed bag this one. The concept is a platformer where there's AI-controlled NPCs and you have to outlast them, being the lone survivor. Unfortunately I spent a good chunk of time debugging an error in my Javascript game library, and ultimately couldn't get the AI finished. You can see an early, unfunished prototype of the AI in action here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15658925/LD22%20release/game2.html

What remains is a procedurally generated forced-scroll platformer where the objective is to stay on the screen in spite of the obstacles.

I found and fixed a potential issue with jaws.js (which is awesome by the way, give it a try) which occurs if you try and dynamically expand the game world. I'll investigate the bug fully and then try to submit a patch, so if nothing else this weekend will have produced that :D

NOTE: I tried this in Firefox and it didn't work. I have tested it in Chrome 11. I am not a web developer and was learning Javascript as I went along, so unfortunately it's probably horribly broken on some browsers. If I am able to I will try and fix this. Sorry again!

entries.title: Omega Men
entries.description:
Really enjoyed doing this Ludum Dare! The game began from an idea based on "The Omega Man", but it changed a little bit - so the one "last survivor" is now three survivors, but at least they're still "alone" as a collective... except for the mutants. But that's how the film works, isn't it? I don't know I've only seen the Simpsons spoof of it!

Anyway, I don't care about the points, but would /really/ love some feedback. I don't know if it has potential to evolve into something bigger from here and where I could take it, so I'd really appreciate any thoughts you have :)

---

Use the mouse to play. Press "R" or "Escape" to reset if it gets stuck. 

Your objective is to get to the checkpoint, marked by a light-blue square towards the top of the map.

Each turn you can move one of your guys by clicking on one of the glowing squares - these represent the squares you can move to. If there are mutants in your line-of-sight then you will have a chance to shoot one of them. Any neighbouring mutants of the same colour will also be killed.

Then it will be the mutants' turn to move! If a mutant moves to a square adjacent to one of your team that team member will be killed.

---

Known issues:
 - Line-of-sight isn't spot on, and probably could be made more intuitive/clear/consistent.
 - Pathfinding is sometimes wrong. But all the locations enemies go to are within their reach, even if the paths they choose sometimes go through rocks! ^^;

After leaving Earth X years ago, the humans detected water forming again on earth. They send back a robot(you) back to earth to make it more habitable. It's a puzzle game where you terraform earth!

entries.title: Alone in the Unknown
entries.description:
Alone in the unknown is a first joint project by Jonno Allcock and Nathan Thorpe working under the name SevenSpace games. It's Jonno's second Ludum Dare entry and Nathan's first.

Timelapse of Jonno's screen: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N5zSoB9fVCI&feature=youtu.be

Aim: Complete the puzzles, find your way through the facility you find yourself in, try to escape and find other people!

Thanks for downloading, we hope you enjoy playing, and apologies for the large file-size; our Easter egg was larger than we expected it to be and the audio resources are pretty high quality as it comes.

You can contact and follow me, Jonno, at the following locations:

Thanks once again,

- Jonno & Nathan

entries.title: And Into The Night We Go Together
entries.description:
"And Into The Night We Go Together" is an open-ended music game.

Play the saxophone on your little existential journey. Mayhap your friends will join you along the way if you play their tune! What could be better than playing the sax and hanging with your best friends?

A Webkit based browser, such as Chrome or Safari, is required to play.
And perhaps consider playing CEG, FAB, EC or whatever you desire!

entries.title: Cave Wanderer
entries.description:
Hey guys. This is my game for Ludum Dare #22, "Cave Wanderer".
It's for the Sega Master System.

The file you want to run is ld22-gm.sms.

Feed that into an emulator. Here's two recommendations.

The best one for accuracy is probably Kega Fusion:
  http://www.eidolons-inn.net/tiki-index.php?page=Kega
Although I quite like Mednafen, and it's plenty accurate enough:
  http://mednafen.sourceforge.net/

There is no defined plot. Invent one yourself to explain the aloneness.



Oh yeah, compilation / assembly instructions.

You will need WLA-DX (possibly built with a maximum string length > 64) to build the .z80 source code.
You will need Python 2.x to build the music.
It would help if you had GNU Make or something like that.
Finally, if you wish to modify the .it files, you will need SchismTracker. I don't have the .it file for one of them.

Of course, if you're just wanting to play this game, open up ld22-gm.sms in an emulator.



If you have any questions, read the README.txt file included before asking me.



UPDATE!
3 days after the 48 hours ended, I ported it to the Sega Mega Drive! (albeit with one glaring bug)
That port can be downloaded here: http://gm.64pixels.org/stuff/ld22/cave_wanderer_smdport_beta1.zip
Please don't use that version for judging.

The story is that you are a robot that got left behind on a planet and you a eager to return back to Earth, so you must mine minerals and turn them into fuel to last the trip back home.

We are three guys who just finished up Year Ten. This was our first game made in C# and XNA; hope you enjoy. :p

The game is a bit framey at some points, but it doesn't effect gameplay.
The sountrack is avaliable for download though the main theme is low quality (360p).
The game runs under the name 'Shooter', feel free to change. :3

entries.title: Planet Earth Is Blue
entries.description:
NOTE!!! This needs XNA 3.0 to run. Meaning, NOT 3.1 or 4.0. (The different versions can coexist just fine, I in fact have all three installed myself.) See the XNA runtime link above for the download. If you're having issues getting it to run, you might want to try the installer, which will automatically install any needed dependencies.

Soundtrack here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/10018382/Planet%20Earth%20Is%20Blue%20OST.zip

-----

"This is ground control... your circuit's dead, there's something wrong..."
On a routine mission, you stumble into a strange portal and find yourself
-alone-
in a parallel dimension.
Search for the space eggs to survive and find your way home.
Good luck !

Controls
--------
WSAD / Left Stick: Move
Left/Right / Right Stick: Rotate
Space / Right Trigger: Shoot
Left Control / Left Trigger: Bomb (recharges, you can see when it is available again when the ship icon at the top left is lit up)

Reqs
----
Note, if it crashes on startup it's most likely just missing a dependency.

XNA Framework 3.0 (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=22588)
--note: newer XNA versions don't seem to be backwards compatible, so if you only have 4.0 installed, you'll need to get 3.0
.NET Framework 3.5 (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=21)
DirectX 9.0c (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=35) (but you probably already have that)

Tarassis is a a cross-platform, pysics-based platformer/puzzler.

STORY
=====
You are a spaceman lost and alone on an empty, broken down spaceship and you need to find your way home. 

GAMEPLAY
========

Control your character with the arrow keys and control the spaceship with the w, a, s , and d keys. Applying thrust to the spaceship can help you make otherwise impossible jumps,
but all other objects in the level are affected along with you.


CREDITS
=======
Julian Ceipek - 3D Art and Coding
Matt Belland - Coding
Kiefer Hicks - Coding
Kai Ausin - Concept and 2D Art
Xy Ziemba - Coding
Jae Young Park - Music


LICENSE
=======
FreeBSD (Attribution by linking to this project on GitHub is fine)

entries.title: Drift
entries.description:
This is my first time entering Ludum Dare. I wanted to make a game about exploring an abandoned space station in zero gravity. It seemed like a really lonely setting in my mind, and you would be investigating why everyone on the stationed vanished.
It became apparent around the midway point that I wouldn't be able to make even a simple version of that on my own in 48 hours.

So the game, appropriately, drifted a bit from my original idea. What it is now is a prototype of the kind of 2D zero-G movement I want to have. Since I was writing the game code from scratch in Processing (with the exception of the Fisica library for physics) I didn't have time to implement all the systems that would be needed for an exploration/adventure game. I spent most of my time coding the game and coding levels. So I decided to make it a simple traversal game with no story. It became less about exploration and more about figuring out how to make your character ricochet off of ungrabbable surfaces to get to the exit, which turned out to be more challenging and interesting to me than just jumping around.

Unfortunately this is a little bit off-theme now. I didn't have time to make the levels look more like an abandoned space station so you're just going to have to use your imagination. :)

I hope you enjoy my first Ludum Dare entry!

entries.title: Leaf  me Alone
entries.description:
* Postcompo version

JAVA 1.6 OR HIGHER REQUIRED FOR THIS GAME

-------- IMPORTANT!!!!!! --------
I propose you play the the postcompo version instead of the compo version, while keeping in mind the changes I made when rating (see changelog below), for maximum enjoyment. ^^
Download version can take screenshot PNGs.
------------------------------------------------------
Changelog Postcompo (Mainly bugfixes & sound):
1.2.1
- Fixed 1.2 increasing the probability of bushes instead of grass
- Balanced rowan

1.2
- Added cheat key hint to Endless Survival
- Increased the probability of grass for dung
- Added antialiasing, things look smoother now
- Reduced the score points for flowers

1.1
- minor fixes & improvements
- number of flowers and destroyed plants are represented in the score now
- changed cheat key
- added F3 to disable music and F4 to disable sound
- fixed cola being picked up although hitting the ground
- added fade effect
- fixed a game crashing array index out of bounds bug

1.0
- dung has a 1/2 chance only to yield plants on clear
- fixed grass & flower grow rate
- added sound & music
- changed start/skip to spacebar
- changed 0 to NUM 0, added NUM 1-5 for sowing
- cola also decreases the time needed for sowing, uprooting, healing
- (very) minor fixes
- fixed "sliding" at unpassable areas decreasing the walked-stats
- added garden house to show unpassable area at hand-ui
- changed pause menu to pause&help menu
- fixed rotation rendering bug (trembling)
- added score

------------------------------------------------------

You are a gardener.
You just want to work.
But you can't.

So show these kids disturbing you, that you are the boss!

Use WASD or arrow keys to move.
Uproot plants with E or NUM 0.
Plant new ones with 1-5 or NUM 1-5.
Pick up objects by walking over them.
Throw them by clicking,
Drop them by right-clicking.

------------------------------------------------------

Unfortunately it has no sound :(
I just did not have time.

Anyway, GL HF, report bugs please, I'll update the Postcompo Version once I have enought points to add/change/fix.

DO NOT USE THE CHEAT!

Pause with P and make screenshots with F2 (they are saved in C:/LMASS/)
Disable music with F3, mute sounds with F4

------------------------------------------------------

Gameplay Video: http://www.moddb.com/members/ayce/videos/leaf-me-alone-gameplay

------------------------------------------------------

Created in 16 hours, planned in ~6 hours.
Used:
- Eclipse (Java)
- Paint.NET
- Ulead PhotoImpact 10
For Postcompo:
- Audacity
- SFXR
- OpenMPT
- some sfx site I don't remember

entries.title: Moving Day
entries.description:
Your best friend is moving away tonight, so sad. You already feel so alone... like really alone... perhaps insanely alone. Hey, is that your friend? I bet you can catch them!

Whew, I had to cut quite a few things (including animating the player's arms, who needs arms...) but managed to finish in time.

This is my first flash game, I started learning flash this week and it has been a lot of fun. (This is also the most 'complete' game I've worked on so far, Thanks for the motivation!) I'll probably continue working on it a bit more to explore Flixel and to see if this gliding mechanic would be fun with better planned obstacles.

Note: This game includes the mandatory kitten! (vote for meee!)

Controls: Mouse movement controls pitch while gliding, click to Jump. Escape to reset the game. The cursor isn't loaded at first but you can still click play. (the button will light up when you are over it)

Gameplay Note: You can jump higher by pulling up with the mouse, but you will be sacrificing run speed. You can regain some run-speed if you dive mid-jump.

entries.title: Solitas Exodae
entries.description:
Solitas Exodae is closer to an interactive story than a game, I felt like trying out something ambiant.

The game ends after about 5 minutes of gameplay. Your mileage may vary, depending on your style of play and the way the random level is generated.

"[14:08] <Derek> Gaeel, it's the best ld22 game I've played so far."


Windows users who do not want to install Love2D from http://www.love2d.org/ can run the Windows standalone.

Otherwise, all users are invited to install Love2D, and run the .love file.

I'm going to leave the auto-update script running until the compo ends, but then I'll only update these files if a game-breaking bug is found.

Changes since compo end:
- Removed the creation of a framebuffer that was never used in the final game (believed to cause problems on some computers)
- Added then removed the display of a console window for Windows users, for debugging
- Replaced the default DevIL.dll with an alternative that fixes some issues.

If you are still experiencing issues on Windows, PLEASE let me know at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ so I can fix it, but I think it's good now.

entries.title: Super Square Zombie Killer
entries.description:
Super Square is spawned into a very strange and dangerous world. There are no other sentient squares, only square eating zombies! Thankfully Square comes packing heat!

Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z3npMRx7BHE


----- Running The Game ----

Windows Standalone: Unzip the archive. Run game.exe. Shot zombies.

** For the following you'll need LOVE 1.7.2 or later to run the game. You can grab it here: http://love2d.org/

Windows: If love is installed, you can double click super_square_zombie_killer.love to start it. If love is unzipped you can start the game from the command line "love super_square_zombie_killer.love"

Linux: Your distro probably has LOVE in its repos. Once installed, the game can be run from the terminal using "love super_square_zombie_killer.love"

Mac OSX: Grab the binary from http://love2d.org/. Double click on super_square_zombie_killer.love or run from the terminal.

If you have any problems, there's more info at http://love2d.org/wiki/Getting_Started


----- Playing -----
Find the exit without dying! There are some health kits around if you're low on health. Each gun has different properties:

Pistol: Powerful and accurate, but has small magazine size and bullets do not go through zombies

Shotgun: Fires many pellets in a large spread. Useful for pushing back a crowd of zombies, but has a long reload time.

Assault Rifle: Large magazine capacity, medium damage, and bullets go through zombies. Good for general killing.

Light Machine Gun: Powerful and can fire a large number of bullets before being reloaded. Watch out for its large spread and long reload times.


----- Controls -----
Move: W, S, A, D
Reload: R

Pistol: 1
Shotgun: 2
Assault Rifle: 3
Light Maching Gun: 4

Aim: mouse
Shoot: mouse left
Next/prev gun: mouse wheel

Quit to menu: Escape
Toggle fullscreen: F5


----- Settings -----
Fullscreen can be toggled by pressing F5. The default resolution is 800x600. This can be changed by editing the file "conf.lua" in the super_square_zombie_killer.love file. The .love file is really a zip file.

entries.title: The Fruits of Solitude
entries.description:
Imagine sitting alone in a boat, surrounded by nothing but water. The sun shines upon you as you crack open a can of your favorite drink. Life is good. Now, imagine never seeing a human being ever again.

Rather than a more literal approach to the theme, "The Fruits of Solitude" is more analytic. Like the title suggests, this game is about the ups and downs of the solitary spirit. Adventure freely through the open waters, while attempting to find civilization before one dies alone.

Tools:
-Flashpunk
-Flashdevelop
-Famitracker
-Paint.net

Thanks to everyone for the chance to participate in such an event!

entries.title: Adventures of One
entries.description:
"Adventures of One"
http://www.gavpugh.com/ludumdare/ld22/WebPlayer.html

by Gavin Pugh (Drebin on WordPress).

Tools:
- 'Engine' is Unity. Used Visual Studio 2010 to edit the C# code.
- Art in Paint Shop Pro 7
- Sfx generated from the 'Bfxr' website
- Music generated by 'cgMusic'. Then midi to mp3 via http://solmire.com/

Summary:
A turn-based tactical RPG. In a similar vein to the "Shining Force" series of games. Unlike those however, "Adventures of One" consists of just a single member of the heroic force. This lone adventurer has to wipe out a series of battlegrounds of it's demonic spawn. Progressing through each battle unlocks harder enemies, more equipment in the shop, and fancy magic spells.

The terrain layout, and placement of enemies are procedurally generated.

"Adventures of One" has a guest voice-over provided by "The Room"'s Juliette Danielle.

Postmortem, time-lapse, and journal log here:
http://www.gavpugh.com/2011/12/21/ludum-dare-22-postmortem-journal-and-timelapse/

The goal of you is to isolate your self into as far as you can into the building. Originally there was a monster that was following you in the wake of the darkness (you are a kid who woke up in a car near the gas station)

Ohwell, looking forward for the next one :)

entries.title: Alone With a Phone
entries.description:
My concept for AWAP was you're a guy who is lonely, so you use your phone to send messages and get popular. As it goes on it gets more difficult until you can't keep up and you lose all your popularity and the game ends. Then, once again, you are alone with a phone.

This is my first Ludum Dare. It was fantastic. Really happy that I heard about it and was able to get it. Had a very busy weekend with other things but I got a lot of good work done and learned a lot. And had fun.

Please enjoy Alone With a Phone! Let me know what you think, and I can't wait to play everyone else's games!

entries.title: Enola
entries.description:
Enola is actually "Alone" backwards. You have to figure out why this "backwards" thing.
This is actually an "exploration" game, since it has no combat or any kind of "fast-paced action." The whole idea is for you to roam around and figure out what is that place and why you are there.
The game was made using UDK, and to keep things simple I opted for a first person view (pretty much staying away from modeling and animating a character). BTW, I hate how the binaries turned out so big for such a small game...
This was my first LD and I really had fun, trying to come up with a simple concept really quick and see how it evolved as I developed the game.
Notes:
Just unzip and double click the "launch.bat" file
The game runs at a windowed resolution of 1280x720
You need a graphic card that supports SM3 to run the game.

NOTES:
Postmortem link above
If you get a *dx*.dll device error, you need DirectX 9 installed: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=8109
If you get the msvcr100.dll error, you need Visual C++ 2008 Redist: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=10015
You may also need Visual C++ 2010 Redist, but above redists should do the trick: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=5555

entries.title: Enslaving Davement
entries.description:
Use the newgrounds link. Press UP next to beds and doors to go to the next level! Collect pills to not die. musical Notes are optional.

TIMELAPSE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rAZlTgyMqYQ&feature=youtu.be



Take the role as Duke (or you???). You're a super fan of Davement, the famous '90s rock band! You've traveled back in time to 1990, but are now stuck and alone! Help Duke fight his anxiety disorder through many meds! Also help duke (OR YOURSELF?!??) take over Davement and become the new frontman, by writing their album ahead of time and beating up the members (via respectively collecting body-sized notes, and breaking into their houses!)


Hi, I'm Sean (seagaia) - this is my first Ludum Dare Entry, and actually my first game I've ever come sort of close to completing. For more, read the journal! All source is at my github. You can download the standalone .swfs from there - included are the .ptcop (pxtone notation files) for the songs if you're interested at all (though these, of course, are quite rushed :) ).

Enjoy!

entries.title: Holdout
entries.description:
For 30 years Hiro Kurasawa has patrolled a small, forgotten island in the South Pacific. Having never been informed that World War II ended decades ago, he has waited patently for his chance to defend his island for the glory of the emperor. 

One day while inspecting his fortifications, hostile forces begin to storm the beach! Finally the moment he has waited for arrives: A full blown American invasion from the sea.

Dodge flying tridents and protect your cache of ammo against a merciless assault from the full force of American military might.

entries.title: Isolation Ball
entries.description: One of that various doodles I did trying to find inspiration.  Made in an hour or so.

entries.title: Leave my Lettuce Alone :(
entries.description:
Whilst your owner is away, you, a black cat, have been left to guard
the family's lettuce patches. It's currently breeding season for rabbits,
so there are lots of hungry kittens about.

Controls are very simple, the black cat will always follow your cursor,
and the rabbits will be avoiding the black cat whilst also trying to eat
all of the lettuce. The rabbits hate being seperated, so what you need to
do is try to split them up so they get scared and run away whilst simultaneously
preventing the lettuce patches from being eaten!

All game code is written in C++, and my own engine, Psybrus, was used.

PS: It is known to work in Linux under Wine, and also runs in OSX with Wine.

entries.title: Munching Mammoth Mutant Frog?!!

entries.title: Rocket Man Stan
entries.description:
So, fine gentlemen, gentlewomen, and gentlealiens, I present to you Rocket Man Stan!

Set in the early 70s, follow our intrepid hero, Stan, as he fights his way off of a Soviet-invaded moon after a covert USAF mission goes awry on the dark side of the moon! Get him to safety by destroying all the Soviet robots Goomba-style so that he can radio for help!

Some back story:

This was GOING to be an LD48 entry, but due to a last minute(literally) happening coming up, I was not able to submit, so I took the extra day and polished it up some. Later I'll make this into a full-blown game, for Eggplant Animation(eggplantanimation.com). This is my second LD, first one alone, and I think I did pretty well, considering what I learned over the course of 48 hours and what I couldn't do just last summer. Uses Flash and Flixel, with FlashDevelop and DAME to help. I plan to release the source sometime in the next month.

Controls:

Left/Right to move, Space to jump. Kill those robots, 9 in all, by jumping on top of them ("goomba-style"). The health bar is in the upper-left corner, with the number of lives left next to it.

-Dr. Quigley the Insane

entries.title: Rubber Ball in a Dark Room
entries.description:
Messed around with Construct 2 for 7 hours, just to try out the software, and tried to make something cool - didn't work out, so I went for the art-y approach... 

Is this a comment on the human condition? Probably not, but is there something more "alone" than a person bouncing a fluorescent-green rubber ball in a dark room?

---

There is no goal, grab ball with left-click.
