entries.title: The Last Geek
entries.description:
First : some levels might be hard. Very hard. Even if I made sure they can ALL be done, i've seen myself how frustrating some levels can be. USE THE MOUSE in case you're desperate and want to see the end of the game.
I didn't have time to make music, sadly.
Please play it, I put a lot of effort into it !
There is a tutorial, but in case you wonder :
use the arrows to move and jump around, space to aim and C to fire seeds (if you have some). Also "V" to clear the screen from bodies.

This is a story of the last man on Earth, a random geek who survived the apocalypse by staying at home, playing video games.
Now he runs around naked, and goes on a quest to get a girlfriend to repopulate Earth.

entries.title: YANA
entries.description:
controls:
a/d: move left/right
w: jump
d: enter door
1-8: select different blocks from inventory
r: reset to checkpoint
u: toggle BGM
i/o: enable/disable level editor
left mouse button: place block
middle mouse button: clone block in level editor(inventory slot 9)
right mouse button: remove block
mouse wheel: select previous/next block in level editor(inventory slot 9)

about the editor:
the inventory in the HUD has 9 slots
slots 1-8 are for regular gameplay, the currently selected slot has a red border
slot 9 is for the editor,
slot 9 also has a blue border when in regular mode, and a green border in editor mode, just to make the mode extra clear

when you are in editor mode, you will always place the block in slot 9, regardless of which slot is selected

i also just found out there is a bug in slots 7 - 9, so MAND/AND gates are only place-able from editor mode, this because i only added a place-able block for slots 7/8 a few hours before finishing/submitting the game, and i had forgotten to disable slot 9, and properly implement the block placement for slots 7 and 8

mostly sandbox-style game since i am not really good at level design

also the first LD i participated in

recolored version(text is a brighter/less transparent color, making it easier to read)
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/11493437/LD22%20recolor.rar

no-bg + recolored version(removed background tiling, should provide the best readability)
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/11493437/LD22%20nobg.rar

no-audio version, this should work for people getting the "requested buffer too large" exception
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/11493437/LD22%20noAudio.rar

and a no-audio version of the recolor/no-bg version
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/11493437/LD22%20noAudio%20-%20NoBG.rar

i am placing these links here since i want to keep the original compo entry the same as when it was submitted

time-lapse: http://youtu.be/BSzW4X7YbLk

if you're getting a "requested buffer too large" exception, this seems to be caused by the mac version of JRE limiting the audio buffer size to 1 MB, for those people i've added a few new versions without the audio

entries.title: A Puzzling Loneliness
entries.description:
I recommend you download the swf.
Please do not resise the window if you do not want to see nasty looking messiness.
Please post a comment if the newgrounds link is broken or something, I will upload it elsewhere.

Sorry about the suckiness, this was my first LD and my first
ever project completed to a playable standard.
I was quite glad to end this, as I started and finished it in the
most awkward way possible, from this I have gained the
skills to know in the future how to structure things. Please
don't tell me about bugs, I already know and to fix most of
them would require more time, which I do not have. And I
can't be bothered to fix them, I am very happy to have
'finished' this. Also, this was quite a tricky theme for me to
do an original idea, I know it doesn't fit the theme, entering
into LD is mainly for fun and experience and feedback.
Please do take into account all these things before you
leave feedback, thank you.

See you next LD!


Bonecuss

entries.title: Alone in Space
entries.description:
A little Flash adventure game. The original intention was to have a series of clues leading up to the character discovering what happened to the crew, but alas, time restraints caused me to scrap that.

Tools used:
FlashDevelop
FlashPunk
Ogmo Editor
MaskedPixel's OgmoExtentions to FlashPunk
Paint.net
sfxr

This is the first time that I've used Flashpunk (and the first time using Actionscript in a couple of years). I decided to enter the Jam about two hours before it started, so despite not finishing the game to a level I was happy with, I wasn't displeased with my progress (especially since I had to do Christmas shopping too during the jam!).

Special thanks to my brother for contributing some ideas and  some of the tile graphics.

entries.title: Alone in the Universe
entries.description:
Space can be a lonely, empty place. Especially when your ship is crippled and you've lost all contact with your people. You will need to control your ship manually while avoiding those dangerous gravity wells! Can you orbit the sun? How about finding all 8 planets? Enjoy.

Made with Unity, Paint.net, GIMP, Blender, sfxr.

Procedural textures created with tools available from:
http://donjon.bin.sh/scifi/world/
http://alexcpeterson.com/spacescape
http://orbithangar.com/searchid.php?ID=2542

Also used some scripts available from the Unity community wiki.

entries.title: Apollo Kepler-22b
entries.description:
My First LD, had a lot of fun and I'm really proud of the game I have made! I hope you like it too!

The tools used were:

Engine: Unity 3.4
Code: C# in Visual C# Express
3D graphics: Blender 2.6
2D graphics: Paint.NET / InkScape
Sound: AudaCity / WolframTones / Bfxr

Don't forget there is another game mode to play when you pass the first one! Be sure to check it out. And also remember to post in the comments what your high score is!

I also used the terrain toolkit library from Unity Technologies

entries.title: Basketball ~for the lonely~
entries.description:
removed the new version since I think I fixed more than bugs... so here's the original 48h version. Newer version is in another link.

This is my take on the theme this time. When I was younger I really enjoy playing basket ball by myself. You can do all the weird things and shoot as more as you like. And when thinking about 2D basketball game one should immediately relate to the NES game <<Nekketsu! Street Basket - Ganbare Dunk Heroes>>. Here's a video to remind you:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5W4EpO5ge9w

So in the game we have three baskets in a row!
I really hope you can enjoy this. This is by far my favorite game by myself and I think I'll continue working on it and try to make it more fun after this compo.

ad / arrow - move and control shooting
z / space - hold to jump and release to shoot
r / x - reset the ball

entries.title: Bouncy Balls
entries.description:
This is my third game in Ludum Dare. I tried my best so far in this one spending soooo much time to get it done. I agreed that I would do a physics game for this Ludum because everyone loves physics. The only hard part was fitting the theme into it which I got an idea for. It took me a lot of resources to make this game so I will list them here:
-Photoshop (Huge help)
-Mixcraft (My Audio from guitar and synth)
-Audacity (Lowering or sound files)
-FlashDevelop (The program for flash 'Duh')
-FlashPunk Classes
-Box2d physics
-Probably more that I cant think of right now

Audio: Created by mixcraft mainly. The sounds were either recorded from my guitar or a composition of notes in mixcraft

Graphics: I basically used vectors and textures in PS for the graphics. This took a good portion of the time I had. The trash can especially took the longest because of 2 layers

Theme: I came up with a story line sort of for the whole game. I said that you were a kid growing up with your family and your family is leaving for a Christmas party and you dont wanna go. So you stay home and you cant find anything to do. Eventually you find a bouncy ball and start playing with it and that is what the game is based off of. It continues through the different levels

GamePlay:
The concept of the game is to do teh objective of the level, which is usually to knock down all of the blocks or get the ball into the trash can. But there is variation involved in the later levels
-Walls
-Red Blocks
-Gravity
-Stars
-Limited bounces
-Much more!

Good luck to everyone participating in Ludum Dare 22!!

entries.title: Circle
entries.description:
Circle for Ludum Dare 22, by RichMakeGame
www.richmakegame.com
[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
twitter: #RichMakeGame

controls:

+ and - change mouse sensitivity
wasd- move
space - jump
left mouse - throw stone


NOTE- I didn't fully get to finish the game I'm afraid, after a certain point the game will loop back to the beginning. Please don't keep playing it to see if something's different! (er, well you can keep playing if you like but.. yeah it'll be the same :P)

thanks, and sorry it's not more finished! I bit off more than I could chew
-rich

PS- audio credit for the birdsong is to 'reinsamba' on freesound.org

entries.title: Dark and Alone
entries.description:
This little game I built in 1 Day turned out pretty good I Think, It is based on a boy that is lost and needs to find his way back home.. .But it is dark outside, and the Monsters are out! So watch out and have a safe trip home.

To gain an extra life, you must collect Kittens!!

Controls:
A,D to Move
Space to Jump
Click to Interact with Objects

The game was a little short because I only had 1 day to make it and I was on my Own, and thats also the reason I couldnt add sound (and I have no idea how to create sounds).

entries.title: First
entries.description:
My second Ludum Dare entry. I think the game is pretty much self-explanatory.
Your main task is to collect the glowing particles.

This time I tried to keep the game as simple as possible and focus on the graphics/sound. While I could not finish every detail I wanted, I am still quite happy with the result.
I hope you like it.

Controls:
WASD or arrow keys. Nothing else needed.

entries.title: Forever Alone
entries.description:
Arrows/WASD to move, mouse to look, space to jump.

I recommend playing fullscreen for the best experience (browser or standalone). Also, the audio is pretty quiet so if you don't hear anything, turn your sound up.

Note: I went for atmosphere rather than fun, so bear in mind that the theme was 'alone' and try to get in the mood and play along.

Made using Unity with MonoDevelop, Audacity, FL Studio and a little bit of Blender.


p.s. Even though I went for atmosphere, there are still a few minor "glitches" (which I prefer to think of as Easter Eggs) that can be quite fun to exploit after you've played it properly.

entries.title: I Am Alone: Top Down Survival Shooter
entries.description:
The Fiends came down from the sky... The burnt our cities to ash and murdered our families... I am Alone - Earth's sole survivor and I want vengeance.

Top down survival shooter:
* Two alien types used in random enemy generation (speed, health and tracking time).
* Ranking based on number of kills and survival time.
* Random health pickups.
* Five types of projectiles used in random weapon generation (rate of fire and spread):
-Pistol Round
-Rifle Round
-Fireball
-Lazer
-Weaver

entries.title: KIitty
entries.description:
Help the lonely kitten find it's way back to home.

This game only has one level, and unfortunately there was no time for character animation.

Written in haXe / NME.

entries.title: Last Stand
entries.description:
My tribute to MechWarrior.
Becaues nothing makes You feel more alone than beeing in a 20+ ton machine on a desolate, lifeless planet.

Cool features:
* Large open terrain levels.
* Two full music tracks.
* You can blow stuff up.
* Full plot including sinster beings from outerspace.
* BattleMechs!

Windows requirements:
Java (most preferably recent)

Linux requirements:
Java
OpenAL

INSTRUCTIONS:
Control: WSAD / Arrows + Spacebar + mouse

Included is a configuration app that will enable you to set graphical quality, resolution etc.
NOTE: Unless necessery don't modify the sound settings.

To run the game launch run.bat or run.sh
To run the configuration app launch run_conig.bat or run_config.sh

Mac OS X version (hopefully) comming soon :)

entries.title: Loneliness
entries.description:
Guide your little (kitty?) friend through a lonely place. Help him gather other and became less lonely. Also, see the world gain more colors as you gather... those... colorfull balls. xD

As you becomes (more or) less lonely, your sprite change to represent that. A blue sprite means lots of loneliness. A green kitty means you aren't alone, but can get less lonely. A green dog means that you aren't alone at all. Also, it enables shooting (I missed the sprite on the main menu to explain that... my bad).

You get points by:
	-not being lonely: your "points over time" grows as you get less lonely.
	-killing the bad guys.

So far, the known bugs are:
	- everything spawns only in the top left corner.
	- difficulty is totally unbalanced
	- loneliness bar doesn't quite works as expected*
	- you doesn't need to get balls to become less lonely

I shouldn't have slacked off so much. >_<
Because of that, there're lots of bugs, there's no bgm during the game... only in the tile...

*Initially, I imagined the bar fixed in the top-left, only with the right side moving (expanding/retracting).


@OFF: I know that I suck at explaining... but I just noticed that I suck even more at explaining in english. xD


[EDIT 01/05]I'm moving the compo version of my entry to dropbox so I can update de kongregate version. I was going to wait until judgind ends... but I can't help but really want to update the game. >_<
Next time I'll just upload it to dropbox from the start...[/EDIT]

entries.title: LUDUM DARODIUS
entries.description:
LUDUM DARODIUS
---------------------------------------------

Chicky is around again! But also, THERE ARE JUST TOO MANY **** (I can't even say it...)

LEAVE ME ALONE! is what Chicky thinks. Luckily, the newest version of his plane has a gun!

SPACE to fly, ARROW KEYS allow Chicky to shoot. Or, if you get tired from shooting, press A to turn autofire on/off (it's slower than you can shoot, though)

Automatic saving

Oh yeah, there's a kitten hidden. If you can find it, you can keep it ^^
EDIT: yeah yeah, you can't call it hidden if there's a screenshot. But I added it so you won't give up midway

Have fun everyone!

entries.title: Neukoelln Nights
entries.description:
You are on the way to a party hosted by the  girl of your dreams.
Arriving extra late to improve your chances of spending quality time with her alone, you realize there are still some people at the party to get rid of...


a game by:
Robert Boehnke (code)
Merlin Bernard (art & animation)
David Junge (art & animation)
Sebastian Kessler (design)

controles:
+ zoom browser to enlarge
+ just click to play

If you are using Firefox or Chrome be sure to have a recent version.

entries.title: Node 2F40E
entries.description:
If you make it onto the yellow square you've passed the first level ;o)

If you get stuck check out this Playthrough Video: http://youtu.be/ZPGIo4bdtgU

NB: it's not complete might have suffered from high ideas and poor time management!

Still It's playable but feature poor, so be kind with your feedback ;o)

Solo effort used EZGUI with Unity so couldn't enter LD48!

Note: It should challenge you if it's too easy let me know!

I will work on this further this week as I like the idea!

entries.title: Rectangle Dude in a Bombed Building
entries.description:
My second game after a Pong clone. It's barely a game, but I had almost no experience, and learnt quite a lot about graphics, programming and game design by making it.

Arrow keys to move. Space or up key to jump. Down to enter doors.

You need LOVE 0.7.2 or 0.8.0 ( http://love2d.org/ ) to play using the .love file.

Linux users who wish to use the standalone binary should make sure they have SDL, OpenGL, OpenAL, Lua, DevIL, FreeType, PhysicsFS, ModPlug, mpg123 and vorbisfile. You probably have them all except for Lua and SDL (if you've never played a game).

I'll update with Windows binaries later.

.love file is a zip archive. Source is inside it.

entries.title: Space Rescue Mission
entries.description:
My first LD game, a game about space, but not about being alone in space. Its about rescuing astronauts that were left alone on distant planets. 

Controls:
WASD or Arrow keys - Control ship
Mouse - controll turret
Mouse Button - Shoot
Space - Land (when possible)

Note: The 64-bit linux version is not tested, if it dosen't work, you can try the 32-bit one. It should work even if you're system is 64-bit

entries.title: The Library of Madness
entries.description:
To run, just unzip the folder and run library_of_madness.exe.

Enjoy!  This is my first entry into ludum dare.  It was created with Python 2.7 and pygame only.  Music was created with MilkyTracker.

This is a roguelike prototype and it takes some inspiration from the C'thulu mythos and games like Amnesia: The Dark Descent.  Send me a message on Twitter @protensity and tell me what you think!

Time lapse videos are available here: http://preordercancelled.com/ludum-dare-timelapse-videos/

entries.title: The Search
entries.description:
The Search is a community game for Ludum Dare 22 "Alone" by Quin.

You play as your civilization's scientific leadership over a span of decades. Each day of real time represents one year of progress in The Search, so you'll want to come back often to review findings, change policies, and adjust budget allocation.

Here in the heart of the galaxy, stars are separated by 1 - 6 lightyears so it can take several years for radio signals to reach distant worlds.

entries.title: The Travel Section
entries.description: You're a travel columnist who's been stranded on the wrong side of the country you are assigned to write about! Take on odd jobs and have cultural experiences so that you can not only catch your flight, but also write a good article!

entries.title: There Can Only Be Static
entries.description:
What happens to a programmer when he loses connection to the internet? You tend to lose a bit of yourself.

Tools Used:
  FlashDevelop
  Ogmo Level Editor
  FL Studio
  SFXR

Time Taken:
  < 48 hours

Contact Info:
  Richard Harrison
  [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
  www.richardesigns.com

Special Thanks:
  GD22 - For being awesome and coming to visit.
  Chevy Ray - For being Flash God and preparing me for this.

entries.title: Zombie Apocalypse
entries.description: Your aim is to either survive as long as you possibly can or to kill as many zombies as you can, before dying.

entries.title: Abyss
entries.description:
The game is a 2D platformer where the player must navigate a dark cave with nothing more than a flashlight.

My original intent was to have the entire cave decorated with grass/plants/rock/etc..., but due to time and an inability to properly light them, these were dropped.

As such, 90% of the "art" is just primitive objects.

Try not to laugh, it's my first LD.

--Ryan Schaefer

entries.title: Adrift
entries.description:
Move with the arrow keys or WASD, drag the camera around with the mouse. I was hoping to get a more automatic camera sorted but you know how it is. The ending doesn't quite end properly, but other than that I am really pleased with how it works.

.jar file mirror: http:/www.jwlawson.co.uk/files/adrift.jar
source code mirror: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/32480884/adrift.zip

Made in Java using LibGDX. This was my first Ludum Dare competition and I thoroughly enjoyed it, but probably not as much as I will enjoy getting some sleep.

entries.title: Alone
entries.description:
WASD or arrow keys to move. QE to strafe.
Mouse clicks to interact.
Go be with your friends.

entries.title: Alone (Except for some Snakes)
entries.description:
Note:
There are some bugs with the resetting of the game when you die; currently I know of the planks being kept between days. This is not intentional; I would suggest relaunching / refreshing the game after you die to make sure nothing is persistent to see my actual intentions.

Note:
I report a sharp decrease in FPS on the web version, so you might prefer to play on an application, or with the source (which is the fastest).

Instructions can be found on the title:
Move with WASD.
Spacebar chops down trees & eats fruits.
Mouse left destroys (at expense of hunger).
Mouse right creates (at expense of planks).

X marks the spot.
Collect treasure the treasure there (one meter of how well you did).


Snakes move faster at night! Also, beware the large snakes. They can break through walls.

So, to detail the game.
The map is generated, and, slowly regenerated.

You need to have sustenance to keep surviving- you fill your hunger bar by eating fruit. Time and snakes empty it.

Cutting down trees (space) gives you planks to use.


(Source (alone) is as of approximately 6:30 EST; slight bugfixes since then. Source with executables matches executables' code.

Made with Paint.net, Processing.org, Minim software, on the Java platform. Sound made with Hamienet converter, Anvil Studio, SFXR, and Audacity. Source in the form of plaintext .pde (Processing.org Development Environment files))

(Provided with Attribution Only Open CC Licence)

entries.title: Alone and Stranded
entries.description: Alone and stranded is a survival game, I know my source and game could use some work but my game changed a lot in terms of ideas and I got rid of a lot of ideas I had for it. I also gave up for a while, so it's probably more like 30-40 hours rather than 48. I'm happy I finished it though.

entries.title: Alone:The Island Adventure
entries.description:
You can press M to mute the audio. Game was made with FlashDevelop + Flashpunk + Gimp. 

Music was generated with this :
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/13/if-you-find-it-hard-to-make-music-read-this/

entries.title: Alonzo
entries.description:
You are Alonzo. The game starts with you waking up in a strange place, with rows of buildings on either side of you that all look the same. Seemingly repeated over and over again. You keep walking until you get to a bridge Don't fall off ;)

Up ahead is a foreboding structure made up of the same buildings. Whats on the other side? Did I mention that you are also a minotaur? Get to the end of the maze for the reveal as to where Alonzo has woken up.

Don't forget to put sound on. Original background music composed on Sunday to set the mood.

I have many more ideas for the rest of the game :)
One is adding footprints so that you know where you've been in the maze.
Alternatively a minimap that reveals as you explore, to make navigating the maze easier. The maze isn't that big...but it would frustrate a casual gamer. Could have different difficullty levels.

Created in Unity3D. All graphical assets were from Unity or the Envato Indie Game Dev Bundle - http://3docean.net/bundles/indiegamedev

entries.title: Brothers
entries.description:
This is a game about brothers who share a bed.

Use the mouse to nudge the colored dots away from their bodies. Try not to let the dots come in contact with the opposing brother.

The narrative poetry was provided by my friend, Matthew Hocker. (dearmeat.me) Everything else is by me.

Newgrounds is currently having some issues with their portal, so I'm temporarily hosting the game on their file dump.

entries.title: Courage Quest
entries.description:
A platforming adventure. Complete your tasks before the day is over.

----

Framework is my own "TriadNME" system, for haXe/NME.

Pixels done in the TriadNME editor, Cosmigo Pro Motion, and GIMP.

Sound and music synthesized and tracked with Renoise, Synth1, and IL Harmless, with additional editing in Audacity.

entries.title: Delirium!
entries.description:
My first LD48 Entry and the most advanced game I've ever written so far.

You are alone in the woods. Hallucinations are (almost) scaring you to death. Survive!

Please press F1 ingame to learn more ; )

Sadly there was not much time left building a nice map, nice AI, partial map loading or to fix other performance issues.

I hope you can nevertheless enjoy my game and imagine what will evolve out of this raw piece of code : )

entries.title: Dungeons of Solitude
entries.description:
Your only friend has gotten lost in a dungeon. Traverse the deadly place while finding weapons and items to help you on your way.


Controls

Arrow keys - Move
Z - Stab sword  (Only after you find it)
X - Use assigned item
Enter - Open/Close Inventory
Press Z or X while in the inventory to set an item
F4 - Enter/Exit fullscreen mode
Esc - Exit game

entries.title: Feeling Alone
entries.description:
You are alone.
You have bad feelings.
Free yourself from them!

Shoot all the bad feelings on the screen and get to the exit before the time runs out!

Use arrow keys to move (left/right to rotate, up for engines) and spacebar to shoot!

This is my first Ludum Dare entry :)

I used Adobe Flash CS5 for art,
AS3 and Starling for programming,
sfxr and Guitar Pro 4 for sound effects and music.

To run in windows, just double click the html file.

Please reply and tell me what you think!

Idan

entries.title: Forever a-zombie
entries.description:
you are the last zombie and you don't want to be alone!

left/right rotate
up move
s special

made with ruby + gosu

entries.title: Lighthouse Keeper
entries.description:
You have 1 minute to collect enough fuel (160 or more) for the lighthouse to work at night.

Controls:
Arrow keys to move around.
A to harvest wood/oil from trees.
S to punch wolves in the face.

entries.title: Lonely God Dude
entries.description:
The God Dude, the god of the universe, is a very lonely omnipotent individual. He is stuck in a big, empty universe with no one else around.

He decides to change this by making little Dudes to entertain him! He is, after all, A GOD!!!

The only problem is that the God Dude doesn't like death. If five of his Dudes kill each other, he will get so depressed that he will send the rest of them into the darkness of the universe. So, see how long you can last!

Info:
At the second evolution onwards, the dudes will start firing at each other. You can click to heal them one point of health. Health is 4 * evolution level, so they start out with 4 health at the beginning of the game.

At the final evolution, they split into two baby dudes and it starts again.

Record thus far is one minute and four seconds (my record). *PLEASE POST A SCREENSHOT IF (when) YOU BEAT MY RECORD!!! :D *

NOTE: if you can't get the game to run, PLEASE make sure you have .NET 4.0 installed! You can download it here: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

entries.title: Lonely Star
entries.description:
The goal of each level is to be alone.

The Windows version requires Vista, I think, the graphics will not load on Windows XP.  The Mac version is universal PowerPC / Intel and requires OS X 10.5.  A Linux version can be built from source, instructions are included (requires GtkGLExt and some other things).

I used C++ for the engine.  Graphics were made with Crayola markers, a pen, and The GIMP.

entries.title: Mad Trolls
entries.description:
You are stranded on a island. You must kill all the trolls alone to win. Made in Lua with LOVE.

Notes:
- You get resources by punching stuff
- Crafting is done automatically once you have enough resources
- Game will quit once you die. You must restart the game to play again

Known Bugs:
- You may see weird lines when playing. Sorry, didn't have time to fix this.

entries.title: Nihil
entries.description:
You wander lost in a decaying world of abandonment where your worst nightmares lurk. . .

Primarily inspired by horror author, Thomas Ligotti, this is a survival horror roguelike and my first game. Much of the code is based on the libtcod tutorial by Jotaf located on Roguebasin.

There is no particular goal, but that's because I didn't have enough time add one to the game.

The tools I used were Python, libtcod, Pygame (for sound), and py2exe.

There is a bug where when you close the game an error pops up that says "See the logfile 'C:\path\to\game\Nihil.exe.log' for details." Ignore that. It doesn't affect the game. I'm sure how to fix that. Sorry.

entries.title: Rover's Spirit
entries.description:
You are a Mars rover, and have recently lost contact with Earth. You stumble across a martian prison and must explore the area.

Controls: arrow keys to move, Z to interact.

This game will run on pretty much any hardware (minimum OpenGL 1.5). On my netbook, only non-power-of-two textures weren't being displayed correctly, but it still played fine.

If you keep your system updated, you'll have .NET 4 (Windows 7 has it by default), but just in case you get an error about not having .NET, you can download it here: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=24872

Just tested this on another machine, you'll need to have OpenAL installed too. If the game doesn't do anything at the beginning, this is your issue, download and install OpenAL here: http://connect.creativelabs.com/openal/Downloads/oalinst.zip

You can still play this game on Linux or OS X, you just need to download Mono separately and run "mono /path/to/entry/RoversSpirit.exe"

entries.title: Soap
entries.description:
Use the arrow keys to move.
Press R to reset.

The ending for the game is not made so the last level can't be beaten.

entries.title: The Ice Maze
entries.description:
You went iceskating with some friends but you lost them. Now you have to navigate through a slippery labyrinth ALONE.

Click on the block or the floor tile to move in its direction. Reach the marked tile to proceed to the next level.

entries.title: Turbo Singulation 6000
entries.description:
Use mouse button to remove all things, except the lonely one.

Not much of an entry, as usual. Figured the idea was interesting but it needs more elaborate generation rules to make the levels consistently challenging. Made it in the last four hours of the compo. One of these years I will actually put in an effort, promise!

entries.title: Welcome to TheCity
entries.description: You just became a new TheCity resident. But why nobody else is there ? Discover TheCity hidden truth.

entries.title: You're Alone.
entries.description:
Hey, so this is my entry. 
It was made in about 20-25 hours, 

This was made using unity3D. 

I wanted to focus on the "Alone against many" rather than being alone..well Alone, without any people, Hope that does make sense :)

Please tell me if you find any bugs, or have any trouble getting the game,
Thanks !

entries.title: A dark dream
entries.description:
Tools:
VS2010 express c# for windows phone
Nokia Lumia 800
Inkscape
Ableton Live

I will port the game for windows ASAP, should be just a matter of recompiling it for desktop XNA.

This is my first entry in Ludum Dare.
Used time was Saturday ~10 hours and sunday ~4 hours.
Sadly I had to travel sunday and missed alot of useful time.

This demo is therefor only 4 levels but I hope you can get the idea.

Controls
2 arrow buttons to move left and right.
Touch to send a burst of particle to reveal the level topology and to illuminate all the lights in the level at the same time to complete the level

The lights will slowly fade out.

link to xna framework: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Alone Ozone
entries.description:
You are the last remaining molecule of Ozone of the Ozone Layer. For the first time on your life you are ALONE.

As the last of your kin, you will put all your effort in protecting all the humanity from the evil UV rays. You must reflect them back to where they came from.

But stay sharp, those humans will keep sending CFCs to the upper space. They already destroyed your entire family... Avoid contact with this insidious molecules.

Fortunately not all humans are insensitive to the O3 molecules epic quest, some of them will also send some help. You should use it.

As your parents told you: "Life is about Observation, Orbitation and Obstruction, that's the true O3."


Use the mouse to play, and try to reach the highest score you can.

Note: The game resolution is 1024x768, if you play it on browser you may want to use full screen mode.

Made with Stencyl, GIMP, sfxr, Audacity and FL Studio.

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Alone, the Game
entries.description: A 5 level game assembled with Unity, Maya, Audacity, SFXR, and   lots of luck.

entries.title: AloneWithZzZobmies
entries.description:
Hi everyone. This is my first ludum dare. I am beginner programmer in unity3D. I spended something about 20hours+ in front of the computer to finish this game .. most of the time I was trying to repair some stupid mistakes :D


My game is mix of action and adventure... I hope I can call it like that. Your main objective is not to get eaten by zombies, throw bricks in zombies and complete several tasks.

If you dont know what to do next, just try to find objects that are glowing in the dark(turn off flashlight and look around) 

Unfotunately there is no sound :/

There are almost for sure some bugs in this game. I had no time to try everything. + sorry for my english used in game ...and here :D  

Controls: W,A,S,D -move
          LeftMouseButton - throwing bricks and shooting 
          E - use
          Space - jump
          Esc - end the game


Enjoy! ... I`am looking forward to reading your comments.

IF YOU HAVE TOO LOW FPS GAME WILL BE LITTLE BUGED
(there are some parts based on timing)

links.label: Web(click on game screen to lock the mouse)
Gameplay Video(watch it if you dont know what to do)

entries.title: Cat Vend
entries.description: Cat Vend.  I ran out of time to do the claw cable and some other stuff because of family holiday stuff, but what I have is still good IMHO.  I cranked out the song in one take (per track) this morning to help the game align to the theme.  It has some issues, as most applets done in a couple of hours might, but it is actually winnable and also has a hidden kitten (aside from the cat character).  It works for me on windows 7 in IE and firefox, although it appears to try to take over firefox's keys... just close the tab, sorry about that.

entries.title: Dead World
entries.description:
About
-------
Dead World is an adventure game with a twist - you play in a world made up of a mixture of the worlds of many other players. Every new area you explore is 'loaned' from the server, and when you die they are returned to the server with any changes you make.

How to Play
-----------
WASD or Arrow Keys: Move
E: Pickup/Putdown
SPACE: Attack
For more help see: http://tombstone.gnomelogic.com:42000/help.html
IMPORTANT: Buildings _must_ be constructed in one of the 4 corners of the map!

Credits
-------
Code: Finn Stokes, Saxon Douglass
Graphics: Rory Stokes
Sound: Jaime von Schwarzburgg, Joshua Douglass-Molloy

entries.title: Derpmiffo's rescue mission
entries.description: Ending is broken due to lack of time.

entries.title: Dwarven Isolation
entries.description:
Do you HATE dwarves? And explosions?

Then you'll LOVE ensuring that explosive dwarves stay alone.

(Also, for gameplay, note that dwarves can see yellow squares. You cannot place anything on squares that are yellow or adjacent to a yellow square)

entries.title: Erased
entries.description:
In the dimension our hero comes from, an evil tyrant has banned magic. After leading the resistance, he was banished - censored out of his very existence. Now he wanders the shadowlands, a realm of broken dreams and forgotten things.

Ancient rumor speaks of a relic of lost happiness at the top of a tall tower, that can take one to a new world. Now it's our only hope.

Map screen:
WASD or arrows to move
Space or enter to interact.
Tilde or M for upgrade menu (every 3 monster victories gives an upgrade point)

Battle screen:
1234 or QWER will activate the spells listed at the bottom of the screen.


Spells:
Rapid - 1MP, 1 damage. +2 bonus damage to poisoned enemies.
Solo - 3MP, 4 damage. (supposed to proc extra Spark damage, did not have time)
Poison - 1MP, 0 damage. +Poison
Spark - 2MP, 2 damage. Each consecutive action raises the mana cost *and* damage. (poison is supposed to reduce its efficiency, did not have time)

Edit: Whoops, source link is up now.

entries.title: Fernands War
entries.description:
You are Fernand, security officer on a remote mining planet. There is trouble in the air and you are the one to protect the colony.
Thrust through the mining tunnels in your ship, avoiding the hazzards and shooting all the enemies you can imagine.
Collect the Log files to piece together what has happened to the colony.
NOTE: there is a wee problem with the collision on the spinning sawblades (spoiler LOL) so keep away from the corners mmkay?! xx
Written in Java using the slick2d library.

entries.title: ForeverAloneKitten
entries.description:
A Kitten awakes, finding itself with a note by its side in a cold frozen land...

Game uses mouse input.


postmortem on doing my first LD is here:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/19/forever-alone-kitten-postmortem-brain-dump/

entries.title: Incident of the Crates
entries.description:
Move - Arrow Keys
Open Crates - Space
Drop Mines - C
Use Medipack - X

You just wanted to explore the fields on your own!

Medipack heals 10 HP.

Easter-Egg for kitten fans.

I know that there ARE some collision bugs. I don't want to fix them.

entries.title: Lone Ghosthunter
entries.description:
[Update, 20.12] I added Linux and Mac ports!
[Update, 21.12] added web-version!
[Update, 22.12] Fixed 64-bit problem

My Timelapse video
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aRz5zTCwHGE

entries.title: Lonely Space Marshal
entries.description:
**** USE ARROW KEYS TO MOVE AND SPACE TO SHOOT ****

It's kinda lame ;) I ran out of time to add more enemies, levels and so on.. But I did something.

Tested on Linux and Windows. A Mac friend could not run the java applet, can someone with a Mac give me some feedback on either the applet or from the zip file. So I know for future projects. Thanks

The source is a last minute mess but feel free ;)

!UPDATE: The web entry has been repacked and went from 24MB to ~1MB ;)
And the others is a zip file that contains a jar. Double click on it or in a terminal/console: java -jar LSM_Run.jar

entries.title: Nightmares of a Wizard
entries.description:
Nightmares of a wizard was produced by three people, two of which got about 14 hours of sleep, consumed apporximately three pounds of food, ingested a box of ice tea, attended the washroom approximately twice and spent about 58 hours spriting/coding/ROFLing... (not kidding about the acronym there) ...at their work.

NOTE: Make sure you walk up to the writing desks in each level to find out more about the story behind the game! The second desk in the dining room is bugged, however, will be fixed soon!


The uncompressed folder is exactly 200mb but it's worth it so be patient!

------------------------------------------------------------
README FILE-------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------
Nightmares of a Wizard
==---------------------------==
Hey there Ludum Dare Community member! On behalf of TeamEpsilon and company, I would like the thank you for 

downloading our game and would like to urge you to rate it! This game was created for the Ludum Jam and was 

produced, from scratch, within 72 hours (almost exactly, more like 71.5).
If you have any problems or questions, please post them in the comments.

Installation/Running the Game:
1. )Open the .zip file with WinRar/WinZip/7Zip
2.) right click on the folder NoaW and Extract all to a destination
3.) Go to the destination
4.) Double click the executable file to start the game, it may take a second or two to load so be patient.
5.) Play through entire game
 ---HINT:(There are hidden achievements so to get them all, you may need to go back to certain levels)
6.) Go Rate the game
7.) ???
8.) PROFIT
Do note that "Nightmares of a Wizard" requires some sound files that we have placed conveniently in the /zip... Please 

extract everything into the same folder. (or don't play the game)
WARNING: The game cannot run without these files so do not remove them from the filepath that you have placed the 

executable in.

Instructions: 
Q - Firball Spell select
E - Lightning Spell select
R - Acid Spell select
F - Ice Blast Spell select
Left Click - Cast selected Spell
Right Click - Teleports your player to the cursor.
WASD - Movement controls

PROTIPS:
1.) Some enemies have immunity to certain spells so try to use them all for maximum efficiency!
2.) Freezing enemies halts ALL movement, so proficient use of this spell will greatly help you.
3.) Your teleport spell is costly so make sure you know where you want to go before using it.

Thanks and have fun!
- TeamEpsilon
------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------

NOW OF TO CONSUME HIGH CHOLESTEROL FOODSTUFFS... AND AAAAWAAAAAAAAAY!

entries.title: One Final Trek
entries.description:
This lady has one great trek left in her!  the controls are hinted at in game, but space jumps, X attempts to light her lantern(may take a few tries!) and can extinguish it as well, and Z will blow flames out of a lit lantern, which also extinguishes it. 

I started really late on this one, since I disliked the theme and had abandoned it, but had an idea halfway through saturday.  I would have dearly loved to get sound into this but i simply didn't have time.  It really needs audio cues. And a bit of polish in a lot of places.


update: it seems game maker likes to blur the pixels on some machines so i found a short script by dear chevy ray that fixes that and reuploaded.  hopefully that's ok!

entries.title: Phil: A Search for a Friend
entries.description:
Phil is a zombie that wants to be alone, but Phil is surrounded by people. Zombie's eat people. Play as Phil with an assortment of cranium accessories at your disposal!

A.S.W.D = Move
Space = Feed
Hold S while moving = Sneak 

(Why sneak? Because Ninja Zombies are the next big thing!)

In all reality we, Doug (art) and Terri (code), have put a lot of work into the core mechanics of a much larger game. Sadly, time was our enemy and because of that we have only the mechanics prepared. We intend to finish the adventures of Phil, and we hope that you will enjoy them. :)

entries.title: Purple is the Best Colour
entries.description: A 2-player scrolling shooter. Kinda unfinished.

entries.title: Solitary Sand
entries.description:
Here's my first Ludum Dare entry and my first completed flash game.

I recommend a half decent set of stereo headphones or a surround sound setup.

It's a concept I'd always thought could be cool, and was my first thought when the theme was announced.

I learned a lot about flash and will take part for sure in the future.

Source is messy but still belongs to me. if you have any questions, hit me up on Twitter.

entries.title: Station 48G
entries.description:
Arrows to move, X to interact, try not to get lost!

you cant win yet and there's no collectables :(
hopefully you can have fun with the machines anyway

source uploaded!

I might get some postcompo thing with collectables going later.

entries.title: Terrified
entries.description:
Win32 game using SFML.

Content created with GIMP/Blender/and sfxr
Coded in VC++ 2010 Express

First LD challenge and first game code in some time. "Terrified" is an attempt to use Alone as a game play mechanic. Hope you enjoy!!

entries.title: The Necropolis
entries.description:
In this game you are a lone explorer trapped in an underground Necropolis filled with demons from beyond time and space. You don't want to believe it actually but they're there just beyond the lantern's light. Actually see them and you'll lose some of your sanity.

Thematically- the theme is Alone since the explorer is trapped alone in the Necropolis

Mechanic- The theme is "Alone" since the player should be almost Alone in the screen or he'll take sanity damage if there are any other creatures near him.

*The music is from http://www.playonloop.com/

entries.title: The Social Network
entries.description:
This is the Social Network. You've never felt more connected... but it's driving you crazy and you just want to be alone. Hurl insults at acquaintances, friends, and family until you are alone once and for all.

This is my first Ludum Dare. I made this using jQuery, Bootstrap and HTML. It's pretty corny, but it was fun to make. I'm hoping to do more OpenGL/WebGL-type stuff in the future.

entries.title: Whenfore art Thou
entries.description:
Note that this wasn't an attempt to follow theme.

This game is our attempt to make a competitive time travel game within 72 hours. We ended up with more of an toy than a game (though we'll hopefully get multiplayer working properly soon!

The game is the story of Romeo and Juliet with a twist. After the basic story, the 5 dead characters (Romeo, Juliet, Paris, Mercutio and Tybalt) are given the chance to use a time machine to change the past. Each player takes on the role of one of these characters, taking it in turns to change the past to try and fulfil their objectives.

Controls are as follows:
Press 'left' and 'right' arrow keys or use the scene navigation bar at the top to move between scenes. Text that can be changed is highlighted in green (for original) and red (for changes), with the one on top being currently used. Click on the lower option to swap it in.

You can also 'lock off' a decision by pressing the button on the top right corner. Locking off a decision or choosing a decision each take a turn.

The objectives for each character are laid out in a scene one to the right of the final scene (yeah, it needs a button). It also shows the current progress of each of the characters.

The game ends either when a player gets all 6 of their objectives, or when all the options have been locked out (note that we didn't get to implement this).

Hopefully we'll have the online multiplayer on this will be working soon. Till then, enjoy the single player browsing mode (you can use this to hotseat).

The team was:
Jonothan Usmar
Paul Sztajer
Louise Fisher
Saul Alexander
Xzander Whillier
Anurag Dey

entries.title: 10 Yards Alone
entries.description:
From the ReadMe
---------------------------


Ten Yards Alone


This game follows most rules of American Football, the target audience would likely know the basic rules already.  However here is my poor attempt at teaching the unprepared:


Fourth quarter and your entire team has been completely injured, physically and emotionally.  You dig deep and find the will to carry on.  With practice equipment.

Space to snap the ball into the throwing machine.
Space again when ready, for the machine to toss the ball.
Arrow keys for movement.  Sneak a run without snapping.

Avoid your opponents and try to score; (RUN UP)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An interception will take time off the game clock.
Failure to convert on 4th down will:
         - Lead to a punt return.
         - < 20 on far field; give the AWAY team 6 points
         - < 40 on far field; give the AWAY team 3 points
         - Make your life, as lonely as it is, more difficult.




EXTRA
-----

User/config.cfg allows you to change the window size, fullscreen etc- AS WELL as the starting points for the AWAY team and how long the game will last.  Hope you enjoy.

entries.title: A Lone Kitty
entries.description: A Lone Kitty, created using Ethanon Engine and Angelscript. Possibly some of the sloppy-est code I've ever written. The game quits automatically after entering the portal at the end game. This is not a crash or a bug, but a call to an Exit function. Source is included in the Dropbox download.

entries.title: Abandoned
entries.description:
This is my first time participating in Ludum Dare and this is my first complete game. The game is just a standard platformer, jump, collect checkpoints, and try to avoid the lasers. The story is that your a lone robot on an abandoned space station. I would of liked to put more into the game, like more levels, because its pretty short. Thanks for viewing my entry and I hope you enjoy!!

----------------------------------

Controls:

Arrow keys to Move
Z to Jump, Press Z again to Jump again
Hold X to Sprint

entries.title: Alone in His Mind
entries.description:
John travels through is mind drowned in insanity. An introspection about himself and about both his past and future.

The game is incomplete. There was a lot more that I wanted to make, but as first time with Unity and a to greedy game design the game ended up not being completed.

But there's still the soul in there and I hope that you can see what I intended to make.

---------------
Controls
---------------

WASD - Movement
Left Mouse Button - Touch
Right Mouse Button - Pick Up

Note, when you touch something the area around iluminates, you can use it to your advantage in dark situations.

---------------
Technical Stuff
---------------

I made a build for MacOS but since I don't have any Mac computer, I'll have to blindly trust in Unity. I made a Universal package, but if you need something specific, just leave a word in the coments.

Sorry for Linux-only users, Unity doesn't provide Linux binaries. I'll try to confirm on my PC if the game works in Wine.

entries.title: Alone In Space
entries.description:
Alone in Space is a suspenseful tile based adventure game, developed by two-man Bombsight Games for this competition. 

As the only surviving crewman of FFG-1 Montgomery, evade the hostile entity and get to the ship's last escape pod!

Enjoy! c:

entries.title: Are We Alone
entries.description:
This is my first ludum dare participation.

I decided to make a game about the discovery of another form of life and our reaction to it.

The game is made in flash with flixel.
Controlls are:
 - arrow keys to move
 - space to shoot.
 - x to advance in dialogues.

entries.title: Carrie
entries.description:
This isn't as intended, so I greatly condensed the story today to it's most base thought. That the things in your life are transient and you are ultimately alone, as you wander forward through life you lose the all things that you had around you.

It's called Carrie because that's her name!

It's my first ever entry, and was made in Processing and Photoshop, I made the music in Garage Band on my iPad :) The final game is an executable for pc.

entries.title: Centhra's Zombies
entries.description: This was Centhra's and my first LD and we had a blast, even though we only just made the deadline. The empty mission level is just a dev level we didn't get a chance to remove before submission time was up, so just ignore it, and have fun. We didn't quite finish it up as well as we wanted and there are sure to be bugs, but it is playable, and there is working multiplayer.

entries.title: Cosmic Whale
entries.description:
You are a cosmic whale. You are alone in this big universe so you eat because you feel alone. And the only thing you can eat are galaxies, but not all of them. The red galaxies are bad for you, they kill you. Click around the screen to move.

This game was made using the RedBox Engine (http://redboxengine.com/).

entries.title: Empty World
entries.description:
Works perfectly in Chrome, some issues in Firefox, untested in IE. Source is all visible and unminified.

It's completely unfinished, the idea was to allow you explore a large world, scavenging for food and supplies and trying to stay alive. I just about got all the systems in place (examining things, picking things up, using items, containers etc), but I ran out of time before I could generate any real content.

I'm pretty pleased with it however, hopefully I can add some more content to it later.

entries.title: Garbage Hero
entries.description:
Not too many years ago, our mother earth got destroyed by people throwing their junk into the nature.
When human kind realized this they started launching their garbage into space.
They soon realized this was a even worse misstake because when they had to leave earth, there were nowhere to go.

So they put up a reward for bringing back all their garbage to the planet.

That's where you come in, control the Garbage Drone(TM)* and collect as much junk as you can.
When the spaceday reaches it's end (even though there are none) you can sell the junk you've collected and purchase upgrades for your ship with the money.

Although be aware, people who are shooting at you are not friendly and should be eliminated ASAP.

Tools used:
Visual Studio C++ 2008
SFML 1.6
Photoshop
GameMaker's sprite editor

Controls:
WASD - Move your ship around
Space - Shoot, activate menu item
Arrow Keys / WASD - Select menu item

Other stuff:
This is my first C++ game and my fourth Ludum dare entry.
If you get stuck somewhere just drop a comment and I'll get back to you about it.
Also, I'm sorry about full CPU usage, I ran into a last minute problem with the accuracy of sf::Sleep() causing half FPS and had to uncap it.

I hope you enjoy the game!
Please leave me a comment with some feedback!
Thanks for an awesome LD,
/HighQuality

entries.title: Jump Alone
entries.description:
"When I think of term "alone," I think of the
blessing and curse of the human condition. As
subjective beings, we can never totally get 
outside of ourselves, and no one else can 
truly get in our heads.  We are, each of us, 
lone thinking things.  The blessing is the 
freedom we have in this space between our 
ears; the curse is the loneliness.  Our art 
and creations can be seen as expressions that 
can never be entirely comprehended, or as 
gifts to others to use their freedom and 
experiences to absorb that art and make it 
their own.

Anyway, what a load of shit."

-- Robert Ellis

entries.title: Leave Black Alone!
entries.description:
When I saw the theme, I spent quite a while thinking. In the end, I think I've created something very different from most entries. Instead of making a game where something IS alone, I decided to make one where something wants to be left alone. I also imagine that not too many people made puzzle games...

When playing this game, be sure to check all of the text at the bottom. It contains hints and instructions. There may be a few bugs that I missed, but I was able to play it through to the end without finding any. Unless told otherwise, you only need to use the left mouse button.

You'll need Game Maker to check out the source, and some stuff requires the registered version.

entries.title: Lonely Robot's Kitten Quest
entries.description:
Controls : WSAD or arrows to move, space to jump.
Find the lost kitten in the city of robots and lead him back to the gate to win.

*EDIT* A few people have commented that the intro text goes by too fast for them to read. If you look at the screenshots below you'll see I included all the intro panels, so if you can't read them in the game you can read them there.

entries.title: Lonely Trader
entries.description:
This game is unfinished and the only thing to do is fly around and trade resources between
planets.

How to play:
Use the arrow keys to fly the ship and use the mouse to trade on the planet UI.

You start off on planet Earth. Click the Take buttons to get some resources, then click Launch. Fly to another planet (use the minimap to see other planets) and land on it (your ship needs to be facing so that the thruster lands on the planet otherwise you will crash). The UI that shows up will show the type of resource that the planet produces click the Buy button to buy that resource (you can buy other types of resources, but there's probably no point) and trade one of your other resource types for it. Then fly to another planet that produces a different resource type and buy it. Repeat until bored. You will need to periodically return to Earth to unload your cargo and refuel.

entries.title: Loquere
entries.description: Loquere is a Java side-scroller.

entries.title: No Mother Alone
entries.description:
I was learning Javascript and Canvas as I was making this, my first game ever. Uh. So the code is terrible, and I've only tested it with chrome. And it works OK with chrome. Not great, but OK. I don't know if Firefox will work. Sorry.

So yeah, thanks. This was fun. Oh I never had a github account either, so if something is wrong with that, I'm sorry again.

[EDIT3]
Oops. I misunderstood the rules. I thought public domain/creative commons sound effects/music were usable. I withdraw my entry. I'll be sure to follow the rules next go around :P

[EDIT2]

Figured out how to host via github. Neat! 

http://brodavi.github.com/No-Mother-Alone/

[EDIT]

Instructions and more about the game:

"Your Mother was shopping. She said wait here, she had to go get some crackers. That was a long time ago. Go look for her."

You are a small child. You feel as though you are lost and alone, and must go look for your mother.

Hit SPACE to look up.
Hit X to call to mommy.
Use LEFT and RIGHT to walk down aisle.
When you find an intersection, use UP or DOWN to switch aisles.

Hitting SPACE to look up doesn't really do anything gameplay-wise. I originally wanted there to be many adults and you had to find your mother among them.

Hitting X will cry for your mother. If she is on that isle, she will respond. If not, you will get a message telling you as much.

At an intersection between aisles, hitting UP or DOWN will traverse aisles.

You only have 60 seconds (or else the world ends), and you can only cry once every 10 seconds or so.

I'll admit it's not much of a game. I've never made a game before. I also never wrote to Canvas before, and only barely played with Javascript before. I'll do better next time :) Sorry I don't have hosting. But it's just an unzip and pointing your browser at index.html.

entries.title: Splaser Strife
entries.description:
-- Story --

Humans have discovered one other intelligent race in the universe, but a new recently elected (psycho) President (might change the title to something like dictator) doesn't think very fondly of the aliens and wants to completely eradicate them, so humans can be alone in the universe again. This stems from the question, "Are we alone?". The answer has become yes, but the President prefers it the other way (because he's stark raving mad).

-- Instructions --

Press/alternate Z and X to fire, arrow keys to move your ship. If you have the kamikaze weapon, press space to fire it.

Open Source with Stencylworks. (www.stencyl.com)

Splaser Strife

- UPDATE 19/12/11 -
Minor bug fix: some stuff broke

Compatability: Old computers buckled under an unusual bug with the platform I used, now fixed!

entries.title: Starlighter
entries.description:
Rjynwor is the "Runner", the last Starlighter. He must travel alone into the void, sacrificing his own life to relight the stars.

My first Ludum Dare attempt!

The kitty is there... Somewhere fiendishly hidden!

Sorry the source code is a mess, must take more care to code more neatly under pressure next time!

************************************************************

UPDATE:

I have created a version with audio which can be found at:

http://www.mediafire.com/?y5m3cd00yd4zuka

This version is NOT to be judged for the competition as it was built after the competition ended. I have added a note to the start of the game reminding users of this. This version is solely for demonstration of how the game would have been had I added audio during the competition and is NOT a new submission or entry.

This build also fixes a bug in the entry version where some users encountered instant game overs. Users with this issue can play this build if they wish to see the game, but please rate only the competition build, even if the game didn't work for you.

Please only judge the build which was entered for the contest as it represents the work done during the contest.

************************************************************

Update 2:

************************************************************

I have tried the game on every computer I can get my hands on from a netbook to a full on gaming rig built for Crysis type games and none have presented the instant game over bug :S Can anyone experiencing the bug comment with what rig they are using because I simply can't replicate the error, even when running the game on the checkout computers at work! Since a number of people stated that they saw a "run..." button (which is actually just a text box that displays for a few seconds, not a button) I even tried mashing the mouse all over the text box in case clicking was the problem and still no error on any of the machines! Please, if you experience this problem post up what rig you are using so I can investigate further!

************************************************************

Update 3

************************************************************

As stated in the readme file, if you get an "MSVCR100.dll missing" error when you try to run the program, please install the redist package included in the game folder.

************************************************************

entries.title: The Break
entries.description:
The Break is a game abut...well..you'll see... :)

entries.title: The Deep
entries.description:
You've just woken up, alone, in a dark cavern deep underground. You must attempt to navigate your way out of the caves whilst disarming traps and avoiding the creatures that live within.

Controls:
Press Z whilst standing near traps and switches to interact with them.

Use the arrow keys to move.

Press Esc to quit.

If the music starts to get on your nerves, press M to mute it.

Switch to full screen with F4.

When lockpicking, use the 1-3 buttons to select a pin and then press the space bar to nudge the pins up, you can also click on the pins to nudge them.

Also, read my postmortem: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/19/the-deep-postmortem/

entries.title: The Misadventures Of Homeless Dave
entries.description:
Click/Tap briefly to move arms, hold down to kick legs
'C' - same action key as mouse
'G' , 'H'- changes zoom level
'Y' - back one level 
'R' - resets level 
'T' - skips level

Homeless Dave says "Thank'ee Sai!"

entries.title: This Charming Man
entries.description:
Make everyone friends

Friends stick together, while nasty people drive them apart

A bit of charm or even hostility in the right place can bring people together

Charming and repulsing people can be hard work though

Replenish your energy by hanging around your friends, but be careful, taking too much can turn people against you

WSAD + mouse to move
Mouse buttons or Q/E to attract/repel

by Eddie Cameron | @eddiecameron | grapefruitgames.com

entries.title: ToastCat
entries.description:
First time entry, Yeah!
Warning: Game contains bugs. Many. I blame the radiation from the Catnobyl disaster, but I may be wrong.
.ZIP contains Windows and Linux versions.
Made using ENIGMA. Should work in GM, too.

For those of you on Linux, you can get a version I made AFTER the deadline, with some bugfixes (Window Resizing (For you Gaeel :D), Bouncing-Off-Mirror-Corners-And-Getting-Stuck and walking on lasers (However, that issue wasn't on Linux in the first place, so it's kinda a useless bugfix XD):
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9078394/ToastCatExt
That was done AFTER the deadline though, so rate me on the version in the links up the top.

entries.title: AB-ALONE
entries.description:
AB-ALONE: A survival/adventure/puzzle game with a unique twist.

An alien creature crash lands on an unknown planet and ends up on a remote island. With no way to repair the spacecraft and no way to call for help, the stranded alien is forced to survive while attempting to find a way home. The small island is covered with sand, grass, rocks, and trees... but no other life forms can be found. A startling discovery reveals that there may be more to this world than originally thought...

CONTROLS
-----------
The controls are listed in a text file as well as on my game page at: http://www.phantomgreen.com/games/abalone

wasd - movement
mouse - cursor
left click - select/use
scroll wheel - zoom
f4 - toggle full screen
esc - exit

GUIDE
-----------
This game is meant to be a puzzle. There is no tutorial. You have to learn how to survive just like an alien on an unknown planet. I will write a guide that will spoil the experience, and I will include it on my game page at: http://www.phantomgreen.com/games/abalone

entries.title: Alone Together

There are three kittens hidden around the level.
If you're having trouble, pay attention to the movement of the crowd around the house. Or just go for it and get lucky. Both work!

entries.title: Cardiac and fireproof Kitten alone in Alps after a plane crash

After a plane crash you're alone in Alps . It's cold, It's Night and you are a Cardiac (but fireproof kitten)...
You need to find your phone to call Help !
Find how to not die by Hypothermia, don't forget kitty is Cardiac , to much effort will cause a Heart attack.

The game need some polishing :

-I used Flixel for fun , and trying to use this framework for the "Game aspect" and Flare3D for the rendenring aspect.
-I need to clean the code before open source it (use the link source code to twitt me if you interested)

Hope you like it !

Sorry for my bad english i'm French.

entries.title: Dark Forest
entries.description:
a nightmare platformer

* Theme

  You are alone in a forest. You cannot see the way home. You have a torch. When you use it, you might not be alone any more.

  The central game mechanic is based on cartoon logic. The Monsters never move the darkness. A pair of eyes only becomes active when you see who is behind it.

  Try not to get eaten and do not jump into bottomless pits! The fingerposts point to the next level.


* Requirements

  Programmed with python 2.7.2 and pygame 1.9.1 on Ubuntu 11.10. Tested with 32-Bit Python  2.7 and pygame 1.9.2 on Windows.

run with =python main.py=

* Controls: 
  A,D: left,right
  W: jump

  Mouse: point torch
  click to turn on the Light

entries.title: Desert Adventure (with Kittens)

This game is a text aventure in which you guide the character in a hostile environment. There are 8 different ways to die, try to find them all!

Warning: Contains Kittens!

Well it turned out that i hate my own game :D
