Have fun playing :)

entries.title: Isolated Assault
entries.description:
ISOLATED ASSAULT V1.4

In a world, where the sun burns so furiously you must constantly seek shade...
Where endless cubes fight to get a shot at you...
Where your only weapons are a sword, and a pair of glasses...

Isolated Assault

This 48 hour game was meant to implement the theme, alone, in a new way--you're alone in a cube wasteland until you put on the sunglasses. 

The sunglasses make you see things. Enemies. That must be destroyed. 

If you can find a shaded zone, (a small building or overhang) you can take off your glasses, making the enemies disappear, and regenerate your health. But, you can't stay there forever. You have a chopper to catch! 

The longer you take to find the chopper, the more enemies appear, and the harder it will be to find. It's easy to get lost, so just try to find the shaded zones. 

READ THE README.RTF FOR MORE (Controls, hints, humor, etc.)

This is my first Ludum Dare Entry, and I'm exciting to finally be doing this! Good luck to all, and thanks for playing!

Timelapse here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/53757030/TimelapseCompressed.mov

(Right click and "Save Link as" if you want a download)

I get distracted a lot... Oh and you may want to go full-screen to see what applications I'm using. 

There's web version... if you really want it. There are several bugs, it's quite laggy, and the opening menu text is completely ruined. 

If you really want to play without a download, let me know in the comments, and I'll post a link, just be prepared for a confusing menu. (The upper left corner blocks is the "Play" button, the lower right is "Quit", and the lower left is instructions.)

Post-Mortem here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/21/isolated-assault-post-mortem/

Gameplay video: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gVjZnsU1BLA

entries.title: Leave me Alone!!!
entries.description:
The idea of the game is to isolate (maintain alone) the main particle from the other particles keep the world alive from a great hyper mega explosion!!!

The game was made using Artemis, Box2D, LibGDX and LWJGL.

Instructions:

Move the main particle with the mouse, dodge green and blue particles. The longer you survive, the best score you get.

Note: the game wasn't designed for touch devices, so the Android version is not so playable but you can try it anyway if you want.

Hope you like it.

entries.title: Mine Shaft of Doom
entries.description:
Use WASD to move, mouse to aim and click to shoot.

Press space to open doors and use the crafting bench, and press escape to exit the bench.

entries.title: Minicraft
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move, C to attack and X to open the inventory and interact with objects in the world.

The goal of the game is to kill the only other sentient being in the world, making sure you'll be alone forever.

entries.title: OMFG FFS will you LEAVE me ALONE
entries.description:
First Ludum Dare for the Team Magnificent 4

Enjoy this game made with a lot of passion and very small deadlines
(we actually skiped Sunday)

Game made in Flixel, Flash

BIO: You are the GIRL Running away from the STALKERS who try to get to touch your private parts. With a huge fire power you have to get rid of these buggers. Good luck young lady!

entries.title: Run Justin, Run
entries.description:
Run Justin, Run was one of two ideas I had for LD22, but the most fun, and I like my humorous games, so here goes.

As a very famous popstar; we'll call him Justin you've just come back from a very successful gig, however he's got a bit of the lergy, and he's feeling particularly disgusting. 

He knows that if a fan gets too close then they won't be able to make it to his concert tonight, so he's only one option; get to the public toilets at the end of town so he can be alone and away from his adoring fans.

It's basically track and field with screaming girls, so press the left and right arrow keys like a nut to run away from the crowds.

Occasionally crazed fans will launch themselves at you, you'll need to kick or punch them away unless you want to lose a particularly die hard fan!

It's missing a lot of animations that I wanted to do, as well as a few sounds that wouldn't loop.

Hope you enjoy it!

I've included a link to both the executable, and the web link; however there is issues with images taking a while to load via the web; you have been warned!

entries.title: Soloing
entries.description:
Once upon a time there was a small town in which a hero lived. His town was destroyed and he was late to wake up. Sound cliched?

Well, what if the villain set out to destroy the world is nowhere to be found? In fact, there doesn't seem to be anyone other than the hero.

A humorous yet eerie visual novel remnant of a high fantasy world.

Made using Ren'Py. All sounds by my voice, some creaky-ish floorboards and a bag of dice, edited with Audacity.

entries.title: The Lonely Knight - Dark Adventure
entries.description:
Team "Underpriced Donuts" proudly presents "The Lonely Knight - The Dark adventure".
      
Prologue 

Once upon a time, in a land far far away, there lived a knight who was very lonely. He did not have a real horse - so lonely he was.

He was spending his days over a pint of ale since he did not see a purpose in his life. One dark and rainy day he was sitting in the tavern "Mug of hero", sinking his miserable life in alcohol as usual.

When he finally lost count of how much ale he has drank his blurry attention was captured by a  strange conversation.  He heard that a daughter of a King was recently captured by a band of necromancers from the Spookywood forest, lead by the Evil Wizard Magazu al'Thaal.   

Only a true hero would have the courage and the SKILL to take the epic quest and save her people whispered. And, as a nice side bonus, the King promised her hand and a little bit more than a half of the kingdom to the savior.

All in sudden the knight realised that the princess would fill the gap in his miserable life or at least cook and more. Thus, after a few days of hangover, he took his licheny wooden sword and faithful wooden horse and marched to meet his destiny. 



Game is made on HtmL5 + javascript.
Best to play on google Chrome or Mozzila Firefox.

We made the entire game from scratch in 72 hours. 
Including all the coding, scripting, login and account system, images, models and storyline.


Hope you like it ! 

Made by Paulius Rumsa, 
Maxim Solovjov 
and Justinas Sneideris.

entries.title: Unknown Receiver
entries.description:
A message have been transmitted on Earth, two young men must decrypt the message through a program they designed.
Help them on six levels and you shall get your answer.

I made it with C++ Builder

entries.title: Zombie Street
entries.description: Top-Down-Shooter, without guns. You are one of the last survivors of the apocalypse and you just came out of the Thrift store and in to your car. Kill as many zombies as possible while stopping to save the survivors.

entries.title: A.I.one
entries.description:
Artificial Intelligence One.

There are no in game instructions or hints, so to the controls work by selecting things, then clicking either the "move" or "destroy" buttons (shown in the screenshot). You can deselect with the cross. There are 2 types of things to select - stars cant be shot, or enemies that shrink to little icons of explosions at long distance as I didn't really make a proper icon.

You are the only known sentient artificial intelligence in existence, and you're looking for someone to talk to. So you have to find them with advanced technology, or build them. With genetic engineering based on experiments with kittens.

There were a few too many features in this game for me to polish all of them, but in general you control everything with the mouse. Space flight is simple, click something and an "approach" and a "destroy" button pop up. 

As for the research, you need to grab some resources (top left) and some data (from the stack thingo) then click a red button to go! Different resources/data tend towards different research outcomes which are either Physics, AI, Genetics or Cybernetics.

Believe it or not, I thought of the name at the very end.

Anyway, I like this game unfinished as it may be so comments are very welcome :)

--source will be up soon.

entries.title: Alone on Ganymede
entries.description:
This is our team's first time participating in the LD, and we present to you our (almost complete) game, "Alone on Ganymede."

You start in orbit around Jupiter's moon, Ganymede, after a debilitating asteroid collision. Reassemble your damaged spacecraft to make it safely back to earth or risk a lonely death in the blackness of space, but be careful, you only have so much fuel!

Only the Linux source is available at the moment, but we'll have binaries for everyone in the near future. We'll also post an update containing the things that never got integrated into the game, including better art and music.

entries.title: Aloneman
entries.description:
Ok, my first L.D. submission. An homage to crusty old Commodore 64 platformers. If you can't stand the controls,

(Arrows to move, 
 Z to jump, 
 X to place skulls if you're on a level that gives you them, they can be used as platforms but realize that human skulls are a limited resource..!!) 

..then you mostly have them to thank. 

IF YOU FALL TOO FAR YOU WILL DIE. 
COLLECT ALL THE CROWNS TO ADVANCE. BUT IT MATTERS NOT. YOU ARE ALONE.

Would have liked to add more.

Tools:
GraphicsGale
GameMaker8.1
FLStudio
sfxr

entries.title: Apoc: Apocalypse Shooter
entries.description:
Apoc is a third person zombie shooter, enough said.
The game was made in Unity through  22 hours.
The team consisted of a single programmer.

Controls:
Movement - WASD
Shoot - Spacebar/Right Mouse button



Weapons
1 - Pistol
2 - SMG
3 - Shotgun
4 - Assault Rifle
5 - Machine Gun

Utility 
Q - Build Wall (costs 2 tokens)
E - Builds Turret (costs 10 tokens)

Windows Build Link:
www.skyparlorstudios.com/games/jam/Apoc/Apoc_Game.zip

Web Build Link: 
www.skyparlorstudios.com/games/jam/Apoc/Apoc_Game_Web.html

entries.title: Coracao Branco
entries.description:
My name is Coracao Branco. I'm all alone, come and comfort me, for my heart is lonely.

***

Instructions: Click on the heart to start. Each room gives you a puzzle where you must guess the proper word (for the first room its any word except for mitso), including  spelling, capitalization and such. To guess the word enter it into the purple text, then click the heart to guess. If you guessed correctly the heart will disappear, and you can continue. To do this walk out the right side of the screen, use the arrow keys to move. After a certain point there will be a drastic change in gameplay, and then you need to figure out what to do from there.   

***

I actually had to make this in under 6 hours as I had no internet connection over the weekend and I just got it up 6 hours ago and it was a real pain. I also couldn't work out the music correctly AS THE AUDIO ON MY COMPUTER BROKE WHILE I WAS WORKING ON THE GAME ARGG!!

***

One last thing, please do not look at the source unless you must, it really ruins the experience of this game.

***

For a puzzle that involves the word same, add "different book" to the description, it will make it easier. The answer for the puzzle is "gronk", but I meant to put something else, see if you can guess what it is.

entries.title: Downtown Nazi Mission
entries.description:
So I got the game name from http://videogamena.me/

There's no sound and most of the artwork are just placeholders. But I found this to be an enjoyable game. There are highscores on the main menu aswell :)
The source code is bundled with the game download, the game will run on practically any system with a JVM (Java basically).

Just to clarify, it says highscores, it should say scores. It keeps track of your last 6 games' score, and remembers the highest one that you've gotten so far!
I did intend on there being multiple weapons and enemies, but time got away from me :(

If the game doesn't open, and it says "Java is unrecognised", try this download.
http://bit.ly/ubr5DI
Make sure you open it with Java, which should be located roughly here "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\".

entries.title: Enneige
entries.description:
Out of supplies, you must survive 3 days in the brutal Canadian wilderness in the dead of winter. Find firewood and get back to your cabin as quickly as you can! Be on the lookout for food and unknown dangers while exploring!

Movement: W A S D
Interact: E

XNA Required

entries.title: Eyes of the Exorcist

Pick ups replenish health.

jump: time the jump to hit the ball.

entries.title: Mountain
entries.description:
Had to cut this a little short, have a job interview in the morning. 

Game is supposed to be a little more difficult than it is, so don't cry if you die, wuss. You're supposed to die. It makes it easier for the next person that plays, even if that person is you.

This game contains some 'player generated content' which is likely to be crude, abusive and poorly spelt. It'll probably be aimed at me and the game, but it might potentially offend you too.

entries.title: Super Bad Dream

entries.title: Super Smash Lander Suicide Party, Bro?
entries.description:
Controls: Press Space Bar.

Story(?): It's a game about hurtling from the sky towards earth, while partying, jettisoning crewmembers and blowing up.

It's also about the sudden death of seagulls, and blunt trauma inducing high-fives.

P.S. Only found out the theme on the second day (I live in Cape Town so I'm 8 hours ahead). And then, after learning the theme, to my great dishonor, I still didn't follow the theme and instead included even more high-fiving... But apart from that I had an awesome Ludum Dare!

entries.title: Teddies

entries.title: 10,000 Space Leagues from Delta Station
entries.description:
Something bad has happened and now you are alone in your escape pod drifting through space.

Make your way to Delta Station to seek rescue.

By Dan Cassidy and Nick Griffiths.

entries.title: A Visitor
entries.description:
Hi,
I may add more comments later, but here are the basics:

Windows:
  Click on "main.exe" to play.  Use keys to move

Android:
  Use tilt to move.
  Note: Too Slow on older phones like my myTouch3G and G2 (sorry!)
  Tilt is calibrated when the level is started.  I'll add more options for configuring this in (non-compo/jam) updated versions.

Feedback appreciated -- thanks!
Feedback responses:
RHY3756547: Yes, it is a little short.  I'll add a post compo version soon with more levels.
Frenchies222: The very first character you see on the first screen is alone.  Hopefully updating my awesome graphics will make that more clear post-compo.  Sorry, no sound :(  But that means your computer is good :)
ladron: Very helpful.  I'll work on making it a little less random and more challenging in the new levels.
J: No source yet, so I entered it in the jam.  I'm still trying to decide if/how to release my framework.
Thanks for all the feedback everyone!

entries.title: Alone in the Dungeon
entries.description:
It's almost done (I'm joking it isn't finished at all)
Go into the dungeon and sweep it all until you're alone.
The left mouse button moves around and the right one shoots fireball

The engine it's working, enemy AI... almost
every other thing is junk

entries.title: Alone in the Mansion
entries.description:
A little survival horror game. You wake up alone in a strange house, and you have to go through eight floors avoiding zombies.
Some doors are locked, so you will need to find a key.


P.S.: if you rate the game please post a comment: I would like to play and rate your game too.

entries.title: Alone in your mind
entries.description:
Game created in a few hours, go to http://ldgame.comli.com/index.htm for web version.
I didn't have much time to work on it this weekend, but I wanted to make something, so I went with a retro-ish game. It uses the HTML5 Canvas and JavaScript.
NOTE:
Source is in gameCode.js in the archive.

entries.title: BraveWorker
entries.description:
EDIT: For you who can't download the game. Right click on one of the links above and save it to your harddrive. Unpack the files somewhere - they are in a seperate directory for your ease. Run the only runnable file you have there.

In the game you are a game tester who racing with the others 'how many mazes sold / minute'.
Use WASD to get to the exit of the maze in the bottom-right corner.
Watch out for your stats! If you get stress to much, then you going mad and the game ends. Try drinking water to calm down. It's good to solve hydratation problem too, but it will raise bladder bar. Similarly if you getting tired you fall asleep. This is why you have coffee in the desk. Click it. If it's empty, then you can make another dose by clicking it once more. The game ends when hydratation goes too low or bladder goes too high so maintain them as well. You can go to toilet by clicking in the bladder stat area.

(The following isn't implemented yet... :( )
When going to toilet or making coffee, you can encounter ghosts and hallucinations that raises stress. You need to avoid collision with objects in running mode and click them to conclude they are not real in coffee making mode.
(...to this point.)

Some of the parts are not playable and there is no sound, but It more or less finished in about 12 hours. It contains 2 minigame - the 3rd isn't included sadly and the 2nd isn't playable - and a monitoring system that you need to keep an eye on while you play.

Written entirely in Processing with graphics made with Gimp. Source code is included and well noted - in hungarian - except for the not finished and temporary parts.

entries.title: Comfort Zone
entries.description:
Navigate with the arrow keys, reach the end. You need to find your way through some puzzles and navigational challenges, but there's no pressure... as long as nobody's watching you.

There are two endings.  Neither of them require a perfect run through.

entries.title: Four Friends
entries.description:
CONTROLS: ARROW KEYS for control, "SPACE" for overview map!

This entry was made by Team Flare:
Guybrush - Game Design
JoeCool - Programming
Monica, Ralf - Graphics
Miriam and Hanne - Sound and Music


Four Friends is a game about four kids who woke up in a labyrnith of rooms. They do not know who they are, where they are from or why they are here. The labyrinth seems like is made form them. With their unique skills, they try to find each other, Alone no one can survive this madness. They feel lonley and afraid. Can you help them to find each other?

entries.title: I'm Where?
entries.description:
The game is set in the World of Mysria, where you will explore and solve puzzles to find out why you are there. 

And more importantly, why no-one else is.

It's my first ever game, and also the first time using Lua. I made it with the LOVE engine, which is quite nice.

CONTROLS
- WASD to move
- Space to pick up keys and to read bookcases and signs. 



Oh and because of a comment, I've decided to tell people this before they rate. The graphics we're not created by Oryx, I do admit they are they same style. But they we're created by me during the weekend.

entries.title: Just Like The Others
entries.description:
48 awesome hours later, here is my game. "Just like the others" is a twitch platformer in a dark theme. The gameplay is similar to Super Meat Boy. It is somewhat difficult, but everything is possible. You wouldn't want to be alone forever right?

If you are on Linux, you can run the game in WINE.


I want to thank everybody who joined Ludum Dare and especially everybody who organised Ludum Dare. It was one of the most awesome weekends I had since last Ludum Dare.

entries.title: Kitten's Missions
entries.description:
A side-scroller written in Python using PyGame.

You play the role of a kitten. This kitten completes solo missions in dangerous environments collecting beer, kebabs and cups of water.

At the end of each level, the kitten is reunited with its friends.

If the kitten comes into contact with a cactus or satellite, it will blow up.

entries.title: Leave Me Alone!
entries.description:
Notch is tired of fanboys chasing him around. He just wants to be alone. :*(

Controls are arrow keys / WASD to move, click / spacebar to shoot, and p to pause.

Please excuse my horrific code.

entries.title: LonelyRouge
entries.description:
After about 30 hours of Compo I realized the NLP algorithim I was using for my original game just was not going to do the job I wanted it to do. So here Is plan B, a Hack-N-Slash rouge-like. 

You will need python 2.7 to play this game!

Advice:
* Save the Green Things for after you are hurt!
* You turn darker red as you die
* You can take on 1 Grue at a time, but 2 can kill you easily!
* Never engage a Grue in the water, you move slower there! Grues do not!
* There is no winning, only seeing how long you can avoid death

entries.title: NightEscape
entries.description:
You're alone, intrapped into this hell, make your path through the exit with your keyboard!

The game is avaible for web and windows

entries.title: Not Alone
entries.description:
In this space shooter, you're teamed with an AI. But no luck for you, she is a psychopath. Her programmer haven't yet cured her, and he have no time for that.

Just sit in your shooter, and defend your planet against endless wave of foes.

Remember, your are alone at this task.
No one gonna help you.
The fate of the worlds is in your hand.

entries.title: One Man Alone in the Darkness
entries.description:
One Man Alone in the Darkness (OMAD) is an action / survival / arcade / Slash 'em Up game where you play as a man trapped underground.

The aim of the game is to survive against the monsters and level up to unlock all 5 swords.

The game uses Adobe Flash as a platform.

Timelapse video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWThOd09lDI

Software Used:
Flash CS4 Professional (with ActionScript 2.0) - general development and animation;
Wally - floor texture;
ASEprite - sprites;
Paint.NET - general image manipulation.

One or two code snippets (such as those used to make objects rotate) were taken from some of my older projects.

The .swf can be used to upload to websites - feel free to upload to your website - just please give credit to me.

I would recommend using the Web version, as it is the most likely to work, and you should be playing the game in quite a small amount of time.
Platform specific versions should work, but they are quite large.
Use the .swf version if neither of the above work. Most web browsers with Flash Player installed are likely to run it.

The source is going to be quite hard to understand as it is very unorganised. As far as I am aware, Flash CS4 Professional or higher is required to open it - but you may be able to open it with other software.

entries.title: Paper Dream
entries.description:
From the same source I have not taken
My sorrow; I could not awaken
My heart to joy at the same tone;
And all I loved, I loved alone.


Click objects to 'pick them up'.

To move the Earth you must first move the Heavens.

entries.title: Party Quest: Never Go It Alone
entries.description: "Party Quest: Never Go It Alone" is in the style of a classic  top-down RPG. You play as one of three different classes and embark on a great journey to save the Kingdom of Ludum from the domesticated pest that has plagued the land. But wait, you are alone! You must find a suitable party of warriors before you can save the land! Good luck!

entries.title: Shadow
entries.description:
Didn't get to the story so the general idea behind this was: You're having an out-of-body sort of experience (maybe a dream) where you're playing as your Shadow (on the left side of the screen) and you're trying to protect your Body (right side). Your Body has no control over his actions so you must follow him through the level and turn off traps that would kill your Body without your help.
There's also enemies/traps that you have to avoid at the same time while making sure you keep your Body alive so you can be together once again!

Created with XNA 4.0 so you'll need the Microsoft XNA Framework Redistributable 4.0 to run it: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
Artwork: Paint.net
Sounds: SFXR/BFXR

You can watch a playthrough here but it'll give away how to beat the game if you watch it! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7s84pb5aWg4

entries.title: Stray Whisker
entries.description:
Controls:
* Left/Right to move
* Space/Up to jump

Design, Art, Programming, Sound And Music by Andrew Sum (AKA JigxorAndy/Assault Andy).

Created using Multimedia Fusion 2 and BFXR.

Please check out www.AndrewSum.com and follow me on Twitter @JigxorAndy.

Game and source are Released under Creative Commons
Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike
3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0)


There is one ending and one SECRET. (I had intended two endings, but a secret fitted better instead).


Please let me know what you think, I'd love to hear all your feedback.

Thank you!

http://AndrewSum.com
http://Jigxor.com
Twitter: @JigxorAndy

entries.title: The Lonely Alien
entries.description:
The Lonely Alien.

It is a Psychedelic Text Adventure with Art and Music.
 
 - 3 Sound Tracks .OGG Audio File Format (8m 47s total)
 - Over 29 Locations each with there own Hand Drawn Art.
 - 26 Items to Use and Solve Puzzles with.
 - 11.7mb Download with Source Code.
 - The rest you can figure out.
 
Run's on Pure Java no other downloads required.

Choosing the softer 72h option made completing my 2nd Ludum Dare (#22) significantly more comfortable. 

The resulting Game had / was
 - Smaller in File Size
 - Free Roaming Map
 - More Locations / Items / Situations
 - Greater Depth than my First Entry.

Linux: Known Issues (do not download till I fix it).
 - Gray Screen 
 - Cannot Click on Gui

Working on them, actually rebuilt the Unbuntu Box couple of hours prior to the Competition Starting so now I can get back to Debugging Post Comp.

Thanks for your Patience and will Post an Update in a bit.

Shout out too Jorbis & Jogg for .OGG playback.

:-)

entries.title: The Word Alone
entries.description:
So it's my first Ludum Dare, and I decided to make a word game for some reason.

Art made with Blender.
Music+sounds made with Ableton Live.
Coding is AS3 in FDT. 

If you want to see the community posts I made during the jam, look here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/mattrix/

Note: Once you get the hang of the game, try getting a move count of 8. It's possible to do it every single game if you plan it out.

entries.title: TransDimensional Moon Rift
entries.description:
Transdimensional Moon Rift

UPDATE
I've added postcompo extended version (web and Windows) - it has quicksave/quickload and a bunch of small bugfixes. You probably know that, but for rating you should try original web version.

UPDATE 2
Although it's not requirement for jam entry, I've put sources on my overfilled dropbox - feel free to do whatever you want with it, but be warned, I guess at least 50% of code is hardcoded ugly looking and barely working mess.


Old Dungeon Master style RPG with pirates, ninjas, undeads, kittens and some insanity thrown in the pot.

You wanted to be alone with your zombie kittens, but oh no, not even on the moon you can find solitude. Some rotten (meaning literally) pirates ninja looted your bag of adorable zombie kittens! Can you beat them with their own weapons and ninja loot your kittens back? 

Menu button opens menu with some help (and possibility to set fullscreen on). Otherwise use WASD (and Q and E to turn) and mouse and your brains. (Right mouse + dragging turns the  view).


Made in Unity (sorry, HC linux guys) in about 40 hours all from scratch by me (didn't make it in time for compo, but it's much better game thanks to one day delay). Just about one meg file with all the "art" and "sounds". 

Based on playtesting on my witch it takes about 30 minutes to finish the game. (It's a bit unbalanced, but I just ran out of time)

entries.title: Zolcan
entries.description:
Enjoy!

Edit: Some of you who can't play the game, try this link instead, It's a direct link to the swf. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/848324/ld22/release/Zolcan.swf

entries.title: [Greeble]
entries.description:
[Greeble] is an HTML5 game where you are the captain of a crashed spaceship. You are ALONE but need some help to survive. Collect the cryo-keys to activate the stasis pods in order to free your friends. 

Features pixel-perfect, non-grid platforming, bounce-pads, transparent glass tubes, a fun retro "scan line" effect, silly AI followers and A KITTEN, your objective is to use the arrow keys to navigate to the exit, where you will be rewarded with a trampoline party! 

I had so much fun making this game. I even had time to hang out with friends, go for a hike, and decorate my house for the holidays! There is a lot of room for improvement but overall I'm really happy with the final product. 

Created using ippa lix's wonderful jawsjs game engine. 

The word "greeble" comes from the original Star Wars ILM special effects artists who used the term to describe generic "tech" bits and pieces that adorn sci-fi hulls. There are thousands of greebles in this game's level art.

Ludum Dare is so much FUN.

entries.title: A Lonely Moon
entries.description:
A lonely, simple platformer that I hope folks find visually appealing.  It's pretty short, but I like to think it highlights both the lonely and exciting parts of being alone.  I also hope other people find the player death as amusing as I do :P.

Made in Unity Free and Blender by me.  Sounds done in cfxr.  Music created with atrk-bu.py :D.

entries.title: Alone at Ludum Dare
entries.description: Not the game I intended to make; that one didn't work out. But I got this tossed together under the deadline anyhow so I wouldn't leave empty-handed. Enjoy! :-)

entries.title: Alone with the Shifters
entries.description:
The game by default starts in windowed mode. To use full screen, add a -full argument when running the game.

Linux executables: 32 an 64 bit
Windows: 32 bit only

The aim is to get to the exit (some ladder), before your light runs out and you get killed by a shifter.

Shifters are the mennacing creatures that turn into statues when you can see them, but move around, picking things up when you can't.

You must collect oil lamps to stay alive.

You may need to find buttons to lower some coloured walls.

Controls:
	UP	move up-right
	LEFT	move up-left
	RIGHT	move down-right
	DOWN	move down-left
	ESCAPE	quit
	
Make sure to try the executables with "o3" in the name, as they are optimised and will run MUCH faster!

I've removed the unoptimised executables, as these seem to be causing confusion.

entries.title: ASSAULT THE DARK FORTRESS
entries.description:
My Ludum Dare 22 entry!
Join up a small team of intrepid adventurers as they explore an old, scary fortress.
Arrow keys move
X C S and D uses items when you found them (like the Sword)
press ESCAPE at any time to quit the game (sorry! no pausing. Didnt have time!!)

So! Was it a good idea to make a Zelda-like game for the Ludum Dare? You tell me!
The game is way too big. I didn't have time to place tiles in the rooms of the right side of the game, so half of the game is simple, ugly blocks over a pink background... whoops! Well, use your imagination! The rest looks decent enough though.
The game isn't finished at all, but its quite playable and actually takes a long while to explore. Which makes it likely there are some bugs. I couldn't even test the entire game yet as Im writing this! Ill get to it now, actually. Crossing my fingers...

I will probably properly finish up the game in the coming weeks. Finish up the tiles, add some new enemies, give it a proper ending... But its good enough for now. Enjoy!

entries.title: Bomb Defuse
entries.description:
My second Ludum Dare entry.

The idea here is that you're a Bomb Defuser, guided by your trusty radio buddy, Microsoft Sam. You use some tools to disarm Bombs. I made the delay between each bomb slightly long, so you can screenshot the transition to show your friends how little of a life you have, by disarming, like, over 100 bombs.

Also, the games files contain references to an old Intellivision game with similar gameplay, can you find it?

(P.S. Any decently trained programmer's eyes will burn out if they look at the source. Be careful.)

entries.title: CANDY WORLD DREAM REALM
entries.description:
NOTE: THIS VERSION OF THE GAME HAS NO BACKGROUND MUSIC, BECAUSE I DIDN'T CREATE IT WITHIN THE 48 HOURS. TO GET THE VERSION THAT HAS THE BACKGROUND MUSIC, GO HERE:

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/6478756/Games/LD48/22%20-%20ALONE%20-%20CANDY%20WORLD%20DREAM%20REALM/CANDY%20WORLD%20DREAM%20REALM.exe

Controls: Mouse, Left-click / Z, R to restart. (F4 - Fullscreen, F9 - Screenshot.)

Lacey returns home from the Untrustable Man's deadly dungeon, to dream of a better place.

- Eat all the candy that you can!
- Close your mouth when a poop comes along!
- It breaks Lacey's heart to see something pass her!

My high score: 3029662.

Also:
- Lacey is quite alone, dreaming of a 'better place'.
- Lacey is a girl.

entries.title: Chromboid
entries.description:
Team entry for the jam.

Code: Pekuja
Graphics, level design, writing: Arne
Music: Burnzez

Didn't quite reach our original vision, but it might be interesting to play still.

There's no real ending. You can fall off the world at the end if you like though.

entries.title: Fly Away Home
entries.description:
No KNOWN bugs.
Intro is skippable via Enter.
Really enjoyed making this.
May possibly need some Microsoft C++ Distro. (MAYBE.)
Enjoy :D
Oh, and there ARE kittens.
Try and beat the top high score too! (No editting the highscore table either...)

entries.title: Hikikomori
entries.description: Are you going to get by alone and unnoticed?

entries.title: I Hate Being Delicious
entries.description:
Tested on Windows XP Firefox 8.0 and Chrome 15.0

(Doesn't work in IE 8.0)

Very slow on Firefox

Made in HTML5/javascript, with Jquery and a system for JS inheritance by John Resig. I used Paint.NET for the graphics, the sound effects were created in sxsr, and the music was created using Audacity.

Credits:
Sean Musgrave: Director - Programming - Art - Sound - Design - Writing
Chris Musgrave: Art - Sound - Design - Writing
Annie Prichard: Art - Design
Renee Davis: Art - Sound
Elizabeth Shoemaker Sampat: Testing
Shreyas Sampat: Testing

entries.title: Lone Survivor
entries.description:
This is my terrible entry :P READ THE README! It will only work on Windows unless you have an XNA library for Mono (and even then I'm not sure how stable it will be). Which means you need the XNA framework if you're on Windows (but this is explained in the readme, which is important, so you should read it. Download here for those that need it anyways: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851).

This is my take on the "Alone" theme. I couldn't think of anything to make that seemed cool, so I interpreted it oddly by making a fighter where you fight off waves of enemies all alone.

entries.title: Me and My Shadows
entries.description: Did you have a creepy basement as a kid? Maybe moved into a new scary big house? If so, you know everything you need to play.

entries.title: Midas
entries.description:
A tough puzzle platformer about the true weight of gold.

Design: Harry Lee
Code: Jarrel Seah

Thank you for playing our game!

Regards,

Wanderlands

entries.title: Only You Can Save The World
entries.description:
A puzzle-platformer about a peaceful creature, helpless in its fate at the hands of a monstrous beast

EDIT: fixed major bug with finding libraries, but did not change any of the content. Kind of counts as porting, because it worked fine on windows before then but not on any other OS

entries.title: Painkiller
entries.description:
Well, first Ludum Dare... didn't do too great but its pretty close to the theme, IMO.

It's about being trapped in a mental hospital, all by yourself.

Protip: Actually click on the inmates to stab them.

Blog Post: http://micle2000.tumblr.com/post/14433473060/painkiller

entries.title: Parcel Walk
entries.description:
Parcel Walk is my third entry into the Ludum Dare competition. Talk to people and then use the environment to dispatch them so you can get to the post office.

Play a game where the character wants to be alone so badly, he's willing to hose an elderly woman down the street using a fire hydrant.

Featuring 5 levels of smooth movement, music, sounds, and bonus 'easter-eggs' and 'kitten-challenge' in case you think the game is too short (it probably is!)

Controls:
Arrows, Space: Jump, C/X: Action

entries.title: Quiet City
entries.description:
WASD - Move
Left Mouse Button - Push Enemy
Esc - Menu

entries.title: Rox Gunner and the Cavern of Loneliness
entries.description: This is my first LD48 so don't be too judgey! :P  Anybody who can show me a video of them beating hard mode within the voting time will receive a box of cookies.  You have to hit "enter" to move the text, and to use a gun you have to grab it and switch to it ("1" for the pistol, "2" for the assault rifle etc.) I hope that helps, and  sorry all the trouble.

entries.title: Snow
entries.description:
Visual novel adventure sort of thing. :)

Edit: Windows version is up now.

Apology: I've not fully tested the game yet, so I expect there are a few bugs. :) Sorry! (Particularly, graphical bugs. I played through to completion once, but didn't test all possibilities.)

Enjoy (or wait until I fix the odd bug typo)

entries.title: solo trader
entries.description: You are a trader trying to fatten your wallet in this text based webgame

entries.title: Stand alone
entries.description:
It's a story about an astronaut who found himself all alone in boundless Space. Your goal is to reach your spaceship before it flies away.  

CONTROLS: 

- Hold SPACE for acceleration
- Hold SPACE after getting Nitro for Super-Speed.
- Arrow Keys (left/right, A/D)
- Enter 

Used: Inkscape, freesound.org, sfxr, Monkey, PaintNet

Music: WMRI - Emerald Sky, DJad - Space Exploration

*Note: Game doesn't have a preloader. Please, give it several seconds for loading. 

*Please Also Note: Web version was not optimized well due to lack of time. If you are interested in this game, you'd better download Windows or Swf version itself. Html version works fine in Chrome.



We participate in Ludum Dare for the first time. And it's our first ever game too. We hope you enjoy it. Thank you.

entries.title: Summit
entries.description:
You're caught in a snowstorm on top of a mountain and must survive to base camp without freezing to death. A really simple adventure game experiment. Multiple endings and story paths.

See my journal entries for more info.

entries.title: The Love Letter
entries.description: Move with the mouse, click and hold to read the letter. Don't get caught!

entries.title: Santa's Survival
entries.description: Kill the elves
